* A deep passion for products and product development
* Extensive material knowledge
* Driven, structured, and proactive in taking initiatives
* Salesmanship and results-oriented
* Excellent communication skills
* A strong team player with a flexible attitude
* Ability to identify opportunities, improvements, and efficient solutions


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Additional information:
   

  

 This is a full-time position, with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including
 **CV in English as soon as possible** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  

 Benefits:
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

 Inclusion & Diversity:
   

  

 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Fullstack utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Teknikstack:**
* NET Platform, C#, Entity Framework, Azure, Azure Functions, Angular, Logic Apps och DevOps


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av Angular, .NET, C#, Azure och minst fem års utvecklarerfarenhet.
   

  

 Du är lösningsorienterad, samarbetsvillig och trivs i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Azure pipelines/CI/CD och IAC. Om man har erfarenhet som Lead är det positivt.
   

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 22-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Java Gameplay Engineer
description:
*Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we’re also on a mission* 
*–* 
*to build a better world through the power of play.*
*Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It’s the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.*
 We enable millions to create and play together, connect people across the globe, and foster a community that is among the most active and passionate in the world. Our community is global and incredibly diverse. When we are developing anything within our franchise, we keep this in mind. We want everyone to not only feel included in Minecraft, but also to see themselves in what we make. Our goal is for the Mojang Studios team to be as diverse as our community. Minecraft is a sandbox game that should be around for a lifetime. Minecraft runs on two platforms today, the Java platform and the Bedrock platform.
   

  

**What you’ll get**
 You'll join a cross-functional team and work closely with the other engineers, designers, artists, all working together on a game enjoyed by over 100,000,000 players worldwide. We have big dreams for the future of Minecraft and need you to help make them happen.
   

  

 By joining the gameplay team, you will find an environment that enables you to leverage your knowledge and values to maintain and evolve a healthy and collaborative culture as we grow.
   

  

  

  

**As a Senior Game Engineer in the Minecraft team you will:**
* Drive technical solutions discussions, implement, test and iterate on new as well as existing Gameplay systems and features for upcoming Minecraft updates.
* Be involved in design discussions related to the core Minecraft experience and helping to define the direction of future updates
* With the team, own the quality and help to refine the quality process
* Be a part of a highly collaborative cross-functional team consisting of Java and C++ engineers, game designers, QA and artists.
* Support the team by ensuring sustainable development processes and workflows
* Lead by example and mentor other engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team environment
* Provide technical leadership during code reviews across teams, understand the root cause of the issues, and find ways to resolve them


**We believe you are someone that has:**
* Excellent teamwork skills and an eagerness to reach goals in a collaborative manner
* Solid experience with Java programming or Java game development
* Experience in modern C++
* Experience and a strong drive in helping to design gameplay and its underlying systems and implementing quality-focused technical solutions to make those systems work
* Solid knowledge of engineering practices
* The ability to work with large cross-platform codebases and legacy code
* Passion for learning and sharing knowledge with your team and the organisation
* Strong communication and leadership skills
* You are knowledgeable and passionate about games


 For this role, we will consider fit for the team and company holistically. Meaning that we'll put a great emphasis on your interpersonal skills.
   

  

**About this role:**
 This is a full-time role based in Stockholm with a hybrid remote working model. You'll collaborate with our studio colleagues in Redmond, USA, and across various disciplines. This position sometimes has off hour meetings mainly with West coast USA representatives. Please note that we are only able to consider applications from candidates currently residing within Sweden.
   

  

**Mojang Studios**
*Mojang Studios is a Microsoft-owned game developer. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We’re always working on new and exciting ways to expand the Minecraft universe.*
*Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.*
*We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we’re also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.*
*To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by Söder Mälarstrand, it’s filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.*
*But in the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!*
***Important note on resumes**
 Please make sure that
 **all** 
 the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we’d hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!*

title: Back End Developer
description:
*Do you want to play a key role in building the digital backbone of the Nordics? At GlobalConnect, we are looking for a Backend Developer to join our Content Delivery Network team in Stockholm. You will be part of a dedicated group that delivers video and content distribution services to millions of people across Denmark, Norway, Finland, and Sweden.* 




  





**About The Role** 




 As a Backend Developer in our Video Streaming & Content Delivery team, you will design, develop, and implement solutions that support large-scale video and radio distribution. You will work in an agile team with experienced colleagues, close to stakeholders across development, operations, and customer support. The role combines technical depth with real customer impact, ensuring reliability, scalability, and efficiency in systems that matter.
 



  





 While our focus is on Content Delivery Network and video streaming technologies, you do not need previous experience in this field. If you bring solid backend development skills and curiosity, we will help you grow into the domain.
 



  





**Why this matters?** 




 GlobalConnect is the digital backbone of society in the Nordics and northern Germany. Our CDN & Origin services enable leading broadcasters, media houses, and partners to distribute content on a scale. By joining us, you will help safeguard connectivity and deliver streaming experiences that millions of people rely on every day.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain backend systems for video and radio encoding, packaging, and distribution
* Contribute to the design and scaling of GlobalConnect’s CDN and origin services
* Collaborate closely with other development teams, network and datacenter colleagues, and support functions
* Troubleshoot, optimize, and maintain services in production
* Work in an agile setup with freedom under responsibility



  





**What You Need To Succeed** 



* Minimum 3 years of experience as a backend developer (Java preferred)
* Knowledge of distributed systems and network protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP)
* Skills in at least one systems-oriented programming language (C, C++)
* Solid knowledge of GNU/Linux, including configuration and troubleshooting



  





**Good to have** 



* Experience with big data (Hadoop ecosystem or similar), SQL/NoSQL databases, streaming protocols (HLS, DASH, SRT/MPEG-TS, RTMP), CI/CD, load testing, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, or automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
* Swedish language skills are a plus.



  





**The team and why GlobalConnect** 




 You will join a team of 16 specialists, including five developers, who have worked together for many years. The team values collaboration, autonomy, and close customer relationships. We are proud to serve more than 120 customers, including some of the most recognized media companies in the Nordics. At Globalconnect, you will experience a culture of trust, learning, and proactivity.
 



  





**Process** 




 We review applications continuously. A CV is enough; a cover letter is not required unless you want to highlight something not covered in your CV or LinkedIn.
 



  





**Join us** 




 If you want to help shape the digital backbone of the Nordics and work with systems that truly matter, we look forward to your application.
 



  





**About Us** 




 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
 



  





 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Senior .Net Fullstack Developer
description:
At NOBA, we’re all about collaboration, curiosity, and tackling tech challenges together. As part of our skilled dev team, you’ll dive into both backend and frontend work, solving problems with people who genuinely enjoy building great things.
   

  

 We’re forming a brand-new development team in Stockholm and are looking for two
 **Senior .Net Fullstack Developers** 
 to join us. We aim to bring together people with varied backgrounds and experiences, united by a passion for solving tech challenges and building great digital solutions!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You’ll have the chance to work across the full stack, developing new web services, improving system usability, and maintaining existing solutions. You will be trusted in designing, building and implementing modern web services for internal and external users.
   

  

 We’re big on continuous learning and knowledge-sharing - plus, we believe in a healthy work-life balance, giving you time to recharge and pursue your passions outside of work. Join a team of friendly and highly skilled developers, based in the central of Stockholm.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop web applications with a focus on great user experiences
* Build internal tools that make life easier for your colleagues
* Lead the full lifecycle of projects, from concept to delivery
* Integrate third-party solutions
* Collaborate closely with fellow developers in an Agile environment.


**We Are Looking For You Who**
 Are a problem solver who’s not afraid to push beyond the comfort zone and try new things. Strong communication and teamwork are essential, and we’re after someone who isn’t shy about sharing their ideas. You’ll need:
   

  

* 5+ years of software development experience
* 3+ years in web development with C#/.Net/.NetCore
* 3+ years working with React or similar JavaScript frameworks
* Experience designing complex solutions with a focus on logical design
* Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodologies
* Experience with relational and document databases
* Fluency in English (written and spoken)


**It's Positive If You Have**
* Experience with Azure or other public cloud platforms
* Fluency in Swedish


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values:
 **we are wholehearted** 
 ,
 **we collaborate** 
 and
 **we take the lead** 
 .
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page
   

  

  

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Join our highly skilled team of developers — breaking new ground and shaping the future of retail.** 




  





**We dare to dream big, we have the courage to keep raising the bar, and we’re committed to being a force for good in retail - helping both established and fast-growing brands meet the ever-changing expectations of their customers.** 




  





**Sitoo is a fast-growing technology company exploring how far we can take innovation to deliver the world’s best Unified Commerce Platform and Point of Sale. Our technology is used in more than 20 countries - a number that keeps growing thanks to our incredible team of engineers. And we have no intention of slowing down. Are you the Senior Software Engineer we’re looking for?** 




  





**Your mission at Sitoo** 




  





 Be part of a small, agile team that designs, builds, and owns products from concept to launch. You’ll collaborate to solve real customer problems using smart technology choices. If you know your way around AWS, Node.js, and TypeScript, you’ll fit right in.
 



  





**What you'll do** 




  




* Design and build cloud‑native services on AWS
* Create self‑service capabilities for customers and internal users
* Implement secure identity and access management
* Own services across the full lifecycle with your team
* Participate in on‑call rotation



  





**What you’ll bring to the table** 




  




* Product mindset with ownership across the service lifecycle
* Experience building scalable, reliable cloud services
* Understanding of serverless and container-based concepts and patterns
* Collaborative mindset who shares knowledge
* Clear communication and high agency



  





**Why Sitoo** 




  





 We are forward thinkers. By turning curiosity into knowledge — and knowledge into continuous improvement — we break new ground and shape the future of retail.
 



  





 We believe in an inclusive culture where everyone feels like they belong. We support each other, win together, celebrate success together, and overcome challenges together.
 



  





 Today, we are close to 100 dedicated experts with a positive and solution-oriented mindset. Most importantly, we take care of each other, and we never forget to have fun.

title: Customer Success Engineer - Experimentation Platform
description:
Interested in driving Spotify’s experimentation philosophy across the company while being the first line of support for our platform? Spotify’s Confidence team is looking for a Customer Success Engineer who will serve our internal customers —more than 300 product and platform teams— combining technical depth, business acumen, and strong interpersonal skills to provide strategic guidance and automate problem‑solving.
   

  

 We’re seeking a versatile engineer skilled in backend development, SDK development, and customer interaction. Your primary responsibility will be to provide first‑response support to internal Spotify teams using Confidence, our experimentation platform, and to build and maintain strong relationships that ensure their success and satisfaction. Join a high-paced, startup-like team of engineers, designers, data scientists and product managers to drive the adoption, reliability, and effectiveness of our experimentation platform across Spotify. While the role is internal‑facing, Confidence is being built as a product that can serve other businesses; you’ll help shape reusable, productizable solutions. We operate with a startup mindset inside Spotify—expect ambiguity, shifting priorities, and broad ownership.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Nurture strong relationships with our internal customers (Spotify teams) by providing the support, information and training needed to achieve their desired outcomes.
* Monitor and respond to internal support channels for Confidence across 300+ teams, alongside a data science counterpart. Triage and solve issues, raising bugs and complex issues to appropriate teams.
* Own first-line triage for incidents impacting Confidence users at Spotify and coordinate with engineering for timely resolution.
* Independently resolve most incoming issues using common debugging approaches (e.g., writing queries, reading and interpreting GCP logs, and performing basic code-level investigation).
* Group and synthesize recurring inquiries/issues to advocate for deeper, longer‑term remediation.
* Propose and drive tooling and automation that reduces support cost and improves developer experience.
* Contribute small improvements to SDKs, samples, or docs when it unblocks teams.
* Identify points of friction in the onboarding and adoption experience.
* Represent the voice of the internal customer and influence the product roadmap to ensure customer satisfaction.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have an understanding of how developers work, and experienced with modern infrastructure - preferably within an enterprise environment.
* You have experience with experimentation (A/B testing), or a strong interest to learn quickly; comfortable with experiment design, metrics, guardrails, and interpreting results in production at a practical level.
* You have the ability to debug issues independently by reading Java code, understanding GCP logs, and writing queries.
* You are familiar with modern data warehouses and analytics stacks (e.g., Databricks, BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift).
* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing customer issues.
* You have excellent written and verbal communicator; calm under pressure and able to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical users.
* Hands-on experience working with experimentation platforms is a plus!


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: 5G Baseband L1 Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 When joining at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.
   

  

 Together with your team you will be responsible from pre-study to customer acceptance for new functionality, together with maintenance of current products. The team systemizes, designs and tests the software and takes joint responsibility for all team tasks.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Your focus will be in Physical layer (L1) parts of the Baseband SW, vital building blocks in our market leading 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) solution and in future within 6G. Together with your fellow baseband SW developers, you will:
   

  

* Build outstanding baseband software using C, Python.
* Participate in the study, implementation, and verification of new 5G features and, in the near future, within 6G.
* Work in a multi-functional, multi-cultural environment with supportive teammates.


**The Skills You Will Bring**
* A Master of Science degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communication, Electrical or Electronic Engineering or equivalent.
* 2 - 6 years of industry experience, preferably within telecom or similar industry working with embedded software development.
* Curiosity, desire, and skills to be a great embedded software developer with a special interest in the C programming language for real time systems.
* Knowledge and experience in 5G and 4G wireless communication e.g. 3GPP specifications.
* Experience with signal processing, RF or air interface measurements, multi-core DSP processor programming in areal-time environment and design patterns in an embedded environment.
* A forward-thinking, hardworking, and creative personality. We love extraordinary teammates who enjoy a fast-paced work environment and adopts challenge.
* Dedication and a genuine interest in the latest technology trends and a passion to solve complex problems no one else has solved before.


 You have an open mind and like to take on new challenges to continuously improve, and to work outside your own field to broaden your competence and get a deeper understanding of our products.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774706

title: C++ Developer
description:
HiQ samarbetar idag med teknikintensiva kunder i framkant som produktbolag inom industrin, försvar och autonoma fordon. Det kan handla om förarlösa tåg eller elektrifierade tunga lastbilar samt sensor och navigationssystem för både båtar och flyg. Vi är involverade i utvecklingen av både komponenterna i fordonen och de som finns vid sidan av dem. En del av projekten har en internationell omfattning med hög säkerhetsklassning.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som gillar att grotta ner dig i komplexa problem. Vi tror att det är bäst för helheten i projektet om du är trygg i din kompetens och har några års erfarenhet med dig in i rollen.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Högskole-/Civilingenjörsexamen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C++.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Möjlighet att jobba på plats på kontoret 3-5 dagar i veckan.
* Erfarenhet eller intresse för industribranschen.


**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Software Application Engineer within Railway Signaling
description:
Are you interested in working with advanced signaling systems and contributing to the development of railway technology? As a Software Application Engineer at our client, you will have the opportunity to develop and configure software for specialized railway signaling systems.
   

  

 By working closely with system engineers and project teams, you will directly contribute to reliable solutions used in both Swedish and international railway networks.
   

  

**Working as a Software Application Engineer**
 A Software Application Engineer working within Signaling System Specific Application team plays a key role in developing and configuring software that ensures safe and efficient train operations. They work with specialized railway signaling systems that communicate with trains to control speed, movement, and track usage.
   

  

 This role involves adapting and integrating software to meet the unique requirements of each railway project, often in close collaboration with system engineers and project teams. The engineer also performs testing, validation, and troubleshooting to ensure the software functions reliably in real-world conditions. Their work directly contributes to the safety and performance of rail networks in Sweden and across the globe.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design basis documents corresponds
* Design basis products corresponds to Generic Products and Generic Application which includes both SW as well as process descriptions, instructions and application information detailing how to execute.
* Create and deliver specific application software configuration and documentation in accordance with applicable internal procedures for Configuration and Change Management to secure quality and safety.


**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent specialize in giving young tech talents the ultimate start in their careers. For this role, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but work at our customers site. You will be coached by a a consultant manager at Nexer Tech Talent. As a consultant, you will be well taken care of. We often invite our consultants to group activities such as lectures, after works and lunch meetings.
   

  

**Desired qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related field, or equivalent work experience. A degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Railway Engineering is considered a plus.
* Relevant experience required in a similar role or railway signalling knowledge.
* Safety and system related engineering experience.
* Experience of development according to safety standards such as CENELEC (EN50126, EN50128, EN50129) or equivalent.
* Computer knowledge for example installation of operating systems, drivers and network configuration.
* Relevant experience working with requirements, specifications and documentation of complex technical systems.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Application**
 Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter Lema Naderi at lema.naderi@nexergroup.com We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
**Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here.**

title: Software Application Engineer within Railway Signaling
description:
Are you interested in working with advanced signaling systems and contributing to the development of railway technology? As a Software Application Engineer at our client, you will have the opportunity to develop and configure software for specialized railway signaling systems.
   

  

 By working closely with system engineers and project teams, you will directly contribute to reliable solutions used in both Swedish and international railway networks.
   

  

**Working as a Software Application Engineer**
 A Software Application Engineer working within Signaling System Specific Application team plays a key role in developing and configuring software that ensures safe and efficient train operations. They work with specialized railway signaling systems that communicate with trains to control speed, movement, and track usage.
   

  

 This role involves adapting and integrating software to meet the unique requirements of each railway project, often in close collaboration with system engineers and project teams. The engineer also performs testing, validation, and troubleshooting to ensure the software functions reliably in real-world conditions. Their work directly contributes to the safety and performance of rail networks in Sweden and across the globe.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design basis documents corresponds
* Design basis products corresponds to Generic Products and Generic Application which includes both SW as well as process descriptions, instructions and application information detailing how to execute.
* Create and deliver specific application software configuration and documentation in accordance with applicable internal procedures for Configuration and Change Management to secure quality and safety.


**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent specialize in giving young tech talents the ultimate start in their careers. For this role, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but work at our customers site. You will be coached by a a consultant manager at Nexer Tech Talent. As a consultant, you will be well taken care of. We often invite our consultants to group activities such as lectures, after works and lunch meetings.
   

  

**Desired qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related field, or equivalent work experience. A degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Railway Engineering is considered a plus.
* Relevant experience required in a similar role or railway signalling knowledge.
* Safety and system related engineering experience.
* Experience of development according to safety standards such as CENELEC (EN50126, EN50128, EN50129) or equivalent.
* Computer knowledge for example installation of operating systems, drivers and network configuration.
* Relevant experience working with requirements, specifications and documentation of complex technical systems.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Application**
 Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter Lema Naderi at lema.naderi@nexergroup.com We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
**Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here.**

title: Quant Risk Developer within Financial Risk
description:
Are you passionate about risk management, financial engineering and IT?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Join the exciting journey of our Financial Risk Value Stream that is responsible for strategic development and maintenance of Swedbank´s Market and Counterparty Risk solutions.
* Work cross functional with financial mathematics and IT development.
* Lead implementation of risk systems and databases, practice your data modelling and SQL skills.
* Analyse, troubleshoot and validate our risk calculations.
* Take own initiatives to continuous improvements and drive change.
* Collaborate with software engineers, analysts, model quants, architects and product owners for successful improvements, automatization, risk modelling as well as system & functional enhancements.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Self-driven, proactive, and curious personality.
* Analytical, structured, with excellent problem-solving skills.
* A personal drive to pitch in and solve a wide range of simple and complex problems.
* Knowledge about modelling of financial markets and instruments.
* Experience in script programming, such as Python, Shell, Java or C#.
* Minimum 3 years’ experience within financial risk or quantitative finance.
* Proficient in oral and written English with excellent communication skills.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field, such as financial mathematics, data science or similar.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 become a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects. Work cross functional with quantitative finance, IT and analysis, building next generation risk system. I expect ambition, proficiency, and self-leadership from the team, equally I strongly support a healthy work/life balance. We are always open to new ideas and innovations helping us to improve.”
 **Fredrik Andersson,** 
**your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 2025-10-15.
   

  

**Location:Stockholm, Sundbyberg**
**Recruiting manager: Fredrik Andersson**
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Senior Software Engineer - Play & Control
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for an experienced backend engineer with a strong background in functional programming, for our Play & Control team.
   

  

 You will play a key part in evolving and deploying our next-generation playback system, the backbone that ensures music plays seamlessly across platforms, devices, and integrations.
   

  

 The team owns the playback experience across all of our platforms. We make the music flow, from the cloud to speakers, through our apps and partner integrations. Our technology powers playback for mobile and desktop clients, our own hardware, and various connected devices through SDKs and APIs. Everyone in the team works across the stack, to ensure a smooth and stable music experience everywhere.
   

  

 You will be joining at an exciting time, our new playback architecture is being rolled out, and you’ll play a central role in shaping how it operates across all platforms.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Design, build, and refine backend services that power music playback across diverse clients and environments
* Contribute to the rollout of our next-generation playback control architecture
* Collaborate with our partners (e.g., Sonos and other integrations)
* Develop our cloud-based audio streaming platform
* Ensure scalability, reliability, and performance in a distributed environment
* Influence a technical direction for systems written in Scala, Go, Rust, and C++


**About You**
 Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ year of professional experience
* Solid experience with functional programming principles (preferably with Scala)
* Ability to design and implement scalable, cloud-native applications
* Professional experience with one or more of the following: Scala, Go, Rust, C++
* Experience deploying and managing applications in Kubernetes (preferably on Google Cloud, but not the main focus)
* A minset to care about deployment, monitoring, and operational stability of your services


**Beneficial**
* Experience in audio streaming, IoT, or hardware-integrated products
* Interest in music technology and playback systems


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Oskar Thorin at oskar@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Cloud Software Developer (Go)
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for a highly skilled Cloud Software Developer (Go) to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design and develop secure cloud-based services
* Integrate designs with larger software systems
* Co-work with cloud architects, backend, and frontend developers


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience with Golang is required
* Highlty proficient in developing AWS cloud services
* Proficient with relational and document based databases
* Experience with developing RESTful and MQTT API
* Experience with Git/GitHub
* Experience with Linux and Docker environments
* Ability to work independently
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Familiarity with Java development
* Basic knowledge of WebRTC and WebSockets
* A solid understanding of networking protocols and architecture
* Experience with SD-WAN and/or VPN technologies
* Familiarity with the Agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: AI Software Engineer/Platform Architect - BCG X
description:
**Locations** 
 : Stockholm | Copenhagen V | Berlin | München | London
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

**We Are BCG X**
 We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.
   

  

 As a (Senior) AI Software Engineer you’ll be part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.
   

  

 We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
   

  

* +4 years of experience in a technology consulting environment
* Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
* Actively involved in every part of the software development life cycle
* Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
* Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
* Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
* Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
* A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
* Master's degree or PhD in relevant field of study - please provide all academic certificates showing the final grades (A-level, Bachelor, Master, PhD)


**Additional Tasks**
* Designing and building data & AI platforms for our clients.
* Such platforms provide data and (Gen)AI capabilities to a wide variety of consumers and use cases across the client organization.
* Often part of large (AI) transformational journeys BCG does for its clients.
* Often involves the following engineering disciplines:
+ Cloud Engineering
+ Data Engineering (not building pipelines but designing and building the framework)
+ DevOps
+ MLOps/LLMOps
+ ...

* Often work with the following technologies:
+ Azure, AWS, GCP
+ Airflow, dbt, Databricks, Snowflake, etc.
+ GitHub, Azure DevOps and related developer tooling and CI/CD platforms, Terraform or other Infra-as-Code
+ MLflow, AzureML or similar for MLOps; LangSmith, Langfuse and similar for LLMOps
+ ...


*The difference to our "AI Engineer" role is: Do you "use/consume" these technologies, or are you the one that "provides" them to the rest of the organization.*
 What You'll Bring
   

  

**Technologies**
 Programming Languages: Python
   

  

**Experience With Additional Programming Languages Is a Plus**
 Additional info
   

  

 BCG offers a comprehensive benefits program, including medical, dental and vision coverage, telemedicine services, life, accident and disability insurance, parental leave and family planning benefits, caregiving resources, mental health offerings, a generous retirement program, financial guidance, paid time off, and more.
   

  

 #BCGXjob
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: App Developer
description:
App Developer — Sweden — Immediate Start
 
  





**Type:** 
 Full‑time contract - 3 months (open to contract‑to‑hire)
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden (Stockholm/Malmö ideal; remote within Sweden OK)
 



**Start date:** 
**ASAP** 
 — we can onboard this week
 



 Flutter Developer (iOS and Android)
   




 What we’re building
 
 Juice lets a driver pull in, charge or fuel, park or wash—and just leave. No kiosk, no app taps at the pump, no tags. Your app will be the simple front door for drivers: register a vehicle, add a wallet, see activity, resolve issues, and get on with the day.
 



  





 We’re accelerating local deployments and need someone
 **hands‑on in Sweden** 
 to build, ship, and iterate the driver app quickly. You’ll sit close to operations and integrations, which means faster go‑lives and better product fit.
   




 What you’ll do
 * Build the first public versions of our driver app and ship updates weekly.
* Implement
 **secure wallet & payment flows** 
 (card tokenization, receipts, refunds).
* Integrate with our APIs for
 **vehicle identity** 
 , site eligibility, and session status.
* Set up
 **TestFlight / Play Console** 
 tracks, crash reporting, analytics, and push.
* Work with a solutions engineer on pilots: from sandbox → first site live → rollout.
* Keep quality high without slowing down: practical tests, CI/CD, and code reviews.


 You’ll be great at this if…
 * You’ve
 **shipped** 
 apps (personal projects or production) and can show what you built.
* You’re
 **an experienced Flutter Mobile App Developer** 
 .
* You’re comfortable wiring up REST/GraphQL APIs, OAuth2/OIDC sign‑in, and payments.
* You like small teams, clear goals, and taking a feature from idea to customers in days.
* You communicate clearly in English; Swedish is a plus but not required.



**Nice to have:** 
 marketplace/mobility/fintech experience; SDK or partner integrations; basic data‑privacy instincts.
   




 What success looks like in your first 90 days
 * MVP live to internal testers in week 2–3; first
 **pilot users** 
 in week 4–6.
* **Two** 
 integrations supported in parallel with our solutions engineer.
* **>95% crash‑free sessions** 
 , instrumented analytics, and clear release cadence.


 Hiring process
 1. 25–30 min intro call
2. 60 min technical chat (system design + code walkthrough of something you’ve shipped)
3. Short, time‑boxed take‑home project (or a code review of your own repo)
4. Meet the team → references → offer

title: SQL-utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som SQL-utvecklare**
 Här blir du en del av ett team på 11 drivna kollegor – SQL- och .Net-utvecklare, testare, mjukvaruarkitekt, systemansvarig, product owner och teamcoach – som tillsammans bygger smarta lösningar för att ge våra kunder den bästa möjliga upplevelsen. Vi arbetar nära både IT och verksamheten och ser till att rätt data finns på rätt plats i rätt tid.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
* Utveckla och förvalta effektiva lösningar för datainsamling och kundkommunikation.
* Vara en nyckelspelare i hela kedjan – från databas till verksamheten som jobbar med datan.
* Arbeta i en hybridmiljö med balans mellan kontoret på Kungsholmen och distansarbete.


**För att lyckas i rollen**
* Några års erfarenhet av MSSQL och stora databaser.
* Vana vid SSIS-projekt, integrationer och datatransformering.
* Stor erfarenhet av T-sql och skriva Stored Procedures.
* Kommunikativ, prestigelös och en lagspelare med eget driv.
* Flytande svenska, både i tal och skrift.


 Hos oss får du inte bara möjlighet att växa i din roll – du får också vara med och skapa långsiktigt värde för våra kunder och samhället.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Fredrik Othberg på mailadress: fredrik.othberg@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Fullstackutvecklare till Digitala personalsäkerhetssystem (DIPSS), utveckla framtidens säkerhetslösningar!** 




  





 Vill du arbeta i ett mindre, dynamiskt team där du får vara med och påverka produkt, teknik och arbetssätt från grunden?
 



 Vi på DIPSS söker nu en driven Fullstackutvecklare med starka kunskaper i C#, .NET och JavaScript samt vana att arbeta agilt. Här får du vara med och bygga nästa generation av säkerhetslösningar för några av Sveriges mest betydelsefulla kunder.
 



  





**Om DIPSS** 




 DIPSS är ett produktbolag med fokus på systemstöd inom säkerhetsbranschen vilket ställer höga krav på säkerhet, tillförlitlighet och kvalitet. Vi är ett litet bolag men med starkt stöd och engagemang från våra ägare. Nu söker vi förstärkning till vårt utvecklingsteam för att vidareutveckla vår produkt.
 




  





**Rollen** 




 Som Fullstackutvecklare blir du en nyckelperson i vårt utvecklingsteam. Du kommer arbeta nära både produkt och kund, med stort utrymme att påverka tekniska val och arbetssätt framåt.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 



* Utveckla både frontend (JavaScript-baserat ramverk) och backend (C#, .NET).
* Versionshantering och kravhantering i GitHub.
* Bidra vid implementation av lösningen hos kunder.
* Delta i support och felsökning för kunder.
* Vara med och bolla kring design och utvecklingsinriktning för produkten framåt.
* Bidra med idéer kring hur teamet arbetar, idag jobbar vi enligt en light scrum-modell och anpassar den löpande.



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare. Du är driven, kreativ, självgående och nyfiken på ny teknik samt trivs i miljöer där du får ta stort ansvar. Har du erfarenhet av produktbolag eller säker utveckling är det ett extra plus. Om du ser dig som backend-utvecklare men vill lära dig och arbeta mer med frontend är det också välkommet, det viktiga är att du har tyngden på backend.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har** 



* Goda kunskaper i C#, .NET, JavaScript och åtminstone baskunskaper inom SQL.
* Förståelse för säkerhet och säker utveckling, från tidigare projekt eller genom starkt säkerhetstänk.



  





 Meriterande
 


* Tidigare arbete på produktbolag eller erfarenhet av paketering och patchning av färdiga produkter.
* Erfarenhet av domändriven design (DDD).



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* En unik möjlighet att vara med och bygga en produkt som gör verklig skillnad för samhällskritiska verksamheter.
* En arbetsplats med startup-känsla, där du får stor påverkan på teknik, processer och produktutveckling.
* Flexibel hybridmodell. Stor möjlighet att jobba mycket på distans.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön.
* Ett sammansvetsat team där du arbetar nära kompetenta kollegor i en platt organisation.
* Tillsvidareanställning.



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: AI-utvecklare med arkitekttänk
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Vara en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av våra AI-lösningar – från kod till arkitektur
* Bygga lösningar i AWS-miljö men också intilliggande on-prem lösningar byggda i Java / Typescript / Python
* Bidra till vägval kring arkitektur, skalbarhet och kvalitet


 Att jobba som AI-utvecklare
   

  

 Vi står mitt i ett spännande teknikskifte där AI spelar en avgörande roll i hur vi bygger framtidens digitala tjänster. Nu behöver vi stärka teamet med en erfaren utvecklare med arkitekttänk som tidigare byggt, produktionssatt och förvaltat AI-lösningar. Här får du vara med och föra ett av våra viktigaste AI-initiativ framåt och vara med på en resa i vårt skapande av en AI-assistent byggd på information från SBAB och även Booli för att skapa en helt unik tjänst.
   

  

 Vad du kommer göra:
   

  

* Vara en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av våra AI-lösningar – från kod till arkitektur.
* Arbeta med generativa modeller, prompt engineering, integrationer, vektordatabaser och utvärderingsmetoder.
* Bygga lösningar i AWS-miljö (exempelvis med Bedrock och andra tjänster) men också intilliggande on-prem lösningar byggda i Java / Typescript / Python.
* Bidra till vägval kring arkitektur, skalbarhet och kvalitet.
* Jobba nära andra utvecklare, produktägare och specialister i ett tvärfunktionellt team.


 Vi tror att du har flera års erfarenhet som utvecklare och varit med på en liknande AI-resa i en större organisation. Vidare har du god erfarenhet av att bygga och drifta lösningar i AWS eller liknande. Du har också en ödmjuk inställning till det ansvar som kommer med att jobba med AI och personuppgifter.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och bygga ett prioriterat initiativ som ständigt utvecklas. Du får ta ansvar och påverka tekniken, strukturen och den fortsatta riktningen framåt. Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med ett kunnigt, nyfiket och prestigelöst team där din kompetens blir ett värdefullt komplement. Vi erbjuder en miljö som förenar innovationslust med respekt för regler och riktlinjer, samt flexibla arbetssätt och en kultur som värdesätter balans, lärande och framdrift.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Kommunikativ
* Kvalitetsmedveten
* Lagspelare
* Nyfiken
* Prestigelös


 Annars då?

title: C++ Utvecklare
description:
**Om uppdraget** 




 Rollen hos vår kund innebär att du utvecklar och underhåller applikationer som bidrar till ökad hälsa för djur med fokus på effektivitet och kvalitet inom produktionen. Hos vår kund kombineras avancerad teknik med praktisk nytta där du som konsult ingår ett dedikerat och kreativt team med helhetsansvar, från idé till färdig produkt.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Utveckla och underhålla datorseendeapplikationer för kundens industri inom produktion för djurhälsa.
* Delta innovationsprojekt
* Utvärdera och implementera nya teknologier och verktyg inom computer vision
* Bidra till att utveckla och förfina kundens arbetssätt med visionteknik



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Civilingenjörsexamen i teknisk fysik, datateknik eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av produktutveckling inom industriella företag
* Goda kunskaper i
 **C++** 
 och
 **OpenCV**
* Erfarenhet av datorseende, gärna både traditionell och modellbaserad bildbehandling
* Kunskap om kameror, optik och belysning för datorseende
* Förmåga att kommunicera på svenska



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av inbyggda system
* Erfarenhet av robotapplikationer
* Intresse för maskininlärning eller AI-baserad bildanalys



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 



* Samarbetsinriktad och prestigelös
* Trivs i en agil miljö med små team
* Nyfiken, kreativ och lösningsorienterad
* Inte rädd för att kavla upp ärmarna och besöka en ladugård då och då



  





**Varför uppdraget är spännande** 



* Du får arbeta med avancerad visionteknik som används direkt i verkliga miljöer
* Du blir en del av ett team som kombinerar innovation, teknik och praktisk nytta
* Du bidrar till en mer hållbar och effektiv mejeriindustri
* Du får frihet att utforska nya idéer och teknologier i en entreprenöriell miljö



  





**Övrig information** 




**Plats:** 
 Söder om Stockholm
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  





**Anställningsform:** 
 Konsultuppdrag via
 **@Akkodis** 
 , hos vår kund.
 



  





**Låter detta intressant?** 
 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, urval sker löpande!
 



 För frågor, kontakta ansvarig Business Manager: Joanna Nyström på joanna.nystrom@akkodisgroup.com
 



  





**Om Akkodis** 




 På Akkodis strävar vi ständigt efter att hjälpa våra kunder och konsulter att bli framgångsrika. Som konsult är du vår högsta prioritet och när du behöver oss kommer vi att vara där för dig. När det kommer till din karriär så är det du som styr, vi litar på dina beslut och stöttar dig för att du ska nå dina ambitioner. Dina synpunkter värdesätts och för att hålla oss i framkant är du aktiv i Akkodis affärsutveckling och tillsammans skapar vi erbjudanden till marknaden.
 



  





 Genom att bli vår kollega kommer du öka möjligheterna för att din vardag varierar med uppdrag i olika projekt i diverse branscher, system och miljöer. Din erfarenhetsbank kommer att växa liksom ditt sociala och professionella kontaktnät. Som konsult omfattas du av kollektivavtal, försäkringar, företagshälsovård, friskvårdsbidrag och rabatter på träningskort. För att vi ska få ut mer av varandra ordnar vi regelbundet med sociala aktiviteter.
 



  





 Akkodis levererar en bred bas av tjänster och kompetenser inom IT, Engineering och Life Science. Våra tjänster präglas av snabbhet, enkelhet och kvalitet. Akkodis finns representerade i USA, Kanada, Europa, Asien med över 100 kontor och med mer än 50 000 kollegor i uppdrag varje dag.
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Till HiQ söker vi nu erfarna Fullstack-utvecklare som vill vara med och skapa innovativa och användarvänliga lösningar för våra kunder. I rollen kommer du fokusera på backend-utveckling och bidra till projekt som gör skillnad för samhället. Du blir en viktig del av ett kompetent team där ni tillsammans hanterar utvecklingen av framtidens digitala tjänster.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som Fullstack-utvecklare kommer du främst att arbeta med backend-utveckling, men även ha möjlighet att bidra med frontend-kompetens när det behövs. Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Backend: Java (Spring, Spring Boot) eller .NET/C#
* Frontend: Javascript/Typescript (React.js, Vue.js eller Angular)
* Molnlösningar: AWS, GCP eller Azure


 Du kommer att delta i hela utvecklingsprocessen från design och utveckling till test och driftsättning, samt bidra med tekniskt innovativa lösningar.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling
* Ingenjörsexamen i datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Svenskt medborgarskap och är flytande i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes och CI/CD-pipelines
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, GCP)


**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Utmanande uppdrag både ute i våra kunders organisationer samt i vår egen regi, där HiQ har helhetsansvar för projekten.
* Möjlighet att delta i och leda utvecklingen av våra kunders framtida tjänster som förenklar människors vardag
* Kunniga kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sina kunskaper och erfarenheter
* En kreativ arbetsmiljö med möjlighet att utvecklas som människa, kollega och bli bättre på det du redan är bäst på!
* Du blir en del av ett värderingsstyrt bolag som värdesätter glädje och gemenskap och hittar på mycket roligt tillsammans.


**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå urvalsfrågor, intervjuer, tekniska tester, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Senior Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Uppdragsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som Senior Fullstack-utvecklare blir du en del av ett agilt team inom Business Support-enheten hos ett ledande nordiskt försäkringsbolag. Du bidrar till utveckling och förvaltning av interna lösningar som stödjer verksamheten – inom områden som intern kommunikation, catering och internrevision. Rollen kräver både bredd och djup, där din förmåga att hitta lösningar och arbeta med olika teknologier blir central.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Samarbeta nära med produktägare, slutanvändare och andra intressenter
* Skriva, testa och kvalitetssäkra kod – inklusive manuella- och automatiserade tester
* Stötta manuella systemtester vid behov


**Om teamet**
 Du blir del av ett team på 3–10 personer arbetar tillsammans för att leverera smarta, hållbara och högkvalitativa lösningar. Här värdesätts samarbete, innovation och kontinuerligt lärande. Med tydliga värderingar som grund skapas en inkluderande och stödjande miljö där varje medarbetares kompetens tas tillvara.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Du trivs i samarbete med andra, brinner för kvalitet och uppskattar en dynamisk vardag. Du är proaktiv, flexibel och har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Gedigen teknisk erfarenhet av Angular, .NET-plattformen, C#, Entity Framework, Azure, Azure Functions, Logic Apps och DevOps
* Relevant utbildning på högskole-/universitetsnivå eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av Azure pipelines/CI/CD och Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Tidigare erfarenhet som Lead Developer


 Övrigt
   

  

* Uppdragsperiod: omgående start med en längd på 6 månader med option på förlängning.
* Omfattning: 100%


**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: LIA Praktik hos Omexom inom IT, elkraft & järnväg, Vårtermin 2026
description:
**LIA Praktik hos Omexom inom IT, el & järnväg** 
**, Vårtermin 2026**
 Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens elnät? Som en LIA praktikant på Omexom bidrar du till en säker och stabil elförsörjning samtidigt som du är en viktig del av energiomställningen. Hos oss får du chansen att utvecklas i en spännande bransch och arbeta med erfarna kollegor.
   

  

 Nu öppnar vi ansökan till LIA för studenter på yrkeshögskolor som studerar till IT, elkraft och järnväg. Ansökan om praktikplats görs via annonsen. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl.
   

  

**Våra team hjälper energiproducenter, nätägare och utvecklare av infrastruktur att välja smarta lösningar i ett snabbrörligt energilandskap. Omexom bygger, driftar och underhåller kritisk infrastruktur inom eldistribution, järnvägssystem, belysning och elbilsladdare (EV-charging).**
**Hur söker du LIA?**
 Om du är intresserad av att söka LIA vill vi att du besvarar frågorna i formuläret så utförligt som möjligt. En välskriven och utförlig ansökan ökar därför dina chanser. Vi får många förfrågningar angående LIA och anställning och kan bara ta emot en mindre andel varje omgång därför är det viktigt att du anger datum för din LIA period. Urvalet sker löpande.
   

  

*LIA är säkerhetsklassad. I enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs registerkontroll och säkerhetsintervju. Observera att säkerhetsprövningen behöver vara godkänd innan LIA:n kan starta.*
**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Vi är hjälpsamma, yrkesskickliga och leveransfokuserade.
   

  

 På Omexom är en kollega alltid nära och vi har roligt tillsammans. Medarbetarna har förtroende för den egna och kollegornas kompetens. Det är en förutsättning för den frihet och det ansvar som medarbetarna har och förväntas ta. Det skapar bra team och glädje i arbetet. Ingen dag är den andra lik och variationen i arbetet gör att individen behöver och får utveckling för att möta framtiden.
   

  

* Hos oss har du kollegor och ledare som stöttar dig i din utveckling.
* Vi är en del av en stark och växande global koncern som satsar på oss och vår verksamhet. Det ger oss möjligheter att utveckla verksamheten


**OM OMEXOM**
 Omexom erbjuder tjänster genom hela värdekedjan inom energidistribution och arbetar för att säkerställa ett välfungerande och hållbart samhälle. Idag finns Omexom i 39 länder, till största del i Europa, men även i länder som Nya Zeeland, USA, Mocambique och i Brasilien. I Sverige har vi kontor från Umeå till Malmö. Total omsättning för Omexom globalt är över 57 miljarder SEK.
   

  

 Omexom är ett varumärke inom VINCI Energies som är en del av VINCI, en stor global koncern med över 285 000 medarbetare världen över. VINCI Energies är verksamma inom industri-, infrastruktur-, och ict-segmenten. I Sverige är VINCI Energies representerat av varumärkena Omexom, Axians, Building Solutions och Actemium.

title: Business Architect
description:
**Tillsammans bygger vi en starkare och mer rättssäker demokrati – är du med?
   

  

 Vårt samhälle bygger på öppenhet, och för att det ska fungera krävs verktyg som gör information tillgänglig, säker och spårbar. Innofactor Dynasty är ett komplett system för dokument- och ärendehantering som möjliggör just detta – utvecklat för svenska myndigheter, regioner och kommuner, men lika relevant för privat sektor. Vill du vara med och göra skillnad? Då kan denna roll passa dig.**
**Din roll**
 I rollen som Business architect blir du en central del av våra leveransprojekt och fungerar som den tekniska länken mellan kundens behov och vår lösning. Du ansvarar för att utforma och leda utveckling av lösningens funktions- och informationsarkitektur, och säkerställer att produkten möter både verksamhetskrav och höga kvalitetsstandarder.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära projektledare, utvecklare och verksamhetsexperter för att översätta komplexa krav till robusta, skalbara och användbara lösningar. Det innebär att du deltar i hela kedjan – från förstudier och workshops, via lösningsförslag och design, till implementation, test och vidareutveckling.
   

  

 Rollen är varierad och kombinerar strategiskt tänkande med praktiskt genomförande. Du fungerar som rådgivande expert för våra kunder och bidrar även med din kompetens i affärsutveckling och interna initiativ. Kort sagt: du är den som ser helheten, men också kan gå ner på detaljnivå när det behövs.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flera års erfarenhet som Business Architect eller i en liknande roll, gärna med fokus på informations- eller dokumenthantering.
   

  

* Du kan överblicka komplexa informationsflöden och fördjupa dig i detaljer när det behövs.
* Du är van vid produkt- och projektverksamhet och kan driva uppdrag från start till mål.
* Du har goda kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor och trivs i dialog med såväl kunder som kollegor.
* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor eller liknande reglerade verksamheter.


**Krav och meriter**
 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

 ➕ Erfarenhet av dokument- och ärendehanteringssystem
   

  

 ➕ Erfarenhet av att leda projekt inom informationshantering eller offentlig IT
   

  

 ➕ Har arbetat med system som
 **Dynasty, Public 360, Platina** 
 eller liknande, och har god förståelse för deras funktionalitet och tillämpning
   

  

 ➕ Flera års erfarenhet som Business Architect eller liknande roll
   

  

 ➕ Förmåga att överblicka komplexa informationsflöden och ta ansvar från förstudie till leverans
   

  

 ➕ Mycket goda samarbets- och kommunikationsförmågor
   

  

**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 På Innofactor får du en arbetsgemenskap med högt i tak och engagerade kollegor som brinner för att utveckla lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

* Du blir en del av ett nordiskt bolag med stark tillväxt och stor frihet i hur du lägger upp ditt arbete.
* Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetsformer, möjlighet till distansarbete, konkurrenskraftiga förmåner och stöd för fortbildning och karriärutveckling.
* Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande och samhällsviktiga projekt där din kompetens gör verklig nytta.


**Be the real you!**
 Vi är stolta över det vi skapar och låter våra medarbetare utvecklas som personer samtidigt som vi levererar högsta möjliga kvalitet till våra kunder. Vår arbetsmiljö stödjer de anställdas personliga utveckling och lärande, en god balans mellan arbete och privatliv – och vi erbjuder både kollektivavtal och friskvårdsbidrag för att skapa trygga och hälsosamma arbetsvillkor.
   

  

 Innofactor is the leading driver of the modern digital organization in the Nordic Countries for its over 1,000 customers in commercial and public sector. Innofactor has the widest solution offering and leading know-how in the Microsoft ecosystem in the Nordics. Innofactor has about 600 enthusiastic and motivated top specialists in Finland, Sweden, Denmark and Norway. www.innofactor.com
   

  

 #PeopleFirst #AIDriven #BeTheRealYou
