title: IT-technician
description:
We are looking for someone who will be responsible for maintaining and improving our IT-setup!


**About us**  

COFFEE STAIN NORTH is a small game developer based in Stockholm that belongs to the Coffee Stain Group. Since we started in 2013, we have grown to 30 developers and are now looking for a replacement while our IT is on parental leave.


We take pride in making games that we ourselves would like to play, a philosophy that has led us to work on multiple kinds of games in the past, like A Story About My Uncle & the Goat Simulator franchise (click here to see what Goat Enough! is)!


Working with us means working in a relaxed and friendly environment, where we value each other and the unique qualities we all bring to the table. Being small has its perks and one of our favourites is how we all have influence over our work/culture and the games we make.


**The role**  

In this role your main focus is to provide IT support for our Coffee Stain North team onsite at our Studio at Fridhemsplan, Stockholm. Part of the role also include to support with purchases and different initiatives at/for the office. As we also have an IT department in Skövde you will be collaborating with them on bigger projects.


Tasks that we see you would handle on a regular basis are:


* Maintenance (updates and similar) of servers, construction machines, dev-kits, virtual machines including setup
* Purchase and maintenance of employee workstations, including problem solving/tech support
* Technology-related improvements in the office, for example solutions for the meeting rooms
* Work together with IT in Skövde (Coffee Stain Studios) on connections to their setup
* Handling licenses and procure allocation (JetBrains, Slack, Maya, etc.)
* Perforce support for the development teams

**Your background**  

To succeed in this role, we see that you have some previous experience with above tasks, as well as knowledge within Perforce and Azure/Microsoft-suite. As we have employees from different parts of the world, it is a requirement to both speak and write in English and Swedish.


As you are alone in your role at our office, we believe that you are a person who can take responsibility of your own tasks, and are comfortable to raise issues or share ideas of improvements. Furthermore, as we are a gaming studio, we think that you might enjoy work even more if you’re a fellow gamer!


*Perks of working at Coffee Stain*

* We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits that go beyond the usual payments to your pension fund and insurances.
* We start every Monday with breakfast together at the office and have fika together on Fridays!
* We believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so on top of the wellness grant you get some paid time off to work out. Did we mention there are several gyms right beside our office?
* Once a month it’s a whole day of creative Friday which lets your inner passion blossom.
* We also have fun together and get inspired by playing games together once a month on Fridays.
* Bridge-days being paid time off.
* And, of course, you will be part of a wonderful team of colleagues working Goat Simulator franchise and what’s next!

**Practical info**  

The position is a temporary contract (vikariat) until January 2027 with start date as soon as possible. We are flexible if you want to work 60-100%, but as we see that this role is mostly needed when our team is onsite, we need you to be at the office at least Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays. Our office is newly renovated and we have, among other things, a ping-pong table, a big lounge area where we hang out, watch movies, or play games together, and last but not least – a giant goat statue (what more do you need?).


Apart from us, the Coffee Stain group consists of COFFEE STAIN STUDIOS in Skövde (Sanctum and Satisfactory), Coffee Stain Malmö (working on Goat Simulator 3 mobile, among other things) and COFFEE STAIN PUBLISHING who also work with close partners like Iron Gate (Valheim), Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic), and Easy Trigger Games (Huntdown) to name a few.


**We look forward to hearing from you!**

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Data Engineer & Analyst
description:
**About Mynt**


Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, on a mission to fundamentally change business banking forever. Our digital software, coupled with corporate cards and payments infrastructure, eradicates manual administrative tasks relating to spending for businesses. Mynt is experiencing huge growth in the Nordic markets, and we have recently secured substantial funding to support our continued expansion in Sweden and internationally.


Mynt is a tech-first company with a product-oriented mindset, empowering teams to create innovative solutions to complex problems. We are a licensed e-money institution, card issuer and payment processor under the supervision of the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority. We have established key partnerships within banking, ERP, fleet and mobility - and our solutions are now live in all Nordic countries. Examples of partners include Fortnox and Nordea, with more collaborations underway.


Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 75+ employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our Platform team to support our growth.

**About the Role**


We are now looking for a top performer with a strong drive and creative goal-oriented mindset to work with business data analytics. You will be expected to work closely with the CPO and leadership team to analyze and visualize a multitude of data, building on our existing ETL and analytics pipeline.


We believe you’re someone who thrives in a fast-moving, ambitious scale-up environment, enjoys solving problems from both a technical and business perspective, and wants to see your work make a real impact. If you love digging into data, finding patterns, and turning insights into action, you’ll feel right at home here.

**What you’ll be diving into:**

* Work extensively with our internal customer and marketing data to deliver sharp and actionable insight to several functions at Mynt
* Work closely with senior leaders in business areas to understand the mechanics of each area
* Own and develop our existing data flows and data tools
* Help other teams be more data-driven by providing the right tools, educating them and assist in more advanced analyses

**What you bring to the table:**

* Experience in SQL and python or similar languages
* Bachelor's or Master's degree
* Fluent in Swedish and English

**What we can offer you:**

* Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
* Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
* Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
* Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.

*The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!*

title: Sr Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea | Stockholm
description:
**Senior Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea**  

At **Apotea**, Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, we’re reshaping how healthcare reaches people — smarter, faster, and more sustainably. Every system we optimize and every line of code we write brings us closer to a society where better health is accessible for everyone.  

  

Now, we’re looking for a **Senior Software Engineer** to take a leading role in developing and scaling the systems that power our entire operation — from seamless customer experiences to world-class logistics.  

This isn’t a role for someone who wants “just another dev job.” This is your chance to be part of a purpose-driven tech journey where your impact goes far beyond code.  

  

**Why this role matters**  

At Apotea, technology isn’t a support function — it’s our competitive edge. You’ll be joining the **core of Apoteas tech team**, where uptime, performance, and innovation meet real-world impact. You’ll help us design and evolve the complex systems that keep millions of deliveries moving, pharmacies stocked, and customers cared for every single day.  

  

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead by doing — combining deep technical skill with curiosity, initiative, and collaboration.  

  

**‍ What you’ll do**  

**Design, build, and evolve** high-performance systems that keep Apotea running at scale.  

**Lead technical direction** within projects and mentor other developers through complex problem-solving.  

**Drive innovation** through automation, modernization, and new integrations — from logistics partners to sister companies.  

**Collaborate across teams** to bridge business needs and technical execution.  

**Strengthen reliability and scalability** across our .NET ecosystem — keeping millions of transactions flowing seamlessly.  

**Shape the future** of Apotea’s tech landscape — your ideas will influence how we grow.  

  

**Who you are**  

You’re an experienced engineer who loves tackling complexity and turning it into clarity. You thrive in fast-paced environments where real impact is visible every day. You’re both hands-on and strategic — equally comfortable writing elegant .NET code as you are leading architectural discussions.  

  

You’ll fit right in if you:  

* **Write clean, maintainable C#/.NET code** with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Understand **system architecture**, distributed systems, and data flow in complex environments.
* Have strong **problem-solving and debugging skills** — you stay calm under pressure and focused on solutions.
* Enjoy mentoring, sharing knowledge, and lifting others around you.
* Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.

  

**Extra kudos if you bring**  

Experience in **logistics, e-commerce, or ERP/WMS systems**.  

Familiarity with **cloud infrastructure**, **DevOps**, or automation tools.  

A background in **integration projects** or migration work.  

Swedish language skills — a plus, not a must.  

  

**What Apotea offers you**  

A role where your code impacts millions of people.  

The chance to work in Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company.  

An agile, flat organization where ideas matter more than titles.  

Growth opportunities: training, mentorship, and conferences.  

A collaborative, transparent culture where your voice counts.  

A meaningful mission – making healthcare more accessible while caring for the planet.  

  

**️ About Apotea**  

Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Årsta, Lidingö, Morgongåva and Varberg.  

  

Follow us on social media to stay up to date on everything that's happening at Apotea  

  

LinkedIn  

Instagram  

  

Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.  

  

**Recruitment process**  

1. Apply  

2. Screening interview  

3. Technical interview  

4. Culture fit interview  

5. Background check (mandatory in pharmacy industry)  

6. Offer
  

  

Location: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm  

Work model: We work on-site  

Reports to: Head of IT Operations  

  

**Ready to join the journey?**  

Don’t wait – interviews happen continuously, and the role may be filled quickly. Apply today and be part of building something bigger than just software.  

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health, and your work creates real change.*

title: Maskinställare till Plastproduktionen
description:
**Volution Sweden söker maskinställare till Plastproduktionen, kvällsskift!**

  

Volution Sweden AB är Nordens marknadsledande producent av ventilationsprodukter för hemmet. Företaget har geografisk spridning i Europa, Asien samt Nord- och Sydamerika, med huvudkontor i Växjö.  

Med vår starka portfölj av varumärken såsom Fresh, Pax, Klimatfabriken och Reton finns vi närvarande i bostadens alla rum, med målet att skapa en sund och hållbar inomhusmiljö i hemmet.  

Hemmet är vår viktigaste plats och vi spenderar mer och mer tid inomhus. Ett gott inomhusklimat är därför viktigare än någonsin. Företaget arbetar aktivt med produktutveckling och digitalisering av såväl vår tillverkning som försäljningsprocess. Vill du vara med och skapa en bättre inomhusmiljö för människor över hela världen?  

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**  

Arbetet innebär att du huvudsakligen kommer att delta i det löpande produktionsarbetet med plastproduktionens formsprutningsmaskiner och verktyg. Byten av verktyg och relaterat arbete med maskinens kringutrustning kommer bli den centrala delen i arbetet, men även optimering av ställtider, produktkvalitet, produktionsprocessen och maskindata samt löpande och förebyggande underhåll kommer inkluderas. Deltagande vid konstruktion samt utveckling av formsprutningsverktyg kan också vara aktuellt.  

Arbetet innebär att du ska bidra till att utveckla dig själv och vår befintliga personal till framtidens ställare och operatörer.

  

Sökande ska vara villig att arbeta främst vårt kvällsskift, men det kan även bli andra förekommande skift.
  

  

**Kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som har en teknisk utbildning på lägst gymnasienivå och erfarenhet av produktionstekniskt arbete. Utbildning eller erfarenhet av förbättringsarbete såväl som programmering av maskiner och robotar är meriterande.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid att hitta rätt person med rätt inställning. Som person är du flexibel, ansvarstagande och engagerad. Arbetet kräver att du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt, kan ta egna initiativ och hitta lösningar samtidigt som du måste ha lätt för att samarbeta i team. Du är noggrann och bra på att planera och organisera ditt arbete. Vidare har du god teknisk kompetens, problemlösningsförmåga, är ambitiös och mån om att göra ett gott arbete. Noggrannhet, ansvarskännande och kvalitetstänkande är nödvändigt för att lyckas i rollen. Du måste ha förmågan att läsa och förstå produktritningar som är vägledande för kvalitetssäkring.

  

Truck- och/eller traverskort är meriterande liksom datorvana i affärssystem.  

  

**Varaktighet**  

Tillsvidareanställning på heltid omgående eller enligt överenskommelse.  

  

**Vill du veta mer?**  

Har du frågor om tjänsten får du gärna kontakta ansvarig chef, Mikael Tates tel. 0470-70 77 34.  

  

**Omfattning**  

Detta är ett heltidsjobb.  

  

**Arbetsgivare**  

Volution Holdings Sweden AB (org.nr 556903-7293), http://www.volutiongroup.se  

Smedjegatan 10  

352 46 VÄXJÖ  

  

**Arbetsplats**  

Volution Sweden AB

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**


Vi arbetar med löpande urval och ser därför gärna att du skickar oss din ansökan snarast möjligt, dock senast 2025-10-25.

title: LIA inom Infrastruktur, Backup & Storage
description:
**Om oss**


Proact är Europas ledande specialist inom data- och informationshantering med fokus på molntjänster och datacenterlösningar. Vi hjälper våra kunder att lagra, koppla samman, skydda, säkra och skapa värde genom data. Våra kunder finns i flera olika branscher och vi ser till att skapa stabila och säkra IT-miljöer med fokus på flexibilitet, produktivitet och effektivitet.


**Om praktiken**


Hos oss får du utveckla dina kunskaper och samtidigt få praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta i en supportnära roll inom infrastruktur, backup och storage. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med erfarna kollegor och hjälpa kunder i deras IT-miljöer. Praktiken sker på vår supportavdelning, där du får:


* Inblick i hur vi hanterar och löser supportärenden
* Arbeta nära erfarna kollegor inom infrastruktur, backup och storage
* Utveckla din problemlösningsförmåga genom praktiskt arbete
* Delta både i dagliga supportuppgifter och i pågående projekt

**Vem söker vi**


Vi söker dig som går en utbildning inom IT-infrastruktur och vill genomföra din LIA på en avdelning där support och kundkontakt är en viktig del av arbetet. Vi tror att du:


* Tycker det är roligt att hjälpa andra och lösa problem
* Har intresse för lagring, backup och driftmiljöer
* Är nyfiken, engagerad och vill utvecklas inom IT-infrastruktur
* Har grundläggande kunskap om nätverk, servrar eller virtualisering
* Du talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska

**Vi erbjuder dig**


En lärorik och utvecklande praktikplats där du får möjlighet att bygga erfarenhet inom både teknik och support. Vi har en härlig kultur där samarbete, kunskap, service och glädje är viktigt.


Skicka in din ansökan med CV och en kort presentation om dig själv och din utbildning!

title: IT Support Engineer
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
At ALS, we encourage you to dream big.
   

  

 When you join us, you’ll be part of a global team harnessing the power of scientific testing and data-driven insights to build a healthier future.
   

  

 IT Support Engineer, Sweden
   

  

 Australian Laboratory Services (ALS) is a publicly listed laboratory-based testing services company that provides a broad range of testing and analytical services to a wide variety of end markets and industries around the globe. We continue to remain at the forefront of the testing services industry, building an enviable reputation.
   

  

 The ALS Northern Europe region is a part of the ALS Group. The sub-region consists of approx. 600 employees with laboratories in Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sollentuna & Danderyd, Sweden
   

  

**About The Position**
 Join ALS as an IT Support Engineer and play a key role in managing and optimizing our IT infrastructure. Your responsibilities will include diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and network issues, improving system functionality, providing remote technical support, ensuring IT compliance, and participating in local and sub-regional IT projects. This role is ideal for someone with a passion for IT, strong problem-solving skills, and a commitment to continuous professional development.
   

  

 Specific Responsibilities
   

  

* Record and address incidents/service requests, through our helpdesk system.
* Oversee, set up, and maintain IT devices for end-users.
* Manage and maintain server room equipment, such as backup devices, switches, routers, and servers.
* Actively monitor systems for vulnerabilities and respond promptly to any security incidents.
* Manage and implement updates for software and hardware.
* Set up and monitor backup processes and disaster recovery plans.
* Contribute to a range of IT projects, supporting delivery and implementation. Work closely with other IT teams to ensure cohesive IT operations and project alignment.
* Maintain and update an inventory of IT components and equipment.
* Maintain and update IT-related documentation to meet ISO accreditation standards and ensure IT operations comply with regulatory requirements.
* Work with internal and external auditors and provide necessary IT-related compliance evidence.
* Document processes and procedures for assigned tasks and projects.
* Participate in budget planning for IT expenditures.
* Communicate and coordinate with third-party support and vendors.
* Travel to various locations for on-site resolution of issues not manageable remotely.


**About You**
**Skills and Behaviors:**
* Windows clients and servers (physical and virtual)
* Experience with virtualization tools such as Hyper-V
* Helpdesk ticketing systems (ticket lifecycle, ITIL basics)
* Demonstrated ability to create clear and concise documentation, end-user guides, how-to guides, and technical process guides
* Proven experience in IT support, preferably in a laboratory or ISO-regulated environment
* TCP/IP networking - basic principles and active troubleshooting
* Familiarity with backup and disaster recovery technologies (e.g., Veeam Backup).
* Proven proficiency in mainstream applications, including Microsoft Office
* Office 365 – knowledge including Teams, Exchange Admin & SharePoint
* Knowledge of Active Directory
* Experience working with hardware vendors and 3rd party service providers
* Motivated to stay updated with IT trends and technologies through continuous learning
* Strong communication skills with a patient and understanding approach to resolving user issues
* You are motivated, with a strong drive to excel in your role
* Proven capability to prioritize tasks effectively and meet demanding deadlines
* You are a collaborative team player who works well with others
* Willingness and ability to travel to remote sites for IT service provision and maintenance activities
* A valid driver’s license is required


**Experience and Qualifications:**
* At least 3 years of experience as a support engineer within an enterprise environment
* Tertiary qualification in IT and/or extensive practical experience
* Full professional proficiency in English and Swedish is essential.


 What can you expect from us?
   

  

* At ALS we believe that the people we employ are what makes ALS the great company it is today
* An excellent opportunity for a motivated and skilled person looking to develop a career within an international company
* A global network with a lot of peers to support your success in the region
* An inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless


 Looking for further details?
   

  

* The position is a permanent employment on a full-time basis with 6-month trial period.
* Please contact Vasile Trifa, IT Operations Manager Northern Europe, Russia, Central Asia and Arabia, vasile.trifa@alsglobal.com , for further details about the position.
* If you think that the position description matches you, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your interest in ALS might compensate for this.
* Apply by providing a cover letter and CV in English. Mark the application with IT Support Engineer.


**Working at ALS**
 The ALS team is a diverse and dedicated community united by our passion to make a difference in the world.
   

  

 Our values are important to us, and shape how we work, how we treat each other and how we recognise excellence.
   

  

 At ALS, you’ll be supported to develop new skills and reach your full potential. We invest in our people with programs and opportunities that help you build a diverse career with us.
   

  

 We want everyone to have a safe, flexible and rewarding career that makes a positive impact on our people, the planet and our communities.
   

  

**Everyone Matters**
 ALS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where the strengths and perspectives of each employee are both recognised and valued.
   

  

 ALS also welcomes applications from people with all levels of ability. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
   

  

**Eligibility**
 To be eligible to work at ALS you must be a Citizen or Permanent Resident of the country you are applying for, or either hold or be able to obtain, a valid working visa.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role.

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
We are a heavy machinery scale-up from Sweden looking for an entrepreneurial Chief Technology Officer to join our company.
 



  





 There's a global shift towards sustainability which has expanded also into heavy machinery & automotive space. This has created a need for electric and battery powered technologies. We specialize within this niche and aspire to become market leaders in engineering products for battery-powered heavy machinery.
 



  





 We are working with global industrial players and are supported by top tier investors both on the Venture capital and on the industrial sides.
 



  





 We are looking for a CTO with the spirit to join a venture with great potential and build it into a global company.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 We are looking for a CTO with an entrepreneurial spirit to join a venture with great potential and build it into a global company.
 



  





 The key objectives of the role are:
 



  





 1) Owning the Technical strategy and roadmap
 



 2) Team Leadership: Lead the two engineering teams of 6 split into software and mechanical side
 



 3) Project Management: Manage delivery of multiple ongoing projects with different global customers.
 



  





 With great investors, IP, market timing and customer interest, timing is perfect for an influential CTO to truly impact the growth of the company.
 



  





 With great investors, board members, IP/ Patents, market timing and customer interest, we offer an amazing possibility to join their management team and lead their next phase of the journey towards global expansion.
 



  





 So, if you are looking for the next big venture to join as a CTO, please apply.

title: IT-Säkerhetspecialist till Castra
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som IT-säkerhetsspecialist kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder för att identifiera säkerhetsutmaningar, utveckla strategier och implementera tekniska lösningar som skyddar deras digitala tillgångar. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:
   

  

* Genomföra säkerhetsanalyser och riskbedömningar
* Utveckla och implementera säkerhetslösningar för IAM, nätverk, molnmiljöer och applikationer
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av regelverk så som GDPR, NIS2, ISO 27001 m.fl.
* Följa upp och övervaka säkerhetsincidenter samt genomföra åtgärder
* Rådgivning till kunder om bästa praxis inom IT-säkerhet


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-säkerhet
* Kunskaper inom områden som IAM, nätverkssäkerhet, kryptering och molnsäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsstandarder och regelverk som GDPR, NIS2, ISO 27001 eller liknande.
* Förmåga att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med säkerhetslösningar
* Certifieringar som CISSP, CISM eller liknande är meriterande


 Låter detta som du i det stora hela? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan, så tar vi ett möte redan under kommande vecka!
   

  

**Bara det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och Management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet. Vi är verksamma inom Systemutveckling, IT-infrastruktur, IT-styrning & Ledarskap samt IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, på riktigt! Det låter lite skrytsamt, men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av
 **Great Place to Work** 
 och har de senaste två åren blivit utnämnda till
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats** 
 för stora bolag. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag.
   

  

 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara en bonus! Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro, Jönköping och Sundsvall.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
 Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till Charlotta Ljung på Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 072-871 63 12

title: IT System Administrator
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 At Legora, technology is at the heart of everything we do. Our teams move fast, and they need reliable, secure, and scalable systems to deliver their best work. That’s where you come in.
   

  

 We are now looking for an
 **IT System Administrator** 
 to own and evolve our internal IT environment. From managing core infrastructure and SaaS platforms to ensuring smooth onboarding experiences and bulletproof security practices, you will be the go-to person for keeping our systems running and our people empowered. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you’ll balance operational excellence with forward-looking improvements that support our rapid growth.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Manage and administer core IT systems including Google Workspace, Slack, Okta (or equivalent), and other SaaS platforms critical to daily operations.
* Drive, manage, and implement new systems and tools that support company growth and improve operational efficiency.
* Own device management for apple devices, including configuration, deployment, patching.
* Develop and maintain internal IT processes (onboarding, offboarding, access management, license tracking) for scalability and efficiency.
* Build automation and integrations across systems using APIs to streamline workflows and reduce manual work.
* Work closely with the Security team to implement Zero Trust principles, identity and access management, and compliance controls.
* Provide technical support and guidance to employees, troubleshooting issues across applications, devices, and services.


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 3+ years of experience in IT administration, system operations, or similar roles in a fast-moving tech environment.
* Deep expertise in the Apple ecosystem — macOS and iOS administration, Apple Business Manager, MDM tools (e.g., Kandji, Jamf, Intune), and endpoint security. Strong knowledge of Google Workspace, identity and access management (Okta, Entra or similar), and SaaS management best practices.
* Hands-on experience with APIs and scripting (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate processes and integrate systems.
* Familiarity with compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR) and how IT operations support them. Strong problem-solving mindset with a focus on automation, efficiency, and user experience.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to build trust as a reliable point of contact across the organization.


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Data Analyst to Financial Crime Prevention area in SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Financial Crime prevention, whether it is to combat fraud against our customers, protecting the bank from money laundering or perform sanction screening is central not only to SEB but for the society as such. If you are interested in working with our solutions regarding sanctions screening, continue reading!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 In this role you will work as data analyst in the FCP Screening team. We are maintaining and developing a bought system used for sanctions screening of SEB customers and transactions. You will support the team and stakeholders by analyzing data, create insights, and produce reports.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Experience with Python, Tableau, SQL or other similar tools and technologies.
* It’s meriting if you have previous experience working with solutions within financial crime prevention, sanctions screening, payment or banking in general.
* You have an analytical mindset and an ability to solve complex technical problems.
* You enjoy working with new technologies, encourage and drive change and continuous improvement in teamwork, tools and processes.


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Long-term stability
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **2025-10-31** 
 . If you have questions about the position please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Rasmus Hallberg, at rasmus.hallberg@seb.se.

title: VIP client support
description:
Job Description
 


* The Band 2 – Desktop Technician will provide day to day local\remote desktop support, receive inbound calls, answer questions, troubleshoot and document steps performed to resolve challenges with hardware, software and application issues in a ticketing system. The candidate will also need to facilitate customer resolution for calls and engage their supervisors and managers to ensure operational consistency across all shifts within the IT Support Center. Desktop Support Engineer provides Break Fix, fault diagnosis and resolution. Providing fault analysis to customer’s various core operating systems and platforms, as well be able to provide support and apply desktop fault resolution for the approved application suite. Ideal candidate should have 2-3 Years’ experience in Windows Desktop support.



  





 Position Responsibilities and Functions
 



  




* Provide first/second level contact and problem resolution for customer issues.
* Handling VIP Users
* Work with vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed.
* Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution.
* Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents.
* Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application.
* Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users.
* Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware.
* Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers.
* Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers and any other authorized peripheral equipment.
* Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and workstation hardware/software.
* Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart Devices and Telecoms.
* This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and teamwork. Performs other duties as assigned.
* VIP User Support



  





 Candidate Required Minimum Qualifications and Skills
 


* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.
* CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) or better.
* Minimum of 18 months years of IT experience.
* Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems.
* Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions, Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.
* Proven analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Proven ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.
* Excellent communication relationship-building and internal customer service skills.
* Adaptable and flexible in a fast-changing industry and work environment.
* Willing to work off-hours and weekends when required for projects or emergency support.



  





 In addition, the Band 2 Technician will mentor and assist Band 1 technicians in their work and provide support to Band 3 Engineers in resolving tickets.

title: System Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about designing and integrating complex systems that combine electronics, software, and mechanical components? Do you thrive in dynamic, cross-disciplinary projects and want to make a real impact on next-generation technology? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who has:
 



  




* A
 **Bachelor’s or Master’s degree** 
 in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with
 **SysML/UML modeling tools** 
 such as Cameo Systems Modeler, Enterprise Architect, IBM Rational Rhapsody, or Capella.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with
 **MATLAB/Simulink modeling environments** 
 (System Composer) and/or Python.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work
 **independently or collaboratively** 
 in project teams.



  





 It’s also a plus if you have experience with:
 



  




* **Requirements management tools** 
 like DOORS Next Generation, JIRA/Confluence, or similar platforms for traceability.



  





 As a Systems Engineer, you will have an opportunity to contribute to diverse and exciting assignments, including:
 



  




* Designing and integrating systems across electrical, electronic, and software domains.
* Modeling system behavior and architecture using SysML/UML.
* Developing simulation models and control algorithms in MATLAB/Simulink or Python.
* Working on prototype and proof-of-concept projects for innovative technology solutions.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop, verify, and test systems end-to-end.
* Exploring emerging technologies, from battery-electric vehicles and autonomous systems to industrial machinery and aerospace applications.
* Supporting process improvements, automating workflows, and introducing new tools and methodologies.



  





**About ALTEN** 




  





 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors,such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



 For the fifthyear in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.
 



 Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: IT-Tekniker
description:
*ill du arbeta med IT-support i en miljö där både teknik och service står i fokus? På Brå får du en varierad roll med möjlighet att växa, utvecklas och arbeta tillsammans med engagerade kollegor i centrala Stockholm. Läs mer för att ta reda på om detta är nästa steg för din karrär!* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vi på Perido söker nu en IT-tekniker till vår kund Brottsförebyggande rådet (BRÅ). De verkar för att minska brottsligheten och tryggheten i samhället. Det gör de genom att ta fram fakta och sprida kunskap om brottslighet, brottsbekämpning och brottsförebyggande arbete, till i första hand regeringen och myndigheter inom rättsväsendet. Tjänsten är placerad på Kungsholmen i Stockholm.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som IT-tekniker ansvarar du för första linjens IT-support (1st line) och hanterar inkommande supportärenden från Brå:s medarbetare. Arbetet omfattar felsökning, administration och användarstöd samt att säkerställa att rutiner och processer följs enligt ITIL. Du samarbetar nära med både interna kollegor och externa leverantörer för att ge bästa möjliga service.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 
 :
 


* Teknisk felsökning och avhjälpning
* Administration av konton och behörigheter
* Installera och konfigurera hårdvara och applikationer
* Eskalering och samarbete med 2nd och 3rd line (både internt och externt gentemot leverantörer)
* Ansvara för inköp och distribution av IT-tillbehör
* Tester av ny hård- och mjukvara



  





**Dina egenskaper** 




 Vi tror att du som söker har en förmåga att arbeta självständigt med komplexa ärenden, förbättra processflöden och koordinera med användare, kollegor och leverantörer. Du kan anpassa kommunikation efter ärendetyp och hantera flera kanaler parallellt. Du visar tålamod, lyssnar aktivt och bekräftar användarens upplevelse på ett professionellt sätt. Du har förmågan att de-eskalera upprörda situationer, skapa förtroende genom proaktiv återkoppling och anpassa ditt bemötande efter behov. Du har ett genuint intresse för att hjälpa användare och drivs av en positiv inställning till din roll, dina kollegor och de du stöttar. Dessutom har du en öppen inställning till kontinuerligt lärande, tar till dig feedback och använder konstruktiv kritik som en möjlighet att utvecklas vidare.
 



 Är det dig vi söker?
 



 Vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan, varmt välkommen med den redan idag!
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* IT-utbildning på minst gymnasienivå och minst 1 års erfarenhet av IT-support i en blandad miljö där du fått kunskap i Windows och Linux
* Stor vana av kund- och användarbemötande
* Vana av mjukvaru- och hårdvarusupport
* Erfarenhet av både on-prem, SaaS och molnlösningar
* Vana av arbete enligt ITIL-processer
* Erfarenhet av ärendehantering och eskaleringsrutiner
* Kunskap inom virtualisering: t.ex. KVM, Proxmox, Hyper-V, ESXi
* Hantera ärenden enligt SLA, inklusive kategorisering, statusuppdatering och rapportering
* Kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som skrift



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning från yrkeshögskola eller universitet inom IT-området
* Djupare kunskap i ITIL-processer, inklusive kontinuerlig uppföljning
* Andra system och verktyg inom mjukvarudistribution, behörighetshantering, Mobile Device Management
* Erfarenhet av incident-, problem- och changeprocesser
* Vana att representera supporten i CAB-hantering



  





**Omfattning och tillträde** 




 Heltid, konsultuppdrag i 6 månader. Start omgående.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansökan görs på vår hemsida
 
 perido.se/
 
 . Klicka på knappen
 *ansök* 
 i annonsen för aktuell tjänst och fyll i dina uppgifter samt bifoga CV. Vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande. Notera att viss information gällande uppdraget och/eller kundföretaget medvetet kan ha utlämnats från annonsen, först vid kontakt med ansvarig rekryterare får du all information som du behöver.
 



 De flesta frågor eller funderingar kan du hitta svar på under
 
 perido.se/vanliga-fragor/
 
 . Om du fortfarande inte hittat svaret du söker är du välkommen att kontakta oss på
 **fraga@perido.se** 
 så svarar någon av våra rekryteringskommunikatörer dig. Ange alltid tjänstens referensnummer
 **35473** 
 i ämnesraden. Vänligen notera att vi endast tar emot ansökningar på vår hemsida och att vi inte har möjlighet att svara på hur du ligger till i processen eller vilket kundföretaget är om det utelämnats ur annonsen.
 



  





**Om Perido** 




 Varför heter företaget Perido? Det kommer från det latinska ordet
 *Peridoneus* 
 som betyder ”väl matchad”. Att matcha vår konsults kompetens och karriärinriktning med våra kunders behov är det vi är allra bäst på! Perido är ett konsult- och rekryteringsföretag inom tjänstemannasektorn som hjälper dig till nästa steg i yrkeslivet och vår vision är att alla ska trivas och vara engagerade på jobbet. Vi har vuxit stadigt sedan starten 2003 och har över 1500 medarbetare över hela landet, varav ett femtiotal interna medarbetare på våra huvudkontor i Stockholm och Göteborg. Som konsult hos oss blir du en viktig del av vår organisation och du växer tillsammans med oss genom att förstärka med din kompetens ute i våra kunders organisationer. Läs mer om oss på Perido:
 
 https://perido.se/om-oss/
 
 .

title: Windows Systemadministratör
description:
*Har du gedigen erfarenhet av Windows-miljöer och brinner för att arbeta med drift, förvaltning och utveckling av IT-infrastruktur? Vi söker nu Windows Systemadministratörer som vill fortsätta utvecklas inom området och bidra med sin expertis i komplexa IT-miljöer* 
 .
   

  

 Hos oss trivs du som motiveras av problemlösning, gillar att ta ansvar och har ett genuint intresse för att fördjupa dig i tekniken.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer


*Dina arbetsuppgifter*
 Som
 **Windows Systemadministratör** 
 kommer du att arbeta ute hos någon av våra kunder med fokus på drift, administration och utveckling av deras IT-miljö.
   

  

**Rollen innebär bland annat att**
* Ansvara för drift, underhåll och optimering av Windows Server-miljöer
* Administrera och utveckla Active Directory, inklusive GPO:er
* Arbeta med applikationspaketering, klienthantering och distribution (ex. via SCCM/Intune)
* Automatisera och effektivisera processer med hjälp av PowerShell
* Förvalta och supportera Microsoft 365-miljöer
* Delta i projekt såsom molnmigreringar, uppgraderingar och säkerhetsförbättringar


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har flera års erfarenhet av systemadministration inom Windows-miljöer
* Har erfarenhet av: Windows Server, Active Directory, GPO:er, SCCM/Intune, PowerShell, VMware, M365 och Windows OS
* Har god förståelse för IT-drift, förvaltning och felsökning på en avancerad nivå
* Behärskar svenska obehindrat i både tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av**
* ITIL-processer
* Nätverk och säkerhet
* Cloud-tjänster (Azure, M365)


**Om dig**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är analytisk, initiativtagande och ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
   

  

**Mer om Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (tidigare Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och framtidssäkra sin kompetens med flexibla konsulttjänster. Våra kunder är välkända aktörer och marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att du ska trivas, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och lunchträffar. Hos oss lyssnar vi alltid på dina behov och vilken riktning du vill utvecklas i.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Urval sker löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att läsa den. Har du frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta: pauline.ryott@nexergroup.com

title: Product Manager - Core Infrastructure
description:
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join Spotify's Core Infrastructure studio.
   

  

 You will be responsible for driving the product strategy for Declarative Infrastructure, our platform for automating the provisioning and management of cloud resources. By treating infrastructure as code, you will empower hundreds of engineering teams at Spotify to build, innovate, and scale their services with the same best practices they use for software development—like version control, code reviews, and automated validation.
   

  

 This is a critical role that will shape the future of Spotify's engineering platform, directly impacting developer productivity and our ability to operate reliably at scale.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Drive the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for Declarative Infrastructure at Spotify, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of our engineering teams.
* Deeply understand the developer experience and the challenges engineers face when managing cloud resources, and translate those insights into impactful product improvements.
* Define and analyze metrics that measure the success and adoption of the platform, using data to inform your product decisions and investment priorities.
* Collaborate closely with the engineering manager and engineers on the squad, as well as with key stakeholders
* Serve as a "developer evangelist" for Declarative Infrastructure, championing its benefits and guiding teams on best practices for managing their infrastructure as code.
* Stay current with industry trends and technology developments in the cloud native ecosystem (e.g., Kubernetes, CNCF, Infrastructure as Code) to evolve our platform.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong technical background and are comfortable engaging in in-depth discussions about complex systems. Experience as a software engineer, especially in the infrastructure or platform space, is a major plus.
* You are passionate about building outstanding developer experiences and understand what a great internal platform looks like.
* You have experience with cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure), Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles, and/or Kubernetes.
* You are an excellent communicator who can articulate a compelling vision and bring complex ideas to a wide range of audiences, from engineers to senior leadership.
* You are a curious, go-getter who inspires change, adapts quickly, and enjoys a dynamic and constantly evolving technical environment.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm, or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about turning ideas into precise 3D models and detailed designs? We are looking for a talented 3D CAD Engineer to join our team in Stockholm, working on innovative projects across a variety of industries.
