**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors,such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



 For the fifthyear in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.
 



 Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
**Data Scientist Focused on Revenue Management & Network Optimization**
 At SAS, we’re passionate about transforming aviation with cutting-edge technology. As part of our AI Team, you’ll shape the future of air travel by creating innovative, data-driven solutions that maximize revenue - you will work on one of the most challenging and rewarding problems in the industry: finding the right price, for the right customer, at the right time. Your work will ensure that the airline's Revenue Optimization remains scientifically robust, operationally scalable, and commercially impactful - directly shaping how revenue is optimized in a dynamic, competitive marketplace.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will center on turning business challenges into well-defined analytical problems and building end-to-end machine learning solutions that deliver measurable impact. You will design, train, and maintain models that power SAS’s revenue optimization, ensuring they are accurate, scalable, and production ready. A priority will be to deliver dynamic pricing, a groundbreaking shift in how SAS competes in the marketplace. At the same time, we are developing AI-driven revenue optimization at scale, ensuring our models continuously learn, adapt, and evolve with industry dynamics. Your work will help SAS unlock the full potential of AI in airline revenue optimization, making smarter pricing and network decisions a reality today.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
* Machine Learning & Optimization Techniques: Build and deploy algorithms that power revenue and network decisions. Among other solutions, you’ll develop demand forecasting, purchase probability, varying revenue optimization models, leveraging a broad spectrum of AI methods. From classical ensemble methods to deep learning architectures and reinforcement learning frameworks - selecting the most effective approach for each complex problem.
* Operations Research: Beyond building models, you’ll explore new formulations, test novel algorithms and findings that push the boundaries of airline revenue optimization. You will convert advanced research into production-ready optimization and modeling solutions, collaborating with the Operations Research team to embed novel algorithms into initiatives that deliver measurable business impact.
* MLOps: Leverage end-to-end ML infrastructure to take models from research to production at scale. This includes designing reproducible training and inference pipelines, integrating CI/CD workflows for seamless deployment, and ensuring robust monitoring to detect drift and trigger automated retraining, keeping models stable and accurate in production.


**The Team**
 We are a central machine learning team that collaborates closely with stakeholders across various business units, identifying business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through advanced analytics.
   

  

 We work with diverse machine learning projects, collaborate and contribute to the machine learning practice to ensure that we have a solid foundation for SAS to scale and realize the full potential of machine learning.
   

  

 We are now strengthening our team with an experienced Data Scientist focused primarily on optimization projects within Revenue Management and Network, enhancing our advanced analytics capabilities to drive continuous business optimization.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Master’s Degree or higher with strong mathematics focus (Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Computer Science) or related field.
* At least 3 years of industry experience within Data science domain.
* Proven record of taking on loosely defined problems and translating into practical application.
* Strong mathematical background (e.g., linear algebra, calculus, statistics, optimization).
* More than 3 years’ experience with Python, SQL and popular machine/deep learning libraries.
* Proficient with statistical- and machine learning models (both supervised learning and unsupervised learning).
* Well-versed in cloud computing, prior experience with Azure is a big plus.


 We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. You’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by commercial opportunities and proactively strive to create business value.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 27/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Är du en teknisk, flexibel och lösningsorienterad person som tycker om att arbeta med flödet kring krav och verifiering när det kommer till framtagning av försvarssystem?
   

  

 Har du ett intresse av att arbeta med framtidens teknik i en innovativ och växande organisation och vill hjälpa till att skapa en tryggare vardag genom att utveckla IT-system som fokuserar på samverkan inom Sverige, NATO och dess allierade?
   

  

 Då har vi rätt tjänst för dig!
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Vi söker en systemingenjör med ett intresse kring kravställning, kravanalys, kravnedbrytning samt att hålla koll och ta fram assuransen till hur dessa krav testas och verifieras.
   

  

 Med en relativt liten och flexibel organisation så kommer du få en stor varians i arbetsuppgifter, arbeta inom hela projektflödet och få möjlighet att komma i kontakt med flertalet olika projekt och ta en central del i att leverera nya försvarsförmågor med kvalitet!
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Kravanalys och identifikation inom aktiva och kommande projekt.
* Kravnedbrytning och allokering för att få tydliga krav på rätt delsystem.
* Upprätta kravspårbarhet för att säkerställa assurans mellan krav, design, implementation och tester.
* Inrätta verifieringsstrategier, var och när skall delsystem testas för att säkra en fungerande slutleverans.
* Ta fram testspecifikationer för olika delsystem inför testtillfällen.
* Genomförande och analys av testresultat för att säkerställa att systemet fungerar enligt kraven.


**Det här bidrar du med**
* Du har en kandidatexamen eller motsvarande utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemutveckling, elektronik eller mekatronik.
* Förmåga att analysera komplexa system och identifiera problem i ett tidigt skede.
* Skriva tekniska rapporter, kravdokument och testplaner på ett tydligt sätt.
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med tvärfunktionella team med flera discipliner.
* Förståelse kring Systems Engineering processer inkl.
+ Kravanalys och specifikation
+ Spårbarhet och förändringshantering
+ Testmetodik och strategi


 Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Du talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Varför MilDef?**
 På MilDef får du arbeta i en engagerad och stöttande miljö där dina idéer och insatser värdesätts. Du kommer att ha möjligheter till kontinuerligt lärande och karriärutveckling samt arbeta i en teamorienterad miljö som främjar innovation och samarbete.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal inkl. bra försäkringar
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar
* Happiness team som ordnar roliga aktiviteter
* Arbete i helt nybyggda lokaler i Rosersberg


**Ansökan**
 Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team, skicka din ansökan snarast. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com. För information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Viktor Attoff, Head of Software Services, på viktor.attoff@mildef.com.
   

  

 Vi påbörjar urvalsprocessen efter ansökningstidens slut den 19 oktober.
   

  

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for defense and security domains. MilDef provides hardware, software and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest.
   

  

 MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

title: Data & Analytics Management Consultant - Graduates/Young Professionals (Stockholm & Gothenburg)
description:
Ready to launch your career within Data & Analytics, and work hands-on with innovative digital solutions and future-proof business models? Capgemini Invent is seeking inventive and driven graduates and young professionals to join our dynamic team in
 **Stockholm and Gothenburg.** 




  





 At Capgemini Invent, our teams blend strategic thinking, creativity, and data-driven expertise to help clients solve complex challenges and stay ahead in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. We deliver solutions that are informed by science, inspired by design, and enabled by purposeful technology.
 



  





**YOUR ROLE** 




 As a consultant within Data & Analytics, you’ll play a key role in multidisciplinary teams partnering with leading organizations to transform data into strategic value. By harnessing the power of advanced analytics, AI and intelligent automation, you’ll help clients make smarter decisions and gain real-time, actionable insights. Working across industries and geographies, you’ll co-create innovative solutions and reshape business models, unlock new growth opportunities, and deliver measurable impact.
 



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 



* **Educational background:** 
 You hold a master’s degree with strong academic results in fields such as Engineering, Business, Economics in combination with Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar. Ideally, you combine this with hands-on experience from internships, projects, or extracurricular activities.
* **Recent graduate:** 
 You are graduating in 2026 or have recently graduated, with 0–1 year of relevant work experience since completing your degree.
* **Skills and mindset:** 
 You’re analytical, curious, and passionate about data-driven innovation. You thrive in dynamic environments, learn quickly, and enjoy solving complex challenges—both independently and in teams.
* **Language skills:** 
 You have fluent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* **Additional merits:** 
 International and professional experiences, as well as involvement in extracurricular activities, are considered valuable assets.



  





**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?** 



* **Diverse environment:** 
 Collaborative with market-leading clients and experienced consultants within Sweden, Denmark, Finland & globally.
* **Career development:** 
 Experience a well-defined career path with support to develop into a successful consultant, including training and mentoring programs.
* **Collaborative culture:** 
 Benefit from our supportive teams, knowledge sharing and comprehensive end-to-end capabilities.
* **Engaging workplace:** 
 Embrace a culture where employees shape their own future and enjoy a welcoming, social workplace with many exciting events and activities.



  





**NEED TO KNOW** 





 Start date and location
 




 As a recent graduate, you’ll join our Stockholm or Gothenburg office in Fall 2026, with readiness to travel and work on projects at our client sites.
 



  






 Application process
 




 Applications are reviewed continuously—apply early to secure your spot. Please submit your CV in
 **English** 
 along with your official transcripts from high school and university. Since the system only allows one upload field for grades (
 
 under “Cover Letter”
 
 ), we kindly ask you to
 **combine all your transcripts** 
 —high school, bachelor’s, and master’s—into a single document before uploading. Clearly state your expected graduation date and preferred office location(s). Incomplete applications will not be considered.
 



  





 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card.
 



  






 Next steps
 




 Our selection process includes several steps to ensure a fair and thorough evaluation:
 



 - CV & grade screening
 



 - Phone interview
 



 - Video interview
 



 - On-site group case
 



 - Final interview
 



 - Offer
 



  





**ABOUT CAPGEMINI INVENT** 




 Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world. We have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



  





*#LI-DNI*

title: CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE AGENT
description:
**Customer Experience Agent**
 The Customer Experience Agent plays a key supporting role in shaping and coordinating the customer experience strategy at SAS. Working within the Marketing organization, this role focuses on defining what excellent customer experience looks like across the end-to-end journey, and ensuring a consistent, customer-centric approach across all touchpoints.
   

  

 The CX Agent is responsible for maintaining the CX roadmap, translating customer insights—primarily from NPS and other feedback sources—into experience principles and actions, and aligning different business units around a unified CX proposition. While the role does not implement solutions directly, it ensures that each business unit understands and applies the CX vision in their respective areas.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 CX Strategy & Roadmap
   

  

* Contribute to the development and ongoing refinement of the CX roadmap for SAS, covering key customer journey stages (booking, check-in, travel, post-travel).
* Define and document what “good customer experience” means for SAS across different channels and touchpoints.
* Support the Head of Customer in aligning CX goals with overall brand and business strategy.


 Customer Feedback & Insights
   

  

* Monitor and analyse NPS survey data and other customer feedback to identify trends, pain points, and improvement opportunities.
* Translate customer feedback into clear experience themes, priorities, and follow-up actions.
* Collaborate with the Insights team to ensure feedback is shared regularly and meaningfully across departments.


 CX Proposition & Governance
   

  

* Help articulate a coherent CX proposition that aligns with SAS’s values and customer expectations.
* Serve as a central coordination point, ensuring business units understand and can apply the CX guidelines and principles in their operational areas.
* Maintain alignment and follow-up routines with key stakeholders in Product, Digital, Operations, and Customer Service.


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* 3–5 years of experience in customer experience, service design, customer insights, or a related function.
* Familiarity with customer journey mapping and CX frameworks.
* Strong understanding of customer feedback tools and NPS analysis.
* Ability to collaborate across departments and influence without direct authority.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills in English; Scandinavian language is a plus.
* Customer-centric mindset with a structured, proactive working style.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: Asap
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna or Copenhagen, and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.


 Come fly with us!

title: Product Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You love building products that truly delight at light speed. At your previous job you often felt impatient that your team’s next wave of improvements isn’t in your users' hands already. At Tandem you’ll be using that mindset to solve the problem that today clinicians are forced to work in systems that work against them rather than with them.
   

  

 As a Product Engineer at Tandem you’ll be shaping and building towards our product vision, working closely with designers, other engineers and our users. Owning and shipping features end to end, from understanding the user's pain-point through shipping it to clinicians all over Europe and polishing it to delight our users. You’re deeply technical, but ultimately, you’re motivated by crafting great products that solve real problems, and you’ll roll up your sleeves and get that done.
   

  

 What you will do:
   

  

* Own Product development end-to-end by defining product requirements, setting priorities, and translating ideas into technical specifications
* Partner directly with designers, users, and other engineers to shape and deliver impactful features.
* Design and implement scalable web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies.
* Ensure applications provide an intuitive and seamless user experience, incorporating feedback from stakeholders and end-users.
* Maintain high standards of code quality through code reviews, testing, and documentation.
* Use the best modern tools to ship great features as fast as possible.


 What You Bring
   

  

* A strong product mindset with the ability to define, build, and ship impactful features end-to-end.
* Proven experience building and deploying production-grade  Python  systems.
* Strong programming skills in TypeScript and  React.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure and a focus on scalability and reliability
* A passion for technical excellence and a drive to deliver impactful solutions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in the healthcare industry or with health-related applications
* Experience building Large Language Model (LLM) applications.
* Experience handling streaming audio and transcription.
* Experience with Kubernetes and Azure


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Technical interviews with some of our Engineers
* Interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: IT-tjänsteledare Modern Workplace – Stockholm
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens arbetsplats? Hos oss på Skanska får du chansen att göra skillnad. Vi söker dig som vill ta ett helhetsansvar om vår digitala arbetsmiljö och skapa lösningar som förenklar vardagen, förbättrar samarbetet och stödjer ett hållbart arbetssätt.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en IT-tjänsteledare till gruppen Digital Arbetsplats inom Skanska Sverige. Vår huvuduppgift är att tillhandahålla produkter och tjänster till användarna omfattande hårdvaror, programvaror, användarstöd och telefoni.
   

  

**Du gör vår digitala arbetsplats möjlig**
 Som IT-tjänsteledare Modern Workplace ansvarar du för att leda utvecklingen och förvalta vår digitala arbetsplats. Du arbetar med allt från datorer och mobila enheter till kringutrustning och användarsupport. Du är en nyckelperson i samarbetet med våra leverantörer och ser till att våra lösningar håller hög kvalitet och är enkla att använda.
   

  

 Du driver utvecklingen av digitala arbetsprocesser i nära samarbete med både interna och externa parter, samtidigt som du arbetar proaktivt med omvärldsbevakning för att kunna föreslå förbättringar baserade på nya teknologier och aktuella trender.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

  

* Testa, konfigurera och administrera datorer och mobila enheter.
* Säkerställa funktionalitet och kvalitet i nya modeller och vara kravställare mot leverantörer.
* Samarbeta kring images, applikationspaket och leveransfrågor.
* Hantera användarkonton och behörigheter i Intune och Active Directory.
* Ge teknisk support lokalt och på distans, inklusive samarbete med fälttekniker.
* Agera rådgivande och eskaleringspunkt vid problem och incidenter.
* Skapa användarguider och utbildningsmaterial.


**Intresse och kunskap om moderna IT-miljöer**
 Vi söker dig som har ett genuint intresse för teknik och människor. Du drivs av att hitta smarta lösningar som gör skillnad. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna IT-miljöer och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknisk kompetens med samarbete och service.
   

  

 Tjänsten kräver:
   

  

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom IT-support eller modern workplace management.
* God kunskap om Microsoft Intune, Apple DEP, Samsung Knox.
* Erfarenhet av SCCM-imaging, felsökning och testning.
* Kunskap om iOS, Android och Windows.


 Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av Microsoft Autopilot och arbete i internationella organisationer.
   

  

 Som person är du självgående, strukturerad och har lätt för att kommunicera både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan**
 Ansök via länk senast 9 november. Kontakta gruppchef Kristoffer Winberg vid frågor om tjänsten: 010-449 93 91.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Våra medarbetare är vår främsta styrka och det är viktigt att du känner dig trygg hos oss. Vi vill att du ska trivas på jobbet och ha kul med dina kollegor. Vi lovar dig som medarbetare en ständig kompetensutveckling och tillhandahåller en rad internutbildningar, befattningsspecifika program och internationella utvecklingsmöjligheter. För oss är hälsa och säkerhet extra viktigt och det ligger även som grund för våra förmåner till dig som anställd på Skanska.

title: MARKETING TECHNOLOGY SPECIALIST
description:
**Marketing Technology Specialist**
 As a Marketing Technology Specialist within SAS Commercial you will be responsible for innovating and solving technical challenges within marketing in general and paid media in particular.
   

  

 Your role includes maintaining and optimizing existing systems and creating new solutions to enhance our media buying and data collection capabilities. Key tasks include maintaining current and creating new audience segments, collecting data for our Marketing Mix Modeling tool (MMM), and developing tools for Dynamic creative optimization (DCO) and SEM, among others.
   

  

 As a person we believe you have a problem-solving attitude and strive in leading initiatives to research, investigate, and implement technical solutions to meet business needs. You will continuously evaluate new technologies, assess feasibility, and recommend the best solutions considering cost, impact, and effort.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
*Innovate and Solve Technical Challenges:*
* Support Media Specialists by developing and maintaining technical solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness in media buying and data analysis


**Audience Management**
* Develop and maintain customer segments for media platforms like Google, Meta, and Snapchat
* Understand APIs and hashing methods or secure data sharing.
* Work with JSON formats, Python scripting, and perform basic server maintenance in Google Cloud


**Data Collection For MMM**
* Collect, manage, and oversee the quarterly data collection process for MMM, ensuring all relevant data points are accurately captured and processed
* Maintain communication with internal and external stakeholders to ensure timely data collection and processing
* Pre-process data files, primarily in CSV and Excel formats, for analysis


**Navigating The Cloud**
* Operate and manage tasks within the Google Cloud Platform, including virtual machines, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler, and BigQuery


**Technical Documentation And Compliance**
* Act as a liaison between IT, legal, and marketing team, ensuring data is handled per GDPR and other regulations
* Draft technical documentation such as Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) and Records of Processing Activities (ROPAs)


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Minimum 3 years’ experience on client or agency side, working with digital marketing and/or marketing technology
* MSc/BSc in Marketing, Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant fields
* Deep knowledge and understanding of the digital marketing landscape – both from a marketing and technical point of view
* Hands-On Experience with Media Buying Platforms, proficient in using platforms such as Google, Meta, Snapchat, and TikTok for media buying
* Deep understanding and knowledge of how to build, operate and maintain technology used by digital marketing (eg Google Analytics, GTM, DV360, SA360)
* Familiarity with Python, Node.js, PHP, SQL, JavaScript, HTML
* Knowledge of cloud functions and RESTful APIs
* Experience from working with analysis in a digital media context
* Proficiency in managing and analyzing large datasets, especially for marketing and sales performance evaluation
* Strong skills in Excel and CSV file processing
* Familiarity with SFTP servers for file handling
* Understanding of GDPR and data compliance requirements
* Experience in drafting and maintaining technical documentation and policies


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 23/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: Asap
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna or Copenhagen, and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.


 Come and fly with us!

title: Learning Producer
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for an experienced learning producer for an assignment in Enköping. The assignment involves part-time work on site in Enköping, and in Solna office if required.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Production of scripts for digital education Design and development of e-learning in Articulate Rise Production of instructional films for educational purposes


**Requirements:**
* Documented experience of e-learning production in Articulate Rise
* Previous experience of script production for digital education in Swedish
* Experience of film production, preferably with a focus on instruction and education
* The candidate will be security classified before the start of the assignment.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: PAM / CyberArk IT Security Consultant
description:
We are seeking an experienced
 **PAM/CyberArk IT Security Consultant** 
 to join our cybersecurity team. In this role, you will play a key part in supporting PAM developers through the full onboarding process by collaborating with application owners and service providers. You will collect and analyze relevant data to ensure an efficient onboarding pipeline and provide expert guidance on PAM best practices within the project.
 


**Key Responsibilities** 
* Collaborate with application owners, providers, and PAM developers to ensure smooth and secure onboarding.
* Provide subject matter expertise on
 **Privileged Access Management (PAM)** 
 throughout project phases.
* Gather, validate, and manage data required for efficient onboarding processes.
* Support change management and risk management initiatives related to PAM.
* Translate business requirements into technical solutions aligned with security standards.
* Promote and implement identity and PAM security best practices across on-premise and cloud environments.
* Work closely with DevOps teams in an
 **Agile/Scrum** 
 environment to deliver secure, scalable solutions.
* Contribute to documentation, analysis, and continuous improvement of PAM controls and processes.


**Required Qualifications** 
* Proven experience implementing and managing
 **PAM controls and requirements** 
 .
* Solid background in
 **risk management** 
 and
 **change management** 
 .
* Strong understanding of
 **identity and PAM security principles** 
 (e.g., SoD, Least Privilege, Zero Trust).
* Familiarity with
 **IT processes** 
 and the
 **system development lifecycle (SDLC)** 
 .
* Experience working in
 **Agile/DevOps** 
 teams.
* Knowledge of
 **cybersecurity frameworks** 
 such as CIS, COBIT, NIST, and ISO 2700x.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
* Strong analytical, organizational, and documentation abilities.
* Ability to bridge business and technical discussions effectively.
* Fluent in
 **English** 
 (spoken and written).


**Nice to Have** 
* Hands-on experience with
 **CyberArk** 
 solutions.
* Previous involvement in
 **PAM implementation or onboarding projects** 
 .

title: Ledare till Kundcenter
description:
***Vill du leda ett team som är hjärtat i våra kunddialoger och skapa förutsättningar för en ännu bättre kundupplevelse? Som Chef Kundcenter på Advania blir du en nyckelperson i att driva både det strategiska och operativa arbetet framåt – med människan, tekniken och framtiden i fokus. Tillsammans med dina medarbetare är du med och formar hur vi möter våra kunder på ett modernt, effektivt och kvalitativt sätt.***
 Ledare till Kundcenter på Advania 🚀
   

  

 I rollen som Ledare för Kundcenter leder du ett team och ansvarar för att skapa en trygg och engagerande arbetsmiljö där både teamet och kundupplevelsen står i centrum. Du driver förändringsarbete, följer upp mål och säkerställer kvalitet i våra interna processer.
   

  

  

* Ha personalansvar för teamets medarbetare
* Leda och utveckla det och operativa arbetet i Kundcenter
* Skapa en god arbetsmiljö där alla medarbetare får möjlighet att växa
* Arbeta med förändringsledning och utveckling av arbetssätt
* Följa upp nyckeltal och driva kontinuerliga förbättringar
* Bidra till digitalisering och automatisering av administrativa flöden
* Samverka brett med övriga affärsområden inom Advania


 Du kommer att arbeta och leda arbetet med fokus på ständig utveckling, både för teamet och våra kundprocesser.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och lyckas i rollen hos oss söker vi dig som har en bakgrund inom exempelvis konsultverksamhet, IT-leverans eller verksamhetsutveckling. Du arbetar idag i en roll som teamledare, projektledare eller linjechef – och har erfarenhet av att leda team, driva förändring eller arbeta nära kunder i utvecklande uppdrag.
   

  

 Du motiveras av att utveckla människor, skapa resultat tillsammans, driva förbättringar och bidra till helheten. Du trivs i en miljö där förändring är en del av vardagen, där kundrelationer är centrala och där vi samarbetar tätt över team- och kompetensgränser.
   

  

**Du vågar agera och stå för dina beslut, tar ansvar för resultat och utveckling, ser möjligheter och driver idéer framåt. Som Ledare hos oss innebär det att du har modet att fatta beslut i vardagen, vågar tänka nytt i hur vi levererar värde till kund och tar ansvar för att både team och affär utvecklas. Du inkluderar andra, bygger förtroende och skapar relationer som får människor och team att lyckas, en avgörande del av ditt ledarskap i en miljö där samarbete och tillit är grunden för att lyckas tillsammans.**
**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap
* God förståelse för digitala processer och systemstöd
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Vana av att arbeta med målstyrning, uppföljning och kvalitetsarbete


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi personlighet- och logiktester, och våra våra slutkandidater genomgår en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra hur just du kan bidra till vår resa. Hör gärna av dig om du har frågor eller vill veta mer innan du söker.
   

  

 Det är du som arbetar nära kunden som vet vad dem behöver och vad som blir den bästa lösningen för just deras unika behov, både i dag och i morgon. Därför tycker vi att det är du som ska fatta besluten. Det är genom att erbjuda säkra, hållbara och kundanpassade lösningar som vi skapar värde för kunderna och samhället i stort.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om hur våra medarbetare mår – på riktigt. Därför samarbetar Advania med Ljung & Sjöberg för att skapa en trygg, proaktiv arbetsmiljö med stöd kring alkohol-, drog- och beroenderelaterade frågor. Tillsammans bygger vi en hållbar arbetsplats där det är okej att be om hjälp, och där förebyggande arbete gör skillnad – för individen, teamet och företaget.
   

  

 I en miljö präglad av stort kundfokus och frihet under ansvar blir det extra viktigt för oss att bygga starka team bestående av ödmjuka stjärnor. Att arbeta i en inkluderande miljö, med kollegor och kunder som vill utvecklas, ger oss möjligheten att trivas och ha riktigt roligt på jobbet. Vi tror på en platt organisation med agilt arbetssätt och flexibilitet. Detta är det enda sättet för en hållbar framtid.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Chefsingenjör till CIO-enheten, Försvarsmakten
description:
Vill du bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Värdesätter du ömsesidigt förtroende, eget ansvar och goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling? CIO-enheten, en del av Försvarsstaben, söker nu chefsingenjör inom området informationssäkerhet med helhetssyn och resultatfokus.
   

  

**Försvarsstaben**
 Försvarsstaben stödjer överbefälhavaren med att handlägga och bereda ärenden på militärstrategisk nivå, samt säkerställer att beslut som fattas av myndighetens ledning genomförs, följs upp och återredovisas. Försvarsstaben ansvarar även för att omsätta regeringens styrning av Försvarsmakten till strategiska planer och för att inrikta försvarsgrens- och stridskraftschefer.
   

  

 CIO-enheten är en del av staben och leder arbetet med att omsätta Försvarsmaktens strategiska inriktning inom område informations- och kommunikationsteknik. Enhetens mål är att säkerställa myndighetssamordnad, robust och effektiv ledningsförmåga. ICT-styrningssektionen i CIO-enheten består av erfarna, professionella medarbetare som fokuserar på resultat genom samarbete, lösningsfokus och framåtanda.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som chefsingenjör inom informationssäkerhetsområdet har du ett delegerat ansvar inom den tekniska designverksamheten från Försvarsmaktens Tekniska chef inom ledningssystemområdet. Som chefsingenjör inom informationssäkerhetsområdet ansvarar du för att
   

  

* Genomföra uppgifter och fatta designbeslut i enlighet med tilldelat mandat.
* Stödja Försvarsmaktens Tekniska direktör och Teknisk chef Led i beredning och utarbetande av underlag för beslut inom den tekniska designverksamheten.
* Stödja Teknsik chef Led med systemsamordning, kravställning, designregler och granskning av tekniska system. Försvarsmaktens kravställning på tekniska system ska tillgodose verksamhetens krav samt gällande lagar och regelverk.
* Samverka med Försvarets Materielverk och Försvarsmaktens förband.
* Förvalta och utveckla design- och handlingsregler inom tilldelat ansvarsområde.
* Stödja vid hantering av it-incidenter.
* Stödja utvecklingen av processer och rutiner inom ramen för den tekniska designverksamheten.
* Delta i förekommande Natoarbete exempelvis standardisering


**KRAV**
**Kvalifikationer**
* Akademisk utbildning inom datateknik, informations- och kommunikationsteknik eller annan utbildning som Försvarsmakten bedömer som likvärdig.
* Minst fem års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT-området omfattande arbete med utveckling och förvaltning av system och tjänster för information och kommunikation
* God teknisk kunskap, kompetens och förståelse för informations-, IT- och cybersäkerhet samt god förmåga att tillämpa detta i framtagande och bedömning av lösningar för digitala tjänster
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av att självständigt hantera analys- och utredningsuppgifter inklusive att presentera resultat och slutsatser för ansvarig ledning
* Goda kunskaper i Office365
* Körkort B


**Personliga egenskaper**
 God förmåga att ta initiativ och driva ditt arbete självständigt. Du är en lagspelare och bidrar till en god stämning i arbetslaget. God förmåga att hantera flera olika uppgifter samtidigt, prioritera och arbeta strukturerat. Du är bra på att föra dialog och skapa samsyn även i större sammanhang. Du är prestigelös, vilket innebär att du är lyhörd för andras åsikter. Du har en god analytisk förmåga och omsätter erfarenheter och lärdomar till handling samt är resultat- och lösningsorienterad. Du bidrar till nytänkande och innovation och trivs i en arbetsmiljö i förändring. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete i statlig verksamhet eller större organisation
* Erfarenhet av arbete med utveckling och förvaltning av Försvarsmaktens tjänster och system för information och kommunikation med tillhörande infrastruktur
* Kunskap och kompetens inom ett eller flera av följande områden syftandes till IT-säkerhet: behovsfångst och kravhantering, teknisk kravställning, designspecifikation, lösningar för molntjänster, data- och informationshantering


**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, inleds med 6 månaders provanställning (för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten)
   

  

 Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Tillträdesdatum: snarast, enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Stina Levin.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter:**
 SACO: Stefan Ungerth
   

  

 SEKO: Monika Danielsson/Liselott Larsson
   

  

 Försvarsförbundet,
   

  

 OFRS: Kjell Tetzlaff
   

  

 OFRO: Roger Ericsson
   

  

 Samtliga nås på telefon: 08-788 75 00.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-11-21. Din ansökan bör innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.
   

  

 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 ----------------------------------------------------- Information om det rekryterande förbandet: I Högkvarteret finns överbefälhavaren och generaldirektören. Högkvarteret har ungefär 1 000 medarbetare – både yrkesofficerare och civila experter. Högkvarteret utgörs från 2023-01-01 av försvarsstaben, operationsledningen, militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten, samt Högkvarterets stabsavdelning och fristående enheter för tillsyn. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
* Start
* People

 Employee Log in Candidate Log in to Connect Homepage curemedia.com
   

  

 Mail
   

  

 Operations & Client Success
   

  

* Stockholm


 Creative Strategist
   

  

*****Cure Media is the leading influencer marketing agency in the Nordics, awarded as the Influencer Marketing Agency of the Year and ranked as the 3rd best tech platform globally.*****
*****We deliver
 ***measurable results to world-class brands such as L'Oréal, Kappahl, and Intersport.********
 We are experiencing a bright future and want to talk to you if you are passionate, driven, and want to join our journey to become the leading choice for brands and influencers across Europe. We are now looking for a
 ****Creative Strategist****
 to come join our Creative team!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* The possibility to work with one of the fastest-growing and most successful marketing methods globally.
* To work with global brands and leading tech solutions for influencer marketing.
* Become part of a passionate and high-performing team.
* Cure Media is working with thousands of influencers in several markets such as Sweden and the Nordics but also in Germany and UK.


**About Creative Strategist**
*Note: We will begin reviewing and responding to candidates in August. Thank you for your patience!*
 Are you the person who always spots the next trend
 *before* 
 it’s everywhere? Do you think in campaign concepts, moodboards, and enjoy making the idea come to life? Cure Media is looking for a
 **Creative Strategist** 
 to help shape influencer marketing campaigns that drive cultural relevance and brand results.
   

  

 As a Creative Strategist at Cure Media, you’ll drive the creative development of influencer marketing campaigns, from ideation to execution and project management. Your mission is to ensure that our clients’ creative influencer activations are well executed and creatively sharp – from A to Z.
   

  

**Your Tasks & Responsibilities**
* Drive creative ideation and concept development for influencer activation across verticals like lifestyle, fashion, beauty, food, family, and more.
* Manage the creative process from concept to delivery, demonstrating strong project management skills to keep timelines, expectations, and quality.
* Scout suppliers, locations, and participate in on-site creative direction during shoots, or recordings.
* Participate in client meetings and pitch ideas and concepts.
* Staying up-to-date and well-read on social media, marketing trends and consumer behavior.
* Create presentations, one-pagers, moodboards, and visualization of creative ideas.


**Who You Are**
* 2–3+ years of experience in a creative role within content, social media and marketing.
* A strong understanding of how brands connect with audiences on Instagram, TikTok, and beyond, including platform trends and algorithms.
* Strong project management skills, you’re comfortable leading timelines, coordinating between internal teams and suppliers, and making sure every creative detail is executed flawlessly.
* Strong visual storytelling skills, you know how to make a deck sing and sell an idea.
* Confidence in working with budgets, logistics and external partners.
* A team player with drive, energy and a love for making things happen.
* You speak and write fluently in Swedish and English.


**Other Perks & Benefits**
* The opportunity to become a partner through a shareholder program.
* Competitive salary, insurance, and pension plan.
* 6 weeks paid vacation per year.
* Generous health package.
* MacBook and iPhone.
* Annual conference trips (we’ve been to places like New York, Barcelona, and London).


**Start** 
 : ASAP (full-time)
   

  

**Hours:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Location & Reporting:** 
 You’ll be based in Stockholm as part of our Stockholm office.
   

  

 Do you have any questions about the role, the career development opportunities, or something else? Don't be a stranger, feel free to reach out!
   

  

 Please note that the application should be in English.
   

  

 Department Operations & Client Success Role Creative Strategist Locations Stockholm
   

  

 Contact Frida Ekholm Creative Lead – Operations & Client Success
   

  

 Colleagues
   

  

 Carlos Casquilho

 Jade D'econzac Mbay

* Lead Beauty Campaigns as Campaign Director at Cure Media Operations & Client Success

* Stockholm


 More jobs
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

 What about perks and benefits?
   

  

* Shared success


 We want everyone to have a share in our future success. Therefore we offer our employees a generous stock option plan, aligning everyone towards our shared goals and future achievements.
   

  

* Great development opportunities


 Since we are a fast-growing company in a fast-moving industry, our employees have great opportunities to evolve, both on a personal level as well as on their career path. Everyone is encouraged to nurture their individual talents and develop within areas they are passionate about.
   

  

* Fun at work


 We believe in celebrating our achievements and building strong team bonds. That’s why we organize bi-annual conference trips to exciting locations like Marbella, Barcelona, and London! Additionally, we have regular after-work events where we can unwind and enjoy each other's company.
   

  

* Reward and recognition


 We celebrate our successes and believe in rewarding hard work. We offer extra vacation days, competitive health packages, and generous pension plans to ensure our team stays healthy and happy.
   

  

 How's life at Cure Media?
   

  

 Our values—result-focused, brave, and passionate—are at the core of everything we do. Working at Cure Media is an exciting, evolving, and challenging experience. We strive to be the best in influencer marketing, and that requires dedication and a commitment to excellence.
   

  

 We pride ourselves not only on our industry-leading work but also on our vibrant company culture. From our renowned happy hour events to our supportive and energetic workplace, we cultivate a “can-do” attitude, serve great coffee, and prioritize being there for each other and our customers.
   

  

**About Cure Media**
 Cure Media is a leading independent Influencer Marketing company with global reach, focusing on the fashion, home, beauty and FMCG. We build successful influencer strategies for marketing teams and run campaigns with influencers on social platforms such as Instagram, TikTok and YouTube. Some of our clients are L'Oréal, Sephora, Kappahl and Wolt.
   

  

 Cure Media was awarded as the “Agency of the Year 2022” at the Influencer Marketing Summit. We've also been awarded “Best Large Influencer Marketing Agency” and “Best Influencer Marketing Platform” two years in a row at Global Influencer Marketing Awards. Additionally, we are certified by IAB as a Qualified Influencer Marketing Partner.
   

  

 Founded in 2014

title: Frontend Engineer - Web Acquisition
description:
**Join Aira's mission to transform Europe's energy future**
 Are you passionate about building exceptional web experiences that drive growth and build iconic brands? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us craft our digital front door with cutting-edge frontend technology!
   

  

 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to own the technical foundation of our public web platform. You'll make the calls on architecture, wrangle technical debt, optimise for performance at scale, and balance shipping fast with building right—working alongside growth and data to prove the impact. Your work sits at the heart of our business, where everyone, from leadership to the markets, feels invested.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Build our public web platform in React and Next.js. Own the technical decisions—from architecture choices to how fast we ship vs. how well we build.
* Work directly with growth and data to use real data to decide what's worth optimising and what's not.
* Own Core Web Vitals, SEO, and A/B testing infrastructure. Build the tools that let us test ideas quickly and measure what actually works.
* Implement a headless CMS that allows marketing and regional teams to publish content independently, eliminating the need for engineering assistance. Keep it performant and maintainable while giving them the flexibility they need.
* Deploy to Vercel, set up CI/CD, monitor metrics, and fix issues.
* Shape the product as much as the code. Beyond development, you’ll participate in discovery and decision-making — influencing how we reach 5 million homes by 2034.


**What You'll Bring To The Role**
* Vercel deployment experience — hands-on knowledge of edge functions, performance tools, and CI/CD best practices
* SEO mastery — deep knowledge of technical SEO and Core Web Vitals optimisation
* A/B testing & CRO — ability to set up experimentation frameworks and act on behavioural data
* Data-driven development — comfort working with analytics and using insights to shape technical decisions


**Professional Requirements:**
* 4 days per week in our Stockholm office
* Strong English communication skills
* Experience working in fast-paced, growth-focused environments


**Please note**
 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth
* Work with cutting-edge frontend technologies and modern development practices
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Juniora Analysts till Cyber (Stockholm) – Jan 2026
description:
Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 450 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå ambitiösa mål genom områdes- och branschexpertis, global räckvidd och allianser med de största tech-leverantörerna. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.
   

  

  




**Jobbeskrivning**

 Deloittes affärsområde Technology & Transformation Nordic är marknadsledande och samarbetar med beslutsfattare i globala och lokala organisationer. Inom Cyberteamet stöttar vi organisationer i deras utmaningar gällande strategiska cybersäkerhetsfrågor. Vi hjälper våra kunder med att förbättra processer, transformation, riskhantering, regelverksefterlevnad och internrevision.
   

  

  





 Som Analyst inom Cyberteamet får du möjlighet att arbeta med olika tjänster relaterade till cybersäkerhet både i Sverige och i Norden. Exempel på områden vi arbetar inom är att hjälpa våra klienter med sin cyberstrategi och roadmap baserat på nulägesanalyser, implementera robusta processer och verktyg som hjälper våra klienter vara motståndskraftiga mot aktuell hotbild och utveckla rätt typ av kontroller och mätbarhet för att följa upp och rapportera relevanta KPI’er till styrelse och externa intressenter. Vi jobbar således brett inom rådgivning, implementation och i vissa uppdrag tar vi mer operativa roller inom klienterna egna organisationer eller tillgodoser deras behov som en “outsourcingpartner”. Genom mixen av tjänster vi erbjuder och våra kunders förändrade behov kommer du över tid att bygga upp en bred erfarenhetsbas som spänner över många olika perspektiv för flera branscher i Sverige och Norden. Detta hjälper dig att utveckla kapacitet som matchar de senaste trenderna och utvecklingen i samklang med marknadens behov.
   

  

  





 Du kommer att få möjligheten att ta mycket eget ansvar tidigt och vara med och styra inriktningen på din karriär över tid. Arbetet innebär en hög grad av kundkontakt, med personer på mycket varierande befattningar vilket ger insyn i såväl styrelsebeslut som verksamhetsprocesser. Oavsett bransch, omfattning, vilken process eller del av en verksamhet vårt uppdrag rör, finns det en gemensam nämnare: Vårt arbete syftar till att hjälpa våra klienter bättre förstå och hantera sina cyber- och säkerhetsrelaterade risker och därigenom bli mer framgångsrika.
   

  

  




**Kvalifikationer**

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

  




* Är nyexaminerad inom systemvetenskap, cybersäkerhet, informationssäkerhet, är ingenjör eller ekonom med IT-inriktning.


 Meriterande:
   

  

  

* Goda akademiska meriter, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna
* Erfarenhet från jobb vid sidan av studier alternativt engagerad i studentförening.
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans i ett team, med målmedvetenhet, engagemang och driv
* Intresse för hur digitalisering och ny teknik kan utveckla verksamheter och branscher


 Du är en prestigelös lagspelare som trivs med att arbeta projektbaserat, i nära samarbete med både ditt team och klienter, i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

  


*Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.*



**Ytterligare information**

**Vi erbjuder**
  

 Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor som är experter inom sina områden. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär och kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.
   

  

  





 Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.
   

  

  





**Ansökan**
  

 Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:
   

  

  




* CV


* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.


 I det första steget laddar du upp ditt CV. I nästa steg laddar du upp dina universitetsbetyg (över hittills avklarade kurser) samt svarar på frågor som är kopplade till rollen, inklusive en motivering till varför du sökt denna roll. Observera att både CV samt fullständiga betyg behöver laddas upp för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Vi tillämpar löpande urval, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vid inskickad ansökan ska du få ett bekräftelsemejl från oss. Får du inte detta mejl råder vi dig att skicka in din ansökan på nytt. Om du söker flera tjänster hos oss ber vi dig att i dina ansökningar tydliggöra vilken roll du är mest intresserad av.
   

  

  


 Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/. För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.
   

  

  





**Frågor**
  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Johanna Aspegårdh, jaspegardh@deloitte.se
   

  

  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: Technical Project Manager - Technology & Plant Development
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.* 




*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.* 




 At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.
 



 Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.
 



  





**Technical Project Manager – Technology & Plant Development** 




 The Technical Project Manager will be in charge of driving various types of projects within the Technology and Plant Development team at Stegra, ensuring on-time delivery with the right quality while applying best practices in project management.
 



  





 Projects will range from techno-economic assessments of novel technologies, to sprints supporting the implementation of Stegra’s first phase in Boden, to leading workstreams across technology, infrastructure, permitting, and engineering for Stegra’s international pipeline of H2-DRI projects.
 



  





 You will lead and support engineers, analysts, and subject matter experts across multi-disciplinary teams, ensuring efficient execution and alignment with organizational objectives. This role offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of large-scale green industrial development, gaining insight into the build-up of a modern, sustainable steel industry, and contributing to decarbonization at scale.
 



  





**Role and Responsibilities** 




  




* Lead individual projects and workstreams within Technology and Plant Development, covering areas such as technology evaluation, process development, and plant design.



  




* Ensure successful delivery of concept and pre-FEED phases for novel green industrial projects, including scoping, budgeting, planning, team coordination, and follow-up.



  




* Manage external consultants, engineering partners, and suppliers to secure high-quality and timely deliverables.



  




* Oversee project performance against time, cost, and quality standards, providing regular updates to leadership.



  




* Support business case preparation, including technical inputs for investment decisions and strategic growth projects.



  




* Coordinate and prepare materials for Stegra’s strategic Technology Board, including presentations, decision papers, and progress reports.



  




* Contribute to strategic planning of Stegra’s technology roadmap, ensuring alignment between plant development and business objectives.



  




* Identify risks and implement mitigation plans to ensure project objectives are achieved.



  




* Drive continuous improvements in project management processes, documentation, and collaboration tools.



  




* Report directly to the Head of Plant and Technology Development.



  





**Requirements And Skills** 




  




* Master’s degree in mechanical, industrial, chemical, or electrical engineering, or equivalent technical discipline.



  




* 5–10 years of experience in technical project management, ideally within large capital projects or process industries.



  




* Solid understanding of engineering and project management workflows across pre-FEED, FEED, procurement, and execution.



  




* Proven ability to manage budgets, contractors, and consultants in demanding environments.



  




* Experience preparing high-quality presentations and decision materials for senior management or steering boards.



  




* Strong project leadership skills with experience in multicultural and cross-functional settings.



  




* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to align technical and business stakeholders.
* Highly structured, execution-oriented, and capable of balancing technical detail with project delivery.



  




* Passion for industrial decarbonization and the integration of new technologies into large-scale projects.



  





**Benefits At Stegra** 




 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
 



 You’ll receive fair, competitive compensation aligned with collective agreements, along with benefits like up to 30 days of paid vacation, occupational pension, parental benefits, and insurance. If you need support with relocation or immigration, our relocation department will help guide you through the process, whether it’s permits, housing or other practical matters. You can also enjoy perks like subsidized gym memberships and bike leases, plus the everyday benefits of life closer to nature.
 



  





**This is Stegra** 




 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
 



 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
 



  





**Our Stockholm Office** 




 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
 



  





*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.* 




  





*We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: Verification, Validation and Test Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 A career at Hitachi Rail will help create a legacy. With operations in every corner of the world, our work goes to the cutting-edge of digital transformation and technology. From the multi-cultural strength of our global organisation to the sustainable and innovative ways we work to bring people together, there’s something for everyone to get stuck into. And that’s where you come in.
   

  

**Description**
**About Us**
 Hitachi rail is a global provider of rail solutions. In Sweden, we are delivering advanced railway signaling systems that meet the highest safety and performance standards.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Verification, Validation and Test Engineer to join our team in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

 This position is lab based, focusing on testing signaling systems and subsystems prior to field integration.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Develop, execute and maintain test plans and specifications
* Configure and operate lab test environment (simulators, hardware)
* Perform functional, regression testing
* Record, analysis and report test results
* Ensure traceability between requirements and test cases
* Collaborate with design and development teams to clarify issues and support problem solving
* Follow EN 50126728/29 standards


**Team & Work environment**
* Small Local team - You'll be joining a compact on-site team in Solna, where your contribution is highly visible and you'll gain broad, hands-on experience
* International Collaboration - Much of our engineering support& development comes from Italy, so excellent communication skills and cultural awareness are essential
* Proactive mindset- We value engineers who work independently, identify solutions and drive activities forward


**What We're Looking For**
* 2-5 years’ experience in testing
* Understanding of the V-cycle and requirements-based testing
* Degree in Electrical, Electronics, Computer Engineering or related field
* Experience with test tools, simulators and lab se-ups
* Basic knowledge of railway signaling concepts
* Strong communication skills for multi-site cross-cultural collaboration


**Why Join Hitachi in Sweden**
* Be part of a small compact team where your work has direct impact
* Direct customer delivery- the results of your test go straight into real projects
