**Ta nästa steg i din karriär: Greenstep!**
 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast men senast
 **25 oktober** 
**2025.**
 Vi kan komma att begära utdrag ur belastningsregistret samt skuldfrihetsintyg som inhämtas från Kronofogdemyndigheten för personer som rekryteras till oss.

title: Funktionsansvarig
description:
**Att jobba som funktionsansvarig**
 I rollen som funktionsansvarig kommer du få ta ett helhetsansvar för våra infrastrukturella basplattformar inom Compute, Storage, Network och Datacenter området. Du blir en nyckelperson i att forma och förvalta Skandias nuvarande och framtidens tekniska plattformar samt processer där stort fokus ligger på långsiktighet och driftstabilitet.
   

  

 Du kommer att agera förvaltningsledare och ta ansvar för såväl strategisk inriktning som operativt ledarskap. Det innebär att du leder funktionens arbete i samverkan med både interna kollegor och externa leverantörer. En viktig del av ditt uppdrag blir att leda projekt med både tidplan och budget samtidigt som du driver tekniska initiativ och följer upp roadmap, förvaltningsplaner och resultat.
   

  

 Ansvarsområdet för rollen innebär bland annat att:
   

  

* Utforma, utveckla och förvalta funktionens arbetssätt, metoder, verktyg och kompetensbehov
* Leda och följa upp tekniska roadmaps, förvaltningsplaner och budget
* Säkerställa uppföljning av interna och externa leveranser enligt Skandias operativa processer
* Driva effektivisering och innovation i IT:s operationella processer
* Bevaka tekniktrender och aktivt bidra till vår strategiska utvecklingsplanering


 Den tekniska miljön är bred och under utveckling. Du kommer arbeta med:
   

  

* Compute & Storage: Virtualisering, Backup, SAN/NAS, Serverplattformar
* Network: Switching, Routing, Brandväggar, Lastbalansering, DNS/DHCP/IPAM
* Datacenter: Fysisk och virtuell infrastruktur, kapacitetshantering, automation


 Teamet du kommer tillhöra består av ett tiotal specialister som arbetar med Skandias applikations- och infrastrukturstöd. Gruppen ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och 3:e nivåsupport av infrastrukturnära plattformar. Vi sitter tillsammans i våra lokaler i Stockholm. Vår arbetskultur kännetecknas av kunskapsutbyte och ett teknikintresse där teamsamarbete står i fokus.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till IT-gruppchef applikation- och infrastruktur.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Ser vi att du har mångårig erfarenhet inom teknikområdet med fokus på infrastruktur, inklusive Compute, Storage, Network och Datacenter. Du har arbetat med teknisk projektledning eller liknande roller, där du tagit både det operativa och strategiska ansvar för drift, utveckling, samordning av infrastrukturella plattformar samt budget och planering. Likaså har du en vana att samverka med externa leverantörer och att arbeta nära både teknik, verksamhet och ledning. Din förståelse för informationssäkerhet är god där du känner till regelverk som DORA och ISO/IEC 27002. Ett grundkrav för rollen är att du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från bank/försäkringssektorn och certifiering inom SAFe eller ITIL.
   

  

 Du är driven och målinriktad person som tar initiativ och arbetar strukturerat. Din kommunikativa förmåga är viktig i rollen där samarbete både med interna och externa intressenter är betydande.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Alexander Larre på alexander.larre@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquistion Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Join Scatterin as a Business Development Intern / Part-Time Role!
description:
**About Us** 




 Scatterin is a KTH spin-off driving a paradigm shift in materials analysis to accelerate sustainable materials and process developments.
 



 Our data analysis platform and services make synchrotron and neutron X-ray facilities — the world’s most powerful microscopes — accessible for industrial R&D.
 



 Our technology enables companies to analyze real materials and components significantly faster and at higher resolution than conventional lab tools, cutting R&D time and cost while accelerating innovation in materials, energy, and manufacturing.
 



 We collaborate with global industry leaders and bridge cutting-edge science with industrial impact.
 



  





**Your role** 




 We are looking for a
 **proactive and motivated intern** 
 to support our business development activities.
 



 You will work closely with our leadership team to expand our market presence, strengthen partnerships, and drive new opportunities across Europe and beyond.
 



 It is a part-time position with 20-50% involvement, starting at your earliest convenience, as mutually agreed upon.
 



**Your main tasks:** 



* Prospect and identify potential customers and partners in Europe and beyond
* Support market research
* Assist in developing strategic partnerships and collaborations
* Engage in customer outreach and relationship management
* Contribute to social media, marketing, and communication campaigns
* Support strategic planning for entry into new market segments
* Support communication and documentation across ongoing business activities



  





**Who You Are** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s student in Engineering, Business, or related field.
* Preferably 3
 rd 
 - 5
 th 
 year student.
* Excellent written and spoken English (Swedish and/or additional language is a plus)
* Strong communication, coordination, and execution skills.
* Analytical mindset with interest in technology, science, and business.
* Curious, self-driven, and eager to learn in an international environment.
* Previous experience in similar activities (e.g. business development, market analysis, or communication) is a strong plus.
* Have valid Swedish working permit.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Experience in a deep-tech startup shaping the future of industrial materials innovation
* Direct exposure to international business development and high-tech commercialization
* Opportunity to work closely with founders and industry leaders
* Flexible work schedule, hybrid possibility, and office at KTH Campus
* Dynamic, supportive, and innovative team culture
* Compensation: hourly-basis part-time working
* Strong candidates will have the opportunity to join Scatterin as permanent team members, helping shape the future of materials analysis at a fast-growing deeptech startup.



  





**Join Our Journey** 




 If you are passionate about bridging cutting-edge technology with industry needs, driving innovation, and help industry shaping the future - Scatterin is the place for you.
 



 We believe in diversity and therefore welcome candidates of all backgrounds.
 



  
 



 To apply or inquire, contact:
 



 Ahmet Bahadir Yildiz, CEO – ahmet@scatterin.com
 



 Markus Holmström, Head of Business Development – markus@scatterin.com
 



 with your CV and short text expressing your interest and relevance with the position.
 



  





 Deadline: 15 November 2025.
 



 Interviews are conducted on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found. We therefore encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible, as the position may be closed earlier.

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Sweden
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**The Team:**
 The Account Executive, a pivotal member of our Nordic enterprise sales team, is dedicated to driving growth by acquiring new clients across Sweden. You will join a high-performing team focused on expanding our footprint in Sweden through strategic logo acquisition and market penetration. Leveraging top-tier products and effective sales strategies, the Account Executive collaborates closely with Value Engineers, Business Development Representatives, and other cross-functional teams to identify and capture high-value new business opportunities.
   

  

**The Role:**
 The primary objective is to build upon our existing momentum and further expand our market presence in Sweden by capitalizing on untapped opportunities. As an Account Executive specializing in new business sales, this role is integral to our strategy for expanding market share through targeted client acquisitions.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
* Discover and cultivate new business opportunities within a designated set of accounts within your assigned client portfolio.
* Establish and strengthen connections across various levels of the organization, engaging with executives and decision-makers to understand their needs.
* Comprehend the strategic and operational requirements of your target accounts and proficiently articulate how Celonis can address them.
* Guide the sales journey, adhering to a structured approach through prospecting, initial contact, qualification, client engagement, needs analysis, solution proposal, and ultimately closing deals.
* Collaborate with Value Engineering or personally conduct comprehensive presentations and demonstrations tailored to specific use cases, showcasing the value of our solutions.
* Forge strong partnerships, particularly with leading consulting firms, SaaS partners, and the Big4.
* Work closely with your virtual team, which includes business development representatives, value engineers, partner managers, and marketing specialists, to ensure seamless collaboration and success.


**The qualifications you need:**
* Demonstrated success in Software as a Service (SaaS) sales, particularly in roles focused on both expanding existing business opportunities and cultivating new business opportunities.
* Proven ability to navigate complex sales cycles involving multiple decision-makers.
* Track record of selling enterprise-level software applications to C-level stakeholders.
* Experience collaborating with partners, such as consulting firms or providers of enterprise technology solutions.
* Fluency in English & Swedish


**What Celonis Can Offer You:**
* Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.
* Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.
* Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more. Interns and working students explore your benefits here.
* Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.
* Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
* Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
* Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
* Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.


**About Us:**
 Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

**Celonis Inclusion Statement:**
 At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that “The Best Team Wins”. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Accessibility and Candidate Notices
   

  

 By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.
   

  

 Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Mobile applications
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 




  






 We are looking for a talented mobile app developer to join our team in Stockholm. You will be working with us to build mobile applications in Flutter, with native components interfacing with the platform at a lower level. While previous Flutter experience is not required, you should be motivated to learn. You should have a background in developing mobile apps for either iOS or Android, as you will also contribute native code for the platform you know best. An enthusiasm for cryptography, secure systems, and solving challenging technical problems will make you an excellent fit.
 




  






  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Design, build, and maintain mobile applications (Flutter) with native components in iOS (Swift/Objective-C) or Android (Kotlin/Java)
* Participate in architecture discussions and contribute to technical decision-making
* Debug and resolve issues across devices and platforms
* Write and maintain unit and integration tests
* Continuously learn and apply new tools, frameworks, and best practices



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Bachelor or MS in Computer Science or a relevant technical discipline, or equivalent work experience
* Experience in building mobile apps with rich user interfaces
* Experience with native app development on iOS and/or Android
* Ability to write code that is secure, readable, testable, and easy to maintain
* Able to take initiative, maintain a positive attitude, be self-motivated, and work effectively on projects with minimal direct supervision



  




**Bonus Qualifications:** 
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Github Actions)
* Experience working with NFC/USB/Lightning communication
* Experience with cryptography (PKI, digital signatures, etc)
* Experience working with open source and the open source community
* Experience with Flutter






  




  


 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Product Development Leader(7)
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 BCSS CNE Security Engineering, we are responsible for the full spectrum of product security across the entire business area, including driving security into products and services that will be used across the globe. We are now looking for someone who can help us ensure that the networks of the future are protected from Cyber Attacks, resilient enough to survive disasters, and use the latest security technologies. The candidate should be someone who enjoys a challenge, is willing to learn new things and loves working in a team. Ideally, they will have a passion for technology and have strong knowledge of cybersecurity, cloud environment, and the ability to see how their actions can impact the bigger picture. This position will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Develop and articulate a clear vision for product security, ensuring alignment with organisational goals and industry standards and regulations (e.g., GSMA NESAS, 3GPP, NIST, GDPR). Champion a security-first mindset across engineering, product, and business teams.
* Represent product security in executive and cross-functional governance forums, influencing decision-making and securing buy-in from diverse stakeholders.
* Develop and manage product security requirements aligned with Ericsson strategic objectives, regulatory requirements, and industry best-practice.
* Collaborate with internal security teams to define security requirements considering efficacy, testability, and development efficiency.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure security requirements and mitigations are understood and implemented.
* Support Security Champions, Experts and Senior Experts in Product Security, and the Head of Engineering & Technology with bringing the BCSS wanted position for Security to reality.


**The skills you bring:**
* At least 5+ years’ experience working with security-related activities in areas such as Product Management, Customer-facing security, Operations, Product Development, Incident Response, and/or Service Delivery.
* Interest in and knowledge of the security domain and related fields, for example, privacy, cyber defense, threat modeling, vulnerability management, and how these domains relate to organizations like Ericsson
* Proven Cloud and Software Services/Product Security domain competence or proven experience in security from large enterprises
* Experience in secure product development, threat modeling, and vulnerability management.
* Strong knowledge within one or more areas of cloud security (Kubernetes, Docker, multi-cloud), DevSecOps, security automation, security protocols, cryptographic functions, and networking (IP, VxLAN, Routing, SDN).
* Proven ability to communicate complex security topics to both technical and business audiences.
* Relevant security certifications (e.g., CISSP).
* Familiarity with 3GPP, ETSI, NIST, GSMA security standards and telecom regulatory frameworks.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams in a technology-driven environment.


**Behavior Competencies:**
* Build strong relationships and networks across teams.
* Deliver measurable outcomes and drive results.
* Self-motivated, able to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
* Present complex messages and customer value clearly.
* Organized, adaptable, and able to identify opportunities in ambiguous situations.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 756602

title: Management Trainee - Bond Health Group
description:
*Bond Health Group is building the next generation of health solutions. We believe that physical and mental and health are among the most important challenges of our time. Rather than addressing each issue in isolation, we embrace a holistic approach. Our mission is to improve people's health and wellbeing on all fronts. We believe that only by connecting with one another and working together can we truly make a difference.*
*We currently serve more than 230,000 people in Sweden, Norway and Denmark with our services through STC, Bruce Studios and Aspire Health Hub, but we are on a growth journey and more solutions will come.*
 Now, we’re looking for a driven Management Trainee to join our journey, based at our HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As our Management Trainee, you’ll be at the heart of Bond Health Group’s mission to scale our businesses and drive innovation. You’ll work closely with and report directly to our CEO, gaining unique insights into strategic decision-making and the inner workings of a fast-growing wellness group.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role that will expose you to a broad range of challenges and opportunities across our group – from strategy and analysis to project execution and operational improvements. Every day will bring something new, and you will be expected to quickly plug into different situations, find solutions, and ensure progress.
   

  

 Examples of projects you may take part in:
   

  

* Strategic initiatives that shape the future of the group – including market analysis, business case development, and implementation.
* Operational improvements to enhance how we work – such as process optimization, data-driven decision-making, and cross-functional collaboration.
* Innovation sprints and growth projects – whether it is new business ideas, geographic expansion, acquisitions and business partnerships
* Executive support – assisting in day-to-day management tasks, spanning from coffee making to preparation of Board meetings.


 This is a demanding yet highly rewarding role designed to accelerate your professional growth. Over the course of six months, you will build a strong foundation in business leadership, strategic execution, and operational scaling. In addition to that, you will have great fun working with passionate people in a dynamic environment.
   

  

**What We Want You To Bring**
 We are looking for someone who is naturally curious and fast to learn - someone with a growth mindset who thrives in a dynamic, fast-changing environment. You enjoy solving problems with limited guidance and have a sharp analytical mind, but you are also pragmatic and hands-on - committed to taking assignments from start to finish. You take initiative, work independently, and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves for even the simplest tasks.
   

  

 At your core, you are a down-to-earth and collaborative team player who builds trust easily and communicates clearly. You know how to turn insights into action and are comfortable navigating ambiguity in a growing organization. It is essential that you share our passion for the services we provide. Our team is diverse in many aspects, our working language is English/Scandinavian, and we see that every person joining us brings something new to the mix.
   

  

**Your background:**
* A bachelor degree in business, engineering or similar, completed no later than December 2025.
* Good understanding of financial accounting and analysis (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash flow)
* Experience from Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Private Equity or Business development is a merit
* Fluency in English and one other Nordic language
* Solid skills in Google Sheets/Excel and Google Slides/PowerPoint.


**Recruitment process**
 We review applications continuously, so don’t wait to apply – we’re excited to meet our next star!
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role, feel free to reach out to Josef Bexell at josef.bexell@bond-healthgroup.com.
   

  

 Last day of application: 2025-11-09
   

  

 First day of work: The ambition is to have our Management Trainee ready to start in mid-January 2026, with some room for flexibility.
   

  

**About Bond Health Group**
 Bond Health Group is a leading Nordic preventive health group founded in 2024. The group is owned by the Axel Johnson family (Novax) and operates through three distinct subsidiaries:
   

  

 STC (Scandinavian Training Center) – one of Sweden’s largest gym chains with over 250 locations
   

  

 Bruce Studios – a flexible membership platform offering access to 1000+ gyms, yoga studios, climbing centers, and more across Sweden, Norway, and Denmark.
   

  

 Aspire Health Hub – a digital platform for employers to manage and promote employee wellness through data-driven insights and integrated fitness services.
   

  

 With a combined membership base of over 230,000 individuals and a growing B2B offering, Bond Health Group is scaling rapidly across the Nordics. Our ambition is to redefine wellness – at the gym, at home, outdoors, and in the workplace – by delivering smart, inclusive, and engaging health solutions.

title: Technical Project Manager - Oceanbird
description:
AlfaWall Oceanbird AB is a 50/50 joint venture, owned by Alfa Laval and Wallenius but operated as an independent company. Our strong mother companies provide valuable insights into shipping and industrial production and enable us to have a long-term perspective. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encouraging applicants of all backgrounds to apply.
   

  

 Oceanbird is now moving into the commercialization phase of our wing sails. During the coming months we will install a full-scale wing on an oceangoing vessel, at the same time, ramping up for commercial contracts.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 We are looking for a dynamic and experienced individual to coordinate customer projects. You will coordinate deliverables against vessel owners, engineering firms, yards and classification societies with the aim of installing our wing sails onboard large oceangoing vessels. On a day-to-day basis you will also work closely across the teams internally.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As part of a small technical multidisciplinary team, you will take on diverse tasks and responsibilities in international projects of varied complexity and scale, such as:
   

  

* Navigate through the exciting and challenging field of naval architecture.
* Coordinate the project implementation and liaise with the external stakeholders.
* Ensure the project deliverables alignment between the teams internally.
* Coordinate with teams to develop the project schedule and detailed work breakdown.
* Initiate and lead feasibility studies.
* Support in carrying out approval procedures.
* Plan, coordinate and supervise on-site installation and commissioning in Europe & Asia.
* Organize and manage activities related to service.


**Who are you?**
**To Succeed In This Role, You Should Have**
* Practical experience in large projects, commissioning, or service operations.
* A high technical interest, solution driven and adaptable.
* A good understanding of product development processes.
* Strong communication, problem-solving and time management skills.
* A degree or demonstrated experience in mechanical engineering, naval architecture, electrical engineering, marine engineering or maritime background.
* Experience of mechanical CAD, preferably CREO.
* An interest in sustainability and a willingness to contribute to a better future.


**What do we offer?**
 A chance to be a part of something bigger and make a real change, and at the same time having a workplace that is characterized by a positive atmosphere.
   

  

**Our Core Values Are**
***Pioneering Spirit***
 - We dare to challenge the conventional and break new ground. As pioneers, we empower a revolution.
   

  

***Natural forces***
 - The power in the wind, in people, in ideas – the natural forces surrounding us all are waiting to be harvested.
   

  

***Fun & Passion***
 - It´s harder to fly alone – only together can we make a difference. Cooperation and shared passions build our strong team spirit.
   

  

***Dedication***
 - Dedicated to high-quality and robustness, to offer the right help on sustainability journeys, to be the best. Dedicated to making change.
   

  

**For More Information About The Position, Please Contact**
 Emil Kotz, Manager Customer Projects, emil.kotz@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Regina García Moguel, Talent Acquisition Partner, regina.garciamoguel@alfalaval.com
   

  

**Union information**
 Anders Jansson, Unionen, Anders.Jansson@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Axel Scharing, Akademikerna, Axel.Scharing@alfalaval.com
   

  

 We review applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to submit yours by
 **November 10th, 2025** 
 , at the latest. Please be aware that the application process may close earlier if we identify suitable candidates, so don’t delay in applying.
   

  

 Please note that, in compliance with GDPR, we cannot accept applications submitted via email.

title: Partnerships Sales Manager
description:
*Are you looking for a place where ambition meets real impact? Do you have a proven track record of building strong partnerships? Are you ready to take your career to the next level in a fast-growing start-up? Continue your growth at Grale - an award-winning green tech company redefining sustainable materials.* 




  





*Now, we’re growing our team and looking for an exceptional* 
***Partnership Sales Manager***
*. At Grale, you’ll have the freedom and support to grow - with the opportunity to shape your role, develop new skills, and advance your career as we scale globally.* 




  





**Partnership Sales Manager** 




 Grale’s unique offering combines sustainability and brand visibility. Our partners use our eco-friendly products as marketplaces for their brands - placing their message where people live, move, and consume. As a Partnership Sales Manager, your role is to build and sell these opportunities, helping brands reduce their plastic footprint while amplifying their reach in meaningful, visible ways. As a Partnership Sales Manager you’ll be helping companies reduce their plastic footprint while amplifying their brand impact
 



  





 You will be responsible for creating, developing, and managing commercial partnerships that generate revenue, strengthen brand positioning, and deliver measurable business value for both Grale and our clients.
 



  





**Main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 



* Identify and engage potential partners and clients across key sectors.
* Building strong relationships with key decision-makers (often marketing managers, brand leads, HR or Employee engagement managers, agency representatives, event managers, franchises etc.)
* Design and pitch tailored offerings – Sell and package Grale’s partnership and brand placement opportunities, positioning our products as a marketplace for visibility and awareness.
* Negotiate and close deals and long-term strategic collaborations.
* Coordinate with internal teams (e.g. product, logistics, design) to ensure flawless execution.
* Stay ahead of trends in sustainable marketing, eco-innovations, brand activations and partnerships.



  





 This role has no limits - a partnership could include anything from office product transitions and employee engagement programs to brand activations, festivals, campaigns, and educational initiatives that inspire both employees and customers, turning sustainability goals into measurable action.
 



  





**What you bring:** 



* B2B sales experience preferably from media, events, partnerships, or brand activations.
* A proven track record of building high-value partnerships.
* Experience with CRM systems (we work with hubspot) and a structured, data-driven approach to pipeline management.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.



  





**We also see that you:** 



* Are results-driven and motivated by closing deals and building long-term customer relationships.
* Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
* Are both strategic and operational, comfortable running the entire sales cycle yourself.
* Are a self-starter with a hands-on attitude: you like to take initiative and own your results.
* Are passionate about sustainability and want to help drive meaningful change.



  





**What you get:** 



* The chance to be part of a fast-growing startup making measurable environmental impact.
* Work alongside award-winning founders featured on
 **Forbes 30 under 30** 
 and awarded
 **Prince Daniel Fellowship.**
* Shape a global brand from the ground up.
* Beautiful, modern office in the heart of Stockholm.
* Free daily breakfast.
* Wellness grant + access to gym and health activities.
* Weekly after works and a collaborative, high-energy culture.
* Opportunities for professional and personal development.



  





*Imagine a world where our oceans are free from plastic and our planet thrives. At* 
***Grale***
*, we’re not just imagining it - we’re building it. Plastics are made from petroleum and stay in our environment for thousands of years. By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the sea. We’re here to change that - and we’re looking for passionate people to join us.* 




  





*🏆 Grale has been awarded as the* 
***World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup***
*- selected from 1,400 companies globally* 




  





*🥇 Awarded prestigious* 
***Global Tech Innovator***
*- chosen among 2,000 technology companies worldwide* 




  





**Interested?** 




 We are interviewing continuously with the aim of filling the position as soon as possible. Apply today to join a team shaping a sustainable future! 🌱

title: Junior systemutvecklare inom Bildbehandling – Teknisk Fysik
description:
Vill du omsätta din tekniska fysik-bakgrund i praktiken och jobba med avancerad bildbehandling i en miljö där mjukvara möter hårdvara? Har du ett analytiskt sinne, gillar att lösa komplexa problem och vill utvecklas i ett högteknologiskt företag i världsklass? Då kan det här vara ett perfekt första steg i din karriär.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN** 




 Vi söker en junior teknisk fysiker (eller motsvarande) som vill arbeta i ett team med erfarna ingenjörer inom bildbehandling, systemdesign och kalibrering. Du får möjlighet att utveckla avancerade algoritmer, arbeta nära industriell utrustning och snabbt se effekten av dina lösningar i praktiken.
 



  





 I rollen får du bland annat jobba med Python, Matlab, OpenCV och NumPy, och du blir en viktig del i att utveckla interna systemverktyg som används i företagets avancerade produktionsmiljö.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckla interna systemverktyg för bildanalys och kalibrering
* Ta fram krav, bygga prototyper och implementera bildbehandlingsalgoritmer
* Arbeta med filtrering, transformationer, kantdetektering och funktionsutvinning
* Integrera bildbehandlingspipelines i befintlig mjukvaruarkitektur
* Testa och optimera lösningar direkt på avancerad industriell utrustning
* Samarbeta med systemingenjörer och utvecklare för att säkerställa effektiva och praktiska lösningar



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM** 



* Har en civilingenjörsexamen inom teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Är nyutexaminerad eller har upp till ett par års erfarenhet
* Trivs med att förstå och förbättra system på både mjukvaru- och hårdvarunivå
* Talar och skriver engelska obehindrat (svenska är meriterande)



  





 Vi tror att du är nyfiken, analytisk och gillar att förstå hur saker fungerar på djupet. Du tar gärna egna initiativ, trivs i ett kunnigt team och vill utvecklas tillsammans med andra. Det viktigaste är inte att du redan kan allt — utan att du har rätt inställning, vilja att lära och ett stort teknikintresse.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag på cirka ett år (med chans till förlängning) vilket innebär att du kommer att vara anställd av Friday.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 




 Omfattning: Tillsvidare
 



 Start: Enligt överrenskommelse
 



 Placering: Stockholm
 



 Rekryteringsansvarig: Anna Persson
 



 Lön: Marknadsmässig
 



 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: Senior Information Security Analyst
description:
**About Gelato** 




  





 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**The position** 




  





 Following our global expansion, we are looking for a passionate Senior Information Security Analyst to join our effort of protecting Gelato and, most importantly, our customer's data.
 



 We are looking for a person who wants to make the Gelato platform safer for millions of users around the world. We’d love to talk to you if you’re a talented individual who is passionate about finding security weaknesses and crafting scalable and usable solutions. We are enablers who make it easier for engineers to create secure-by-design services, not blockers.
 



 Reporting directly to the VP of Information Security, you will work closely with Product Managers and Tech Engineers.
 



  





**What you'll be doing** 




  




* Collaborate closely with Product Design and Software Engineering to align with security features, roadmaps and ensure timely delivery.
* Identify vulnerabilities and develop innovative, scalable solutions to enhance our defense-in-depth strategy. This involves conducting vulnerability scans and penetration testing.
* Promote a security-conscious culture by educating all Gelato employees on security best practices.
* Monitor and respond to security incidents, including the regular analysis of potential threats.
* Identify, document and measure security risk, effectively communicate these risks to senior leadership, and influence remediation plans.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to provide timely response and escalation for security incidents outside of business hours, ensuring continuous protection and monitoring coverage.
* Develop, tune, and maintain security monitoring and detection systems (IAM, SIEM, SOAR, WAF, EDR) to identify suspicious activity, anomalies, and potential threats.
* Manage the full vulnerability management lifecycle, including identification, prioritisation, remediation tracking, and verification of closure.
* Contribute to security architecture reviews and the design, deployment, and hardening of security controls across infrastructure, cloud, and applications.
* Introduce automation and orchestration to streamline detection, response, and compliance activities through scripting (Python, PowerShell, Bash).
* Support governance and compliance activities such as audit preparation, evidence collection, and control testing against frameworks like ISO27001, SOC 2, NIST CSF, and CIS Controls.
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing secure AWS cloud architectures.
* Integrate AI and LLM technologies into daily security workflows to automate repetitive analysis, improve threat detection, and support rapid incident response.



  





**Who you are** 




  




* A degree (Master’s is a plus) in Computer Science, a similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
* Broader certification coverage, including CISSP, CISM, GIAC (GCIH, GCIA, GCFA), CCSP, or equivalent advanced credentials.
* 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity, with at least 3 years in hands-on incident response, detection, or vulnerability management roles.
* Proven experience with SIEM, WAF, IAM, SOAR, EDR, and vulnerability management tools.
* Cloud security specialisation, ideally with certifications such as AWS Security Specialty
* Demonstrated expertise in incident response, including investigation, containment, and coordination across cross-functional teams.
* Embraces an AI-first mindset, leveraging AI and LLM tools to drive efficiency and innovation in daily work.
* Strong crisis management and communication skills, able to remain composed under pressure and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Good understanding of implementation requirements for ISO27001 and/or SOC2.
* Strong practical automation and scripting capabilities using Python, PowerShell, or Bash to enhance detection and response efficiency.
* Experience designing and implementing production services, APIs, or security-specific libraries.
* Familiarity with cloud solutions, including AWS and GCP, and prior experience with tools like Cloudflare, ELK stack, and Burpsuite Professional, as well as scripting and programming skills, are required.
* Strong strategic thinking, planning, and organisational skills.
* Fluency in English with excellent verbal and written communication abilities is a mandatory requirement.



  





 To be successful in this role, you will need to have a start-up mentality. You are committed to excelling with energy, ownership, and endurance, understanding that building a secure global platform is challenging but deeply rewarding work. You are naturally curious and forward thinking, embracing an AI-first mindset and leveraging AI and LLM tools to enhance decision making and innovation in your work. You have superior communication and interpersonal skills, high integrity, and strong attention to detail. You are a confident and collaborative leader who thrives in complex environments, capable of making sound decisions under pressure while maintaining a calm and structured approach.
 



  





 You are passionate about technology, curious by nature, and motivated by the constant evolution of cybersecurity. You enjoy solving complex problems, automating solutions, and continuously improving processes to stay ahead of emerging threats. You take initiative and excel with minimal direction, proactively identifying risks and opportunities to strengthen Gelato’s security posture.
 



  





 You likely have a background in network administration, DevSecOps, or software development, and have progressed into a senior role where you’ve led investigations, incident response efforts, or designed security controls for cloud and enterprise environments. You’re comfortable being part of an on-call rotation, supporting critical security incidents, and mentoring others in best practices.
 



  





 You combine technical depth with strategic perspective, capable of zooming out to align with business objectives while still diving deep to resolve complex security challenges. You are a team player who brings both expertise and humility, eager to contribute to Gelato’s mission of making the world’s production more sustainable and secure.
 



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




  





 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Security Test Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 BCSS CNE Security Engineering, we are responsible for the full spectrum of product security across the entire business area, including driving security into products and services that will be used across the globe. We are now looking for someone who can help us evolve our security testing processes and tools, automated measurement of product security controls and overall. The candidate is someone who possesses a strategic mindset, able to develop and communicate a vision for security functional test automation that aligns with long-term organizational goals. Ideally, he/she has proven experience in feature testing and test automation within CI/CD environments, with a strong grasp of security protocols, cryptographic functions, and networking. This position will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Drive and execute the vision for automated product security testing, including adapting and improving existing testing processes and tools to support evolving business and technology needs.
* Drive the design of standardized test specifications for security features for the needed security features.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess, define, and maintain the common security test cases applicable to telecom products.
* Define key security metrics to measure product security and assurance. Track and monitor the results of the security tests, considering aspects such as compliance, efficacy, and congruency.
* Provide detailed reports, including proof of execution, to be shared with executive teams and/or end customers.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze business security requirements for product security testing and propose suitable AI-driven (LLM, RL, …) solutions.
* Work closely with product teams to ensure continuous enhancements of the security test cases and tools.
* Be up to date with all urgent security vulnerabilities, the security technologies, efficient AI algorithms, and testing strategies.
* Work closely with operations and development teams to ensure security testing with cost efficiency.
* Evaluate and report on leading technology and tools, providing input to investment decisions.


**The skills you bring:**
* Proven experience in feature testing and test automation within CI/CD environments. Pentesting qualifications are merited
* Strong analytical skills, able to quantify product security posture and deliver measurable, actionable results through automated testing
* Experience with AI tooling and automation frameworks
* Strong knowledge of security protocols, cryptographic functions, and networking (IP, VxLAN, Routing, SDN)
* Experience with cloud-native platforms and virtual machines
* Familiarity with 3GPP SCAS standards
* Master’s degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity


**Behavior Competencies:**
* Results-oriented with a strong drive to deliver measurable outcomes.
* Excellent relationship-building and networking skills.
* Self-motivated and able to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
* Is organized, adaptable, and able to identify opportunities in ambiguous situations, continuously improving testing processes to support evolving business and technology needs.
* Strong presentation skills with the ability to convey complex messages and customer value.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 756604

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**Business Development Manager – Transplant Care**
**Location: Sweden and Nordics**
 After successful development of the portfolio in the US, Getinge are excited to bring the Paragonix Transplant Care (TC) portfolio to the European market, and you can be a part of this journey! The Transplant Care portfolio has been transforming transplantation with novel systems that better protect human organs for their journey through transplantation to a human donor.
   

  

 We are excited to be recruiting for a newly created position for a Business Development to join us covering Transplant Care across Sweden and the Nordics. In this key, field-based role you will be responsible for all the commercial activity for Transplant Care across the region, providing expert knowledge, building strong business relationships and support for implementation and end users.
   

  

**Job Duties And Responsibilities**
* Achieve agreed targets, focused on revenue growth and profitability.
* Put together proposals, tenders and contracts for potential customers.
* Drive multiple new business initiatives, gather marketing intelligence, drive projects, and create business models to assess the feasibility of TC opportunities.
* Maximize Order Intake, Margin, Market Share and Customer Satisfaction for the TC Product Area portfolio and provide quality funnel visibility including forecast accuracy, installed-base protection and win/loss analyses.
* Identify and nurture relationships with key stakeholders to enable and progress sales.
* Daily hospital visits to relevant accounts.
* Attendance at domestic and international workshops, congresses and symposia relevant to TC.
* Work with relevant domestic entities responsible for organ procurement, transplantation and reimbursement in liaison with OUS Product Management.
* Create unique sales activity methods to accelerate sales with customers.


**Who You Are**
 At Getinge, we are Game Changers, Forward Thinkers and Team Players. We're looking for passionate individuals, who are agile, resilient, take responsibility for their development and focus on achieving excellence. They never compromise on quality and always act responsibly remembering that our customers always come first. They enjoy collaboration and working in diverse and international teams and embrace the future.
   

  

**What You Bring**
* At least 5 years’ experience in the Medical Device arena, ideally within a similar area of TC i.e. cardiothoracic/cardiac and/or abdominal.
* Experience in new business development/sales within the medical device market.
* Ideally someone coming from a clinical/technical background within the TC arena.
* Willingness to travel throughout the relevant territory daily.
* Willingness to travel internationally: approximately 15%.
* Must have the right to work and live in the required territory.
* Must hold a valid driver's license.


**Our Benefits**
 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness and family friendly programmes. We do our best to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

 Please note the benefits for Getinge employees may differ due to region and local legal requirements. Please feel free to reach out to Courtney Williams – courtney.williams@getinge.com for more information on the employee benefits available in your country.
   

  

 To help meet our goals of becoming CO2 neutral by 2025, we travel only if we must. In this role, you will be required to travel up to: 60% to meet the requirements of your role.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Systemingenjörer SCADA
description:
**Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.**
 Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till en grönare framtid? Som systemingenjörer SCADA en del av Granitor Systems, blir du en viktig del av ett kompetent och engagerat team. Vi arbetar med externa kunder inom energisektorn och strävar efter att skapa hållbara energilösningar för framtiden. Detta är en unik möjlighet att delta i uppdrag som påverkar Europas elmarknad, med fokus på innovation och energiomställning. Om du vill utveckla ett starkare, smartare och grönare energisystem – ansök nu! Vi välkomnar alla sökande, även om inte alla krav uppfylls, eftersom vi tror på mångfald och utveckling inom teamet.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen som systemingenjör kommer du att arbeta med kundens SCADA-systemet. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar bland annat databasunderhåll, Arbetsuppgifterna i detta uppdrag innebär att genomföra PTP-tester i labbmiljö. Teamet för PTP-tester kommer att bestå av en testledare från kunden.
   

  

 Kontinuerligt under projektets gång valideras migrerade data och bilder i syfte att säkerställa kvalitén. En viktig aktivitet under slutfasen av valideringsarbetet är punkt-till-punkt tester (PTP-tester). Dessa går ut på att testa fjärrhanterade objekt mellan kundens nätstationer och det nya systemet.
   

  

 Efterleva Granitor Systems värderingar om säkerhet och integritet, och bidra till en positiv arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Bakgrund**
* Högskoleexamen med teknisk inriktning.
* Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med elkraft
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med drift- och övervakningssystem (SCADA system).
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av punkt-till-punkt tester eller andra strukturerade tester i SCADA-system eller andra industriella IT-system som vi bedömer som relevant.
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med kontrollanläggning i nätstationer och/eller stations RTU (Remote Terminal Unit) och/eller kommunikation mellan nätstation och driftcentral.
* God skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
 Kollektivavtal och flexibel arbetstid.
   

  

**Bra Att Veta**
**Placering:** 
 Stockholm Omfattning: heltidstjänst
   

  

**Säkerhetsprövning:** 
 Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning hos oss kan det vara ett krav på
 **svenskt medborgarskap** 
 i vissa befattningar. Säkerhetsprövning av kandidaten kan komma att krävas!
   

  

**Beredskap/Jour**
 Beredskap eller jour kan innebära att du ingår i en beredskapsgruppering och har ansvar att vara tillgänglig under vissa tider. Hur ofta detta inträffar beror på hur många personer som ingår i teamet – ju fler personer, desto mer fördelas beredskapstiden.
   

  

**Kontaktperson**
 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef), siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocess**
 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu!
   

  

 Granitor Systems AB är en del av Granitor-gruppen, en svensk företagsgrupp som är verksam inom fastighetsutveckling och förvaltning, entreprenad, konsult och underhåll samt tillväxtinvesteringar i utvecklingsbolag. Här jobbar 3300 medarbetare som tillsammans skapar välmående samhällen och industrier. Granitor-gruppen hade 2023 en omsättning på 7500 MSEK.

title: Accounting Assistant
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for an Accounting Assistant that wants to be a part of our growth journey. As a member of the Finance team, you will be a part of a small yet pivotal team, that plays a key role in the external financial reporting, as well as contributing to our internal projects that drives scalability and efficiency across the Group.
   

  

 In this role, you will report directly to the Finance Manager in Sweden while also collaborating closely with a large global network of colleagues — including accountants, tax specialists, and business controllers. Together with two teammates, you will form the Swedish Accounting team, responsible for all accounting activities for the Group’s Swedish entities. You’ll be part of a truly international environment, with fantastic colleagues based in Malta, Sweden, the UK, Italy, the Netherlands, the US, and Colombia.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Process invoices and managing accounts payable
* Process payments, reconcile bank statements, track bank deposits and payments
* Process credit card transactions and expenses
* Communicate with suppliers and other stakeholders
* Prepare documentation for the monthly closure process
* Prepare Balance Sheet reconciliations
* Other daily accounting activities.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 Essential skills:
   

  

* More than 1+ year experience in accounting. You are either at the beginning of your journey, or more experienced individual who is looking for a new challenge.
* Experience of accounting software (NetSuite experience is ideal) and banking solutions.
* Intermediate competency with Excel.
* Fluid in Swedish and proficiency in English (written and spoken).


 WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1900 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

 BENEFITS:
   

  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Produktionssamordnare inom CTI
description:
**Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap**
 MSB arbetar för ett säkrare samhälle i en föränderlig värld med fokus på utveckling av det civila försvaret. Från och med den 1 januari 2026 är vi Myndigheten för civilt försvar. Myndigheten för civilt försvar har två tydliga roller: vi är den ledande, inriktande och samordnande myndigheten i det civila försvaret och vi är sektorsansvarig myndighet för beredskapssektorn räddningstjänst och skydd av civilbefolkningen. Myndigheten för civilt försvars vision är ”Tillsammans för ett starkt civilt försvar”.
   

  

 CERT-SE förväntas öka sin operativa förmåga och kunna ge stöd till fler delar av samhället. För att lyckas med det behöver vi stärka vårt team och rekrytera en produktionssamordnare inom CTI för att kunna öka den operativa förmågan och ge ytterligare stöd för att hantera och förebygga IT-säkerhetsincidenter och cyberangrepp. Är det du som är vår nästa kollega?
   

  

**Ditt ansvar och dina arbetsuppgifter**
 I ditt ansvar ingår att leda arbetet med att samla in, analysera och sprida underrättelser om cyberhot. Du planerar, koordinerar och följer upp teamets arbete och säkerställer kvaliteten i leveranser. Rollen innebär också att samverka med andra funktioner, beslutsfattare och externa partners. Som produktionssamordnare ansvarar du dessutom för att utveckla strategier och processer för CTI-verksamheten.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i en operativ verksamhet, vilket innebär att arbetet ibland är reaktivt och styrs av externa omständigheter. Arbetsuppgifter utförs normalt under kontorstid, men vid inträffade IT-säkerhetshändelser kan andra arbetstider förekomma. Du kommer även att delta i övningar, nationellt såväl som internationellt. Ibland arbetar du enskilt och ibland tillsammans med andra i grupp.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår att:
   

  

* planera, genomföra och följa upp den dagliga operativa CTI-verksamheten.
* säkerställa att analysaktiviteter sker enligt fastställda processer, metodik och prioriteringar.
* koordinera CTI-insatser med relaterade funktioner.
* granska och godkänna underrättelserapporter, briefings, och hotanalyser.
* utbilda och stötta kollegor inom CTI och närliggande områden.


**Dina kunskaper och kompetenser**
 För att söka anställning som produktionssamordnare inom CTI vid CERT-SE har du för tjänsten en relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT- eller informationssäkerhetsområdet, alternativt kunskap inhämtad via arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig. Du har också certifieringar relevanta för CTI, erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling och projektledning. De har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig mycket väl både i tal och skrift, både på svenska och på engelska.
   

  

 Vidare söker vi dig som har:
   

  

* förmåga att koppla operativa förmågor till strategiska mål med erfarenhet av att leda och coacha medarbetare på operativ nivå i egenskap av till exempel teamledare eller projektledare, inklusive stöd och uppföljning.
* förståelse för cyberhotlandskapet - typer av hotaktörer, motiv och angreppssätt.
* kännedom om CTI-processens olika steg och delmoment med erfarenhet av planering, prioritering och uppföljning av CTI-verksamhet.
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med underrättelsecykeln och/eller CTI-processen.
* erfarenhet från arbete inom SOC eller CERT/CSIRT-verksamhet.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att driva verksamhets-, metod-, processutveckling eller förändringsarbete inom IT-säkerhetsområdet eller angränsande område.


 Som alla medarbetare och ledare hos oss förväntas du kunna arbeta uppdragsorienterat, utvecklingsinriktat, dialoginriktat, ha god självkännedom och bidra genom att vara ett föredöme.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, så som att du är strukturerad, tydlig och att du har förmåga att skaffa dig helhetssyn. Du tycker om att arbeta under stundvis tidspressade förhållanden och att kunna växla mellan samtidiga arbetsuppgifter. Du är nyfiken på nya företeelser inom teknik men också på hur arbetet med cybersäkerhet fungerar i Sverige och utomlands.
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Vi erbjuder dig en anställning tillsvidare på heltid som inleds med en provanställning. Din placeringsort kommer att vara Stockholm på vårt kontor Tomteboda, resor i anställningen förekommer.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för anställning på MSB då den innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Om oss**
 CERT-SE är Sveriges nationella CSIRT (Computer Security Incident Response Team) med uppgift att stödja det svenska samhället i arbetet med att hantera och förebygga IT-säkerhetsincidenter. Uppdraget omfattar både privat och offentlig sektor med fokus på samhällsviktig verksamhet. CERT-SE:s verksamhet bedrivs vid Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap (MSB).
   

  

 Hos oss får du en unik möjlighet att växa i din roll och vara en del av ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag. Vi erbjuder utbildning och personlig utveckling i en dynamisk och framåtblickande arbetsmiljö där du kan göra verklig skillnad.
   

  

 Vi har nu inlett en ny fas i vår utveckling. Samverkan med det nationella cybersäkerhetscentret (NCSC-SE) har intensifierats och på sikt kommer hela CERT-SE som funktion att överföras till NCSC-SE med FRA som huvudman.
   

  

 Alla vi som arbetar på MSB förväntas och ska bidra till ökad jämställdhet och likabehandling för en arbetsmiljö och ett samhälle fritt från diskriminering.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Daniel Tourde
 **.** 
 Facklig företrädare är Carl Önne SACO-S, Jan Herremo ST och Josefin Berglund eller Ann-Britt Paradis SEKO. Samtliga nås via växelnumret 0771-240 240.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 19 oktober 2025.**
**Anställningsform** 
 Tillsvidare med provanställning
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Tillträde** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Löneform** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Antal lediga befattningar** 
 1
   

  

**Sysselsättningsgrad** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Län** 
 Stockholms län
   

  

**Land** 
 Sverige
   

  

**Referensnummer** 
 2025/238
   

  

**Publicerat** 
 2025-09-19
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 2025-10-19
   

  

**Dela länkar**

title: AI Product Owner till Rexel!
description:
*Är du en Product Owner som brinner för AI och vill omsätta ny teknik till konkret affärsvärde? Vill du vara den som leder vägen för hur ett marknadsledande bolag använder generativ AI i praktiken? Sök då rollen som AI Product Owner till Rexel!*
**Din Vardag**
 Som AI Product Owner på Rexel ansvarar du för att identifiera, driva och realisera användningen av generativ AI i olika delar av verksamheten. Rollen är ny och strategiskt viktig – du blir en nyckelperson i att definiera roadmap, samla in behov och leda utvecklingen av AI-lösningar inom Rexels olika verksamhetsområden.
   

  

 I nuläget ligger fokus på att arbeta nära finans- och BI-teamet, där du får en central roll som produktägare för datalagret och de insiktsdrivna lösningar som byggs på det. Du driver backlog och prioriteringar, koordinerar mellan verksamheten och externa leverantörer, samt säkerställer att utvecklingen sker strukturerat och med hög kvalitet.
   

  

 När organisationens mognad inom AI växer kommer din roll att breddas till fler verksamhetsområden. Du kommer då att vara en viktig drivkraft i att inspirera och engagera hela organisationen att omfamna AI-teknologier, samt att använda AI för att förbättra IT-leveranser och skapa verksamhetsnytta.
   

  

 Du fungerar som en kontaktperson mot Group IT och deras AI-gruppering, och får via detta nätverk stöd, råd och inspiration i hur Rexel Sverige kan driva AI-agendan lokalt.
   

  

 Rollen rapporterar till Head of Business Solutions och har placering på Rexels huvudkontor i Älvsjö, Stockholm.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att passa i rollen som AI Product Owner tror att du har:
   

  

* Några års erfarenhet som Product Owner med fokus på generativ AI.
* Förståelse för grossistdistribution, supply chain-dynamik och kundserviceprocesser samt B2B försäljning
* Förståelse för AI/ML-koncept, mjukvaruutvecklingslivscykler och bästa praxis för datastyrning.
* Goda färdigheter inom stakeholder management och change management
* Talar och skriver svenska samt engelska flytande


 Som person är du nyfiken och experimentell. Du är orädd för att utmana strukturer, men har en förmåga att göra detta på ett sätta som tar hänsyn till kontext och historik. Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga och är duktig på relationsbyggande.
   

  

**Kontakt:**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Rexel med Wise IT.
   

  

 För att söka tjänsten ansöker du enkelt via länken. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Gustaf Linder på gustaf.linder@wiseit.se
   

  

 Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter
   

  

**Processen för rollen kommer att startar i mitten av augusti.**
**Passar vi dig?**
 Rexel är en av världens största leverantörer av energiteknik, med verksamhet i mer än 20 länder. Vi tror på att föra vår positiva energi till allt vi gör, och varje dag vägleder vi våra kunder genom de utmaningar de står inför för att göra installationer, infrastrukturer och byggnader mer bekväma, säkra och energieffektiva. Vi kopplar ihop och distribuerar morgondagens hållbara elvärld. Idag. Läs mer om Rexel på rexel.se och hur det är att arbeta med oss.
   

  

 Rexel. Elektrifierande lösningar som gör en hållbar framtid möjlig.

title: Junior Group Accounting Analyst - Global Electrolux Talent Program
description:
**Global Electrolux Talent Program (GET)**
 The Global Electrolux Talent Program is a proactive initiative that brings together young talent across various functions and global offices of Electrolux. The program offers hands-on, international experience in a multicultural environment, with the goal of securing long-term employment within the company upon successful completion of the internship.
   

  

**Job Role**
 All financial information within the Electrolux Group is consolidated and reported by the Group Accounting & Reporting (GA&R) team, based in Stockholm. The team is responsible for preparing the Group’s consolidated accounts and producing annual and quarterly reports, in close collaboration with Group Business Control (GBC) and Investor Relations (IR). GA&R also manages the financial reporting and consolidation systems, including AARO and Workiva. In this role, you will work closely with an experienced and dedicated team, where collaboration and a positive mindset are key.
   

  

**Key Operational Responsibilities**
* Supporting system-related activities for AARO (financial reporting and consolidation) and Workiva (external report production).
* Managing user administration tasks such as adding, removing, or updating users and user rights.
* Providing user support on reporting processes and requirements (excluding IT-related issues).
* Preparing reporting systems by setting up periods, forms, and reporting packages.
* Participating in the production of quarterly and annual external reports, including:
+ Transferring data from AARO to Workiva.
+ Checking and verifying comparative financial information.
+ Updating numerical data and text sections in Workiva.
