 Job ID: A3070621

title: Dataskyddsjurist
description:
*Jobbar du med dataskyddsfrågor och är redo för en ny utmaning i Sveriges femte största bankkoncern? Vi söker nu en jurist som vill utvecklas och arbeta nära verksamheten genom att lämna kvalificerad juridisk rådgivning i varierande dataskyddsrättsliga frågeställningar.*
 Om jobbet
   

  

 Hos oss spelar du en central roll i bankens dataskyddsfunktion i första linjen som har i uppdrag att säkerställa att verksamheten i banken och dess dotterbolag efterlever EU:s dataskyddsförordning (GDPR) och andra relevanta regelverk. Som Dataskyddsspecialist lämnar du juridisk rådgivning om dataskydd och stöttar verksamheten i att omhänderta regelverkskrav i en rad olika frågor.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat vara att:
   

  

* Lämna juridisk rådgivning inom dataskydd till verksamheten vid t.ex. konsekvensbedömningar, personuppgiftsincidenter, registrerades rättigheter och riskanalyser.
* Bistå behandlingsansvariga i att säkerställa att deras verksamhetsprocesser sker i enlighet med GDPR och andra dataskyddsregelverk.
* Stödja implementeringen av styrdokument, instruktioner och rutiner för dataskydd i verksamheten.
* Delta i regelbundna egenkontroller, uppföljningar och stickprovskontroller.
* Bevaka rättsutvecklingen på dataskyddsområdet och analysera på vilket sätt den påverkar verksamheten samt i förekommande fall utbilda i frågorna.
* Fungera som central kontaktpunkt mellan dataskyddsombudet, behandlingsansvariga och andra nyckelpersoner som arbetar med dataskydd inom Länsförsäkringsgruppen för att säkerställa effektiv efterlevnad i bankkoncernen.


 Vem är du?
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Jurist- eller affärsjuridisk examen.
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av att arbeta med GDPR och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering.
* Det är meriterande om du har: erfarenhet av att arbeta i en komplex och dynamisk miljö med tvärfunktionella team för att integrera dataskyddsprocesser i verksamheten, kunskap om informationsteknik, AI och informationssäkerhet.


 Vi söker dig som är noggrann, strukturerad, analytisk och har ett stort intresse för dataskydd. Med hög integritet och gott omdöme hanterar du komplexa frågor professionellt. Du är en skicklig kommunikatör som anpassar budskap till olika målgrupper och arbetar proaktivt för att stärka dataskyddsarbetet och skapa en ansvarsfull kultur.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Dataskydd Bank är en nyetablerad dataskyddsfunktion inom bankens säkerhetsorganisation, som även hanterar informationssäkerhet, dataskydd, IT-säkerhet, kontinuitet, civil beredskap och fysisk säkerhet. Här får du möjlighet att vara med och forma en viktig funktion som bidrar till att säkerställa att banken uppfyller högt ställda krav på dataskydd och regelefterlevnad.
   

  

 Länsförsäkringar Bank är idag Sveriges femte största bank och erbjuder ett brett sortiment av produkter och tjänster till våra privat-, företag- och lantbrukskunder. I arbetet mot vår vision "Tillsammans skapar vi trygghet och möjligheter" hoppas vi att du vill bidra med ditt engagemang och nyfikenhet för effektivisering, AI samt omvärldsspaning av moderna verktyg och metoder för att driva vår utveckling framåt
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-26**

title: AWS Public Sector Senior Cloud Application Architect
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking an experienced ProServe Cloud Architect (PCA) to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to understand their technical requirements and business objectives, designing and implementing tailored cloud solutions. You'll be a key player in the pre-sales process, providing technical expertise and guidance throughout the customer's cloud journey.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be responsible for creating and leading the solution design to address customer business outcomes (CBO). Operating as the conduit between ProServe Account Executives and our Shared Delivery Teams (SDT), you’ll ensure proposed solutions are realistic, achievable, and optimize ProServe and/or our partners to maximize CBOs. As a PCA you are a trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to address customer challenges. As a technical SME, you will share knowledge within the organization, through mentoring, training, creation of reusable artifacts and process improvements.
   

  

 Your experience in designing technical solutions within the technology/consulting sector, will equip you with the ability to architect complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer, translating technical concepts into business value. Your success as a PCA will be linked to impacting the signing of SOWs, and the successful implementation of solutions which achieve CBOs while exceeding customer satisfaction (CSAT) expectations.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Design sophisticated, scalable cloud solutions that directly address critical business challenges
* Provide strategic technical guidance throughout customer engagement lifecycle
* Develop comprehensive cloud architecture strategies that balance performance, security, and cost-effectiveness
* Mentor and educate internal teams on advanced cloud technologies and best practices
* Translate complex technical concepts into compelling narratives for diverse audiences
* Build the technical relationship with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of technical specialist, design and architecture experience, including 5+ years of cloud-based solution (AWS or equivalent), system, network, and operating system experience
* 5+ years of external or internal customer-facing, complex and large-scale project management experience, including
* 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience working within software development


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Mendix utvecklare
description:
**Hjälp oss bygga framtidens digitala lösningar på iwow** 




 På iwow vet vi att alla människor har olika styrkor. Vi tror på att skapa en inkluderande kultur där vi genom att stötta och engagera oss i varandras arbete och erfarenheter skapar ännu bättre erbjudanden och leveranser till våra kunder.
 



  





 iwow är ett nytänkande IT-konsultbolag där du får vara med på en inspirerande resa – från affärsutveckling och kunddialog till leverans och innovation. Här uppmuntras kreativitet, initiativförmåga och entreprenöriellt tankesätt.
 



  





 Vi söker nu dig som är senior utvecklare / arkitekt med teknisk höjd, affärsdriv och vilja att vara med och bygga något nytt – både för våra kunder och internt på iwow.
 



  





**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




 Som Senior Mendix-utvecklare kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att digitalisera och effektivisera sina verksamheter. Du leder design och utveckling av moderna affärsapplikationer och arbetsflöden på Mendix low-code-plattformen, där du omsätter kundernas behov till intuitiva, kraftfulla och skalbara lösningar som skapar verkligt affärsvärde.
 



  





 Du har ansvar för att vägleda kunder genom hela utvecklingsprocessen – från kravställning och design till implementation och leverans. Du samarbetar nära produktägare, UX/UI-designers och utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att varje lösning är användarvänlig, säker och långsiktigt hållbar.
 



  





**Ledning och utveckling** 



* Leda hela processen – från kravanalys och design till utveckling och driftsättning av applikationer på Mendix-plattformen.
* Säkerställa att applikationer byggs med fokus på prestanda, säkerhet, skalbarhet och användarupplevelse.
* Implementera best practices och delta aktivt i kod- och logikgranskningar för att upprätthålla högteknisk kvalitet.



  





**Teknisk design och implementation** 



* Utveckla anpassade moduler, widgets och logik med hjälp av microflows, nanoflows och domänmodeller för att stödja komplexa affärsprocesser.
* Designa och implementera robusta integrationer med interna system och externa tjänster via REST-API:er och förkonfigurerade konnektorer.
* Bygga återanvändbara komponenter och etablera standarder för effektiv Mendix- utveckling.



  





  





**Var med och utveckla iwow:** 




  





**Bidra till att vidareutvecklare kompetensområde inom low-code** 



* Etablera och vidareutveckla iwow:s erbjudande inom området.
* Utveckla interna processer, kunskapsspridning och best practices.
* Representera iwow i branschforum och kunddialoger.



  





**Bidra till affärsutveckling och försäljning** 



* Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och sälja in projekt.
* Medverka i förstudier och behovsanalys hos kund.
* Agera teknisk rådgivare i tidiga kunddialoger.
* Bygga långsiktiga relationer med kunder och partners.



  





**Vem är du?** 



* Djup förståelse för Mendix-plattformen, inklusive domänmodellering, microflows och applikationsarkitektur.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att integrera Mendix-applikationer med andra system via REST API:er och webbtjänster.
* Goda kunskaper i frontend-webbteknologier (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) för anpassad design och funktionalitet.
* Erfarenhet av att designa och ge rådgivning kring domänmodeller som stödjer komplex applikationslogik och integrationskrav.
* Starka problemlösningsförmågor och förmåga att arbeta i en samarbetsinriktad, agil teammiljö.
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Fördelaktigt med Mendix-certifiering.



 Som person är du drivande, nyfiken och prestigelös. Du trivs med ansvar och att vara en del av något större. Du har ett naturligt affärssinne, kombinerat med djup teknisk förståelse. Du motiveras av att bygga, påverka och skapa lösningar som ger verklig kundnytta. Du är kommunikativ, delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och ser lärande som en självklar del av vardagen. En bra dag för dig är när du har lärt dig något nytt – och hjälpt någon annan att göra detsamma.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder iwow?** 



* En central och inflytelserik roll från dag ett
* Möjlighet att forma både kundprojekt och interna satsningar
* En öppen, transparent och stöttande företagskultur
* Kort väg till beslut – du påverkar, vi lyssnar
* En arbetsplats där innovation och egna initiativ uppmuntras
* En möjlighet att bygga bolaget tillsammans med oss



  





**Ansökan** 




 Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



 För frågor om rollen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta:
 



**Jarkko Parviainen** 




 📞 +46 70-021 46 70
 



 ✉️ jarkko@iwow.se

title: Senior Product Manager, Data Products (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Product Manager, you will play a critical role in shaping and delivering data products and projects that power decision-making, monitoring, and innovation across the business. You will define product vision, manage roadmaps, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable, reliable, and user-centric data solutions. Your strategic thinking and product sense will help elevate our data platform capabilities and maximize business impact through data.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
***Product Leadership & Strategy***
* Define clear goals, success metrics, and KPIs to measure the value and impact of data products/projects.
* Lead the end-to-end lifecycle of data projects, from discovery and requirements gathering to release and continuous improvement.
* Develop and manage the product roadmap in close collaboration with engineering, analytics, business and product stakeholders.
* Identify opportunities to create or enhance data products that solve real user problems and unlock business value.
* Ensure alignment between product initiatives and broader business strategy.


***Stakeholder Management***
* Serve as the primary point of contact for all stakeholders on all things related to data and analytics.
* Organize and gather requirements, and ensure alignment across business analysts, product teams, account managers, and partners.
* Communicate product vision, timelines, trade-offs, and progress effectively to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Drive decision-making by presenting clear data product insights, feasibility considerations, and business value assessments.


***Execution & Delivery Support***
* Collaborate with data engineers, and BI analysts to deliver robust data solutions (e.g., datasets, dashboards, APIs, reporting).
* Ensure clear documentation of product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Prioritize development efforts based on impact, feasibility, and user needs.
* Oversee data validation, testing, and release processes to ensure high-quality delivery.


***Data Governance & Quality***
* Promote data governance best practices, including consistent definitions, data lineage, and metadata management.
* Monitor data product performance and quality post-release, and coordinate improvements as needed.
* Ensure compliance with data security, privacy, and compliance standards across all data product initiatives.


***Process Improvement***
* Identify and implement opportunities to streamline data product development and delivery processes.
* Advocate for product and data best practices within cross-functional teams.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, user-centricity, and continuous learning in how data products are developed and used.


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* Proven experience in product management, ideally focused on data platforms, analytics tools, or data infrastructure.
* Strong understanding of data pipelines, data modeling, and analytics workflows.
* Excellent communication skills (verbal and written), with an ability to translate complex technical concepts into business-friendly language.
* Proactive, analytical, and user-focused approach to problem-solving.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and product management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Trello).
* Ability to thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and balance multiple priorities effectively.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Sales Director - RE0107
description:

 Fluency in Swedish (with excellent command of English)

 to join our team at Creative Software in Colombo, Sri Lanka. This is a

 , responsible for driving sales while

 .
 



  





 This opportunity is designed for Swedish professionals eager to advance their careers while experiencing life abroad.
 



  





 Sri Lanka offers a welcoming community, rich culture, and tropical lifestyle by the ocean. With

 age,

 If you are a results-driven sales professional with experience in B2B sales and would like to advance your career while living in Sri Lanka, we encourage you to apply.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Quantum information
emails: elizabeth.yang@su.se, sofia.qvarfort@fysik.su.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, seko@seko.su.se, sekodirekt@seko.se
description:
**Nordita, The Nordic Institute for Theoretical Physics,** 
 was founded in Copenhagen, Denmark, in 1957. It moved to the AlbaNova University Center in Stockholm, Sweden, in 2007, where it is jointly hosted by KTH Royal Institute of Technology and Stockholm University. Research at Nordita covers a broad range of theoretical physics including astrophysics, biophysics, condensed matter physics, gravitation, cosmology and astroparticle physics, high-energy physics, quantum information, soft matter and statistical physics/complex systems. The research activity of the local academic staff is supplemented by Nordita Scientific Programs, which bring together groups of leading experts to work on specific topics for extended periods. There is also ample opportunity for collaboration with faculty and research staff at local universities.
   

  

 Further information about Nordita can be found at www.nordita.org
   

  

 Project description
   

  

 The candidate is expected to propose an independent research project, demonstrating both the autonomy expected from a postdoc and potential for fruitful collaborations with members of the group. Other tasks may involve helping with the management of the group, as well as co-supervision of students on research projects. The job description may be changed during the contract period or upon contract renewal.
   

  

 There are no teaching requirements for this position, but for candidates interested in teaching, Nordita has connections with nearby institutions where it is sometimes possible to arrange teaching opportunities (Stockholm University, KTH, and Uppsala University). The position is meant to further the careers of early-career researchers who wish to pursue a career in academia.
   

  

 This position is part of the Wallenberg Initiative on Networks and Quantum Information (WINQ), supported by the Knut and Alice Wallenberg foundation (KAW). It is aimed at nurturing and bringing together expertise from both quantum information science and complex dynamical systems to address major open challenges in these fields. WINQ is located within the conducive research environment of Nordita. Successful candidates for a position in WINQ may also have an opportunity to collaborate with other KAW initiatives across Sweden in the fields of artificial intelligence (WASP) and quantum technology (WACQT).
   

  

 Research in WINQ has two main threads: quantum information processing (QIP) and complex dynamical networks (CDN). We also encourage applicants working at interfaces between those broadly defined areas. Relevant (but not exclusive) keywords for these fields include:
   

  

**QIP** 
 : quantum computation; quantum optics; quantum metrology; quantum algorithms; quantum information; quantum co-processors; quantum simulators; coding of quantum information; quantum error detection; quantum information sharing
   

  

**CDN** 
 : neural network learning; chaotic dynamical systems; deep networks, spatiotemporal multiscale systems; multiplex-multilayer networks; neurobiological networks
   

  

 We are looking for a creative candidate with a strong collaborative mindset to join the group of Sofia Qvarfort, one of the Assistant Professors in WINQ. Projects in this research group focus on have QIP aspects, including quantum information, quantum optics, modelling nonlinear and noisy quantum dynamics, quantum metrology and tests of fundamental physics, but could also involve CDN aspects, including quantum networks and machine learning methods for solving quantum dynamics.
   

  

 Main responsibilities
   

  

 The position involves conducting research in accordance with the themes from the project description, under the direction of the PI and also independently.
   

  

 Qualification requirements
   

  

 In order to qualify for a Postdoctoral position, applicants are required to hold a Swedish doctoral degree or an equivalent relevant degree from another country. The degree must have been completed no later than when the employment decision is made.
   

  

 Assessment criteria
   

  

 It is considered an advantage if the doctoral degree or an equivalent degree was completed no more than three years prior to the application deadline. Under special circumstances, an older degree may also be an advantage. Special circumstances refer to sick leave, parental leave, elected positions in trade unions, service in the total defense, or other similar circumstances, as well as clinical attachment or service/assignments relevant to the subject area.
   

  

 In the appointment process, special attention will be given to candidates with strong research background. A successful candidate is expected to have a strong background in quantum information theory, with specialization on quantum dynamics and/or quantum metrology.
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The position involves full-time employment for a minimum of two years and a maximum of three years, with the possibility of extension under special circumstances. The starting date is flexible, with a preference for the spring semester of 2026.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 With us, you will experience the dynamic interaction between higher education and research that makes Stockholm University an exciting and creative environment. You will work in an international environment and get favorable conditions. The university is located in the National City Park with good transport links to the city.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 Further information about the position can be obtained from the Head of Administration, Elizabeth Yang, phone: +46 8 553 784 73, elizabeth.yang@su.se, or the recruiting Assistant Professor Sofia Qvarfort, sofia.qvarfort@fysik.su.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. Attach a personal letter and CV as well as the attachments requested in the application form, including two letters of recommendation. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
   

  

 Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.

title: Sustainable Sourcing Climate Lead
description:
**Ready to lead the climate transformation in global sourcing? Apply now and join Alfa Laval’s commitment to a sustainable future!**
**Sustainable Sourcing Climate Lead**
 Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping. As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.
   

  

**About The Job**
 You will be part of a global team working to improve existing and develop new sustainable sourcing practices throughout our central and local sourcing organization. The role focuses on emission reductions and environmental improvements in our supply chain. You will work with analysis of fast-changing requirements, developing, rolling out and supporting new ways of working.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Climate knowledge - to support the sourcing organization on how to reduce emissions and risks
* Change management lead - to drive changes in way of working to incorporate more sustainability
* Reports and digital – to use data and reports to drive change, to follow-up and evaluate for improvements


 This includes working with pilot projects to find new solutions, creating guidelines, rolling out KPIs, participating in new IT solution projects and representing Alfa Laval in external settings.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A global platform to champion climate action in sourcing
* The authority to drive real change and innovation
* Collaboration with passionate, diverse colleagues worldwide
* Opportunities for growth, learning, and leadership


**Who You Are**
 You are ready to make a difference in a fast-paced, innovative environment. You embrace change with optimism and find it easy to remain confident and actionable in situations with new elements and ambiguity. You are a networker that quickly builds and develops new relations, and you can handle a complex cross-functional stakeholder context. You thrive when you can find solutions and make decisions that bring a topic forward. You can easily move between strategic topics and how to make change happen tactically and operationally in the organization. You prioritize keeping up to date on industry trends, innovation and risks. You are well known for obtaining high levels of engagement and reaching ambitious goals.  As a person you also listen, consult, and make room for others. You believe that transparent communication and collaboration is the key to success.
   

  

**What You Know**
 You have expertise in the areas of climate, sustainability and sourcing/supply chain, with knowledge of climate-related best practices, standards and regulations (e.g., GHG Protocol, SBTi, CDP, GRI, CSRD, ESRS, Circularity and relevant ISO standards). You have a proven track record for successfully implementing new ways of working across a global organization. You have experience in leading data driven approach, in understanding new data and quickly determining business value. You are fluent in English both written and spoken. Good knowledge in sustainability reporting is an advantage for this position. You have a university degree in supply chain management, industrial engineering, business administration, or similar.
   

  

**What is in for you?**
 We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success, driving towards Positive Impact for our Planet.
   

  

 The role can be based in our headquarters in Lund, Sweden or Copenhagen and Stockholm.
   

  

**For More Information, Please Contact**
 Sofia Alfons, Sustainability Manager Global Sourcing, sofia.alfons@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Divya Sharma, Talent Acquisition Partner, divya.sharma@alfalaval.com
   

  

  

  

**Union information** 
  

  

 Johan Ranhog, Akademikerföreningen,  +46 730 576 410
   

  

 Monica Anderberg, Unionen,  +46 709 623 811
   

  

 Stefan Sandell, Ledarna, +46 709 787 364
   

  

 The last day to apply is November 1st 2025
   

  

 We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.
 **Playing the games is mandatory.**
 We review applications on an ongoing basis, so please send in yours as soon as possible. Applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice due to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
   

  

 Looking forward for your application!

title: Senior D365 SCM Supply Chain Consultant
description:
Join our Nordic ERP team of talented professionals and contribute with your expertise to help organizations achieve operational excellence and drive successful digital transformations using Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP. We partner with some of the biggest companies across the world, working together to improve business outcomes. We help not only well-established organizations move into the digital era, but also support innovative start-ups as they build their businesses.
   

  

**We**
* Have a wide variety of interesting projects to work with both locally and globally
* Provide you with a dedicated Career Adviser to support you during your journey at Avanade and who works together with you to create a personal development plan
* Welcome you to a team of engaged and helpful co-workers
* Have a wide range of different benefits such as employee stock purchasing, flexible work arrangements, a commitment to diversity and inclusion
* Provide the opportunity to work for Microsoft's Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 tears in a row), with a wide variety of development and training opportunities (80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Have offices in the major Nordic cities, and we support flexible work locations.


**Come join us**
 ERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365.
   

  

 This role provides the opportunity to work for the Microsoft 1 Partner, with an unrivalled focus on development, global opportunities as well as a dedicated career advisor to support you through your career progression.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner
* You have a passion for learning along with good business sense and time management
* You know how to manage your clients’ expectations effectively
* You’ve likely achieved a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field
* At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O or Dynamics AX OR experience supporting Dynamics 365 F&O as a strong user within the Supply Chain modules
* Experience with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain module
* Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain Management end-user experience nice to have but not required
* Experience managing/leading teams both on and offshore is nice to have, but not required


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Convincing storyteller and engaging content creator


**What You'll Do**
 You will:
   

  

* Transform business requirements into a straightforward and technical model, and match processes to application requirements
* Prototype and configure processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) to make sure the system works the way your client needs it to
* Run workshops with your clients, consultants, and client leaders to analyze and design solutions for any application, and handle gaps detected during prototyping
* Work with the technical team to make sure that your clients' needs are incorporated into the specifications and functions
* Create or evaluate a breakdown of your clients’ businesses processes so that you can identify and link functional and non-functional requirements
* Documents settings and prepare your clients to use the system
* Support testing the proposed system and train users


**Learn more**
 Apply today!
   

  

 To Learn more about Avanade Nordics, visit our home page.
   

  

 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

 Avanade Insights exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
   

  

 Inside Avanade explore what life is like working at Avanade
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


  

  

 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


  

  

 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Medical Science Liaison, Nordics - Nephrology
description:
On behalf of Otsuka - a respected global pharmaceutical company with Japanese roots and strong core values - PharmaRelations is supporting the recruitment of a Nordic Medical Science Liaison. Otsuka is currently expanding its presence within Nephrology, and we are seeking an experienced professional with solid scientific expertise, strategic thinking, a collaborative spirit, and a proactive mindset to contribute to this important area. Are you ready to take on a key role in a dedicated Nordic Medical Affairs team?
 



  





**Department:** 
 Medical Affairs
 



**Reports to:** 
 Medical Affairs Manager
 



**Location:** 
 Flexible within the Nordics (field-based)
 



**Employment type** 
 : Full-time position
 








  





**About the Role** 




 As an MSL, you will act as a scientific expert across the Nordics. You will engage with key opinion leaders, healthcare professionals, and internal stakeholders to drive scientific partnerships, lead medical initiatives and support evidence generation and educational efforts. This is a strategic and field-based role that requires a high level of autonomy, expertise, scientific curiosity, and a passion for delivering value to patients and the healthcare system.
 








**Key Responsibilities** 



* Establish and maintain long-term scientific collaborations with healthcare professionals, thought leaders, and key stakeholders.
* Provide medical and scientific expertise to internal teams, commercial planning, and training activities.
* Proactively drive medical strategy in your countries.
* Identify, analyze, and communicate emerging scientific data within relevant therapeutic areas.
* Drive and support medical initiatives pre (- and post) launch of products.



  





**Qualifications and Experience** 



* Advanced scientific degree (e.g., MD, PharmD, PhD, or MSc in life sciences).
* Years of experience in Medical Affairs, preferably in an MSL capacity.
* Proven ability to collaborate with opinion leaders and communicate complex scientific information.
* Experience with Nephrology and/or Immunology is a strong advantage.
* Experience with RWE or evidence generation projects is an advantage.
* Strong understanding of ethics, regulatory frameworks, and compliance within the pharmaceutical industry.
* Fluent in English; proficiency in one or more Nordic languages is a plus.



  





  





**Who You Are** 




 You are self-driven, proactive and solution-oriented, with a warm and collaborative approach. You are driven by impact, not hierarchy or prestige. You thrive in a hybrid strategic-operational role, enjoy rolling up your sleeves and getting involved wherever needed in the team and enjoy engaging with the healthcare community in the field. You are a strong team player in the Otsuka family who generously shares knowledge and is motivated by supporting your colleagues in order to makes difference for patients.
 








  





**We Offer** 



* A meaningful role in a company guided by strong values: ethics, innovation, empathy, and collaboration.
* A Nordic team, characterized by professionalism, kindness, openness, and dedication.
* The opportunity to contribute to a dynamic therapeutic area where patient needs are at the center.
* A workplace that feels like a family - Otsuka is known for its warm, supportive, and collaborative culture, both locally in Sweden and globally. You’ll be part of a team of professional people who genuinely care for one another and enjoy working together. It’s a happy and inspiring environment where people thrive.








**About Otsuka** 




 Otsuka is a global healthcare company with a strong heritage in innovation and a deep commitment to improving the health and well-being of people worldwide. With a unique and patient-centric approach, we develop breakthrough treatments in areas of high unmet medical need, including rare diseases, CNS, nephrology, and oncology. At Otsuka, we believe in thinking differently — and acting boldly — while staying grounded in care, integrity, and human connection. Our teams across the globe work closely together in a spirit of curiosity, collaboration, and compassion.
 



  





 At Otsuka, we foster a family-like culture built on mutual respect and trust. As a global leader in innovative therapies, we offer:
 


* Opportunities for professional growth in a collaborative and dynamic environment.
* Engagement with cutting-edge healthcare solutions across diverse regions and disciplines.
* A chance to contribute to life-changing treatments within a globally respected organization.



 At Otsuka, we also foster a culture where the right competence, the right attitude, creative thinking, and international collaboration come together to empower our employees to make a meaningful difference in patients' lives worldwide.
 








  





**The Recruitment Process - Your Application** 




 PharmaRelations is managing this recruitment on behalf of Otsuka. If you believe your background and expertise align with the requirements, we encourage you to submit your application through the “Apply” button. We will review all applications with great care in our search for the right candidate. A kindly reminder is that the application documents should not be sent via email. For questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact Kristina Edholm (kristina.edholm@pharmarelations.se).

title: Principal Salesforce Developer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

 To get a sneak peek into our culture, find us on Instagram: @optimizely
   

  

**Introduction**
 Optimizely is seeking an Salesforce Developer who will report to the Director of Business Enablement, Information Technology. This role will primarily work with the Sales Operations team as well as other departmental system administrators of enterprise software applications.
   

  

 This role will ensure that Optimizely’s Salesforce instance is both scalable and meeting the needs of the business operations. You will requiore extensive experience in designing and implementing CPQ solutions within Salesforce for subscription-based business operations.
   

  

 You will guide our Salesforce strategy by championing the best practice usage of the system and its integrations with other systems like NetSuite, Gainsight, and Marketo as well as satellite software and third-party integration tools like Celigo and Workato.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Gather (or work closely with business analysts) requirements from various stakeholders relating to changes in integrations for projects related to enterprise systems, integrations, processes, change control, and operations
* Facilitate discussions with business owners in working sessions to understand requirements, find common ground, and evaluate acceptable solutions
* Create and maintain documentation on enterprise systems and satellite system integrations
* Create/update and maintain documentation in partnership with cross-departmental teams related to process and operations when related to specific work
* Develop User Acceptance Testing scenarios, identify test criteria and test new functionality/enhancements
* Identify gaps in process, operations, and systems
* Work with IT Infrastructure, enterprise system subject matter experts, and other resources to design and review technical designs and project plans for fit and purpose in accordance with system best practices
* Understand data flows between enterprise systems, in collaboration with our Enterprise Architect
* Develop and maintain trust cross-departmentally
* Work with Enterprise Architect on enterprise system roadmap
* Maintain backlog of work for IT business system analysts and project team members as appropriate
* Research, pilot, and recommend emerging technology to the IT Software Portfolio Manager
* Stay current with technological developments within the Salesforce platform, monitoring and planning for the organization to utilize new release functionality as it becomes available
* Log and track work in a structured ticketing system (JIRA) and manages changes sets in accordance with best practice
* Lead the design and implementation of CPQ solutions to optimize pricing strategies and streamline quote processes
* Work in conjunction with product development teams to ensure Salesforce solutions align with product offerings and business goals
* Design and implement integrations between Salesforce ,CPQ and NetSuite to enhance data accuracy and streamline operations
* Provide support and be available for collaboration with team members and stakeholders across different time zones, ensuring coverage until 3 PM EST/9 PM CET.


**Knowledge And Experience**
* 5+ years in administrating Salesforce
* 2+ years in deep knowledge and practice of Apex code
* Salesforce certifications as Administrator and Platform Developer and/or an architect track certification
* Experience in building complex Salesforce solution designs and reviewing/enhancing solution designs from other SFDC delivery teammates; including a working knowledge of Salesforce platform limits, order of execution, data storage impacts, and sharing and visibility
* Solid knowledge of Agile development methodologies
* Experience with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, & Communities required
* Knowledge of what can and should be done with configuration vs. code and adheres to a “configuration before code” mindset to minimize cost and complexity and maximize scalability
* Experience designing or building Salesforce integrations with third-party applications
* Ability to create webhooks and work with API


**Education**
* Salesforce Certifications:
* Platform Developer I and II Advanced Administrator
* Bonus: SFDC certifications: CPQ Specialist, Application Architect, System Architect; Celigo Certifications


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Psykiatri Nordväst söker timanställd medicinsk sekreterare
description:
Psykiatri Nordväst arbetar utifrån visionen "Rätt vård när och där du behöver" och vår värdegrund som består av tre grundläggande värderingar: Patientens fokus, Allas lika värde och Arbetsglädje. Kompetensutveckling är viktigt för oss och alla våra medarbetare har möjlighet att medverka i olika utbildningar och kurser.
   

  

**Vårt anställnings erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett trevligt extrajobb att skriva journaler åt Psykiatri Nordväst.
   

  

 Vi söker medicinska sekreterare som har möjlighet att skriva journaler åt psykiatrin vid arbetstoppar.
   

  

 Arbetsplatsen är belägen på någon av våra två administrativa enheter inom kliniken: Administration Solna-Sundbyberg och/eller Administration Sollentuna-Väsby.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Journalskrivning i TakeCare, diagnosregistrering och KVÅ.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Krav på utbildning som medicinsk sekreterare.
   

  

 Tidigare journalskrivning inom psykiatrin.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Goda IT-kunskaper tillmäts stor betydelse. Du får gärna vara kunnig i diagnos- och KVÅ-registrering. Du är flexibel, prestigelös och hjälpsam. Du har mycket god samarbetsfråga samtidigt som du har förmåga att arbeta självständigt och driva ditt arbete framåt. Du är nyfiken, tycker om att lära dig nya saker och bidrar till god stämning på mottagningen.
   

  

 Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att den inte behöver tas i anspråk för intern omplacering, enligt gällande regelverk.
   

  

**Vid patientnära arbete inom Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde:**
* tillämpas registerkontroll före beslut om anställning enligt SLSO:s övergripande anvisning för registerkontroll vid anställning.
* ska medarbetare som kommer att ha patientkontakt genomgå nyanställningsundersökning, enligt gällande direktiv, vilket sker genom företagshälsovården innan anställning.
* krävs, förutom svensk yrkeslegitimation, goda kunskaper i svenska språket motsvarande nivå C1 enligt den gemensamma europeiska referensramen (GERS). Samma krav är vägledande vad gäller icke-legitimerad personal med patientkontakt.


**Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde (SLSO) är en av Sveriges största vårdgivare med 11 600 medarbetare. Vi erbjuder hälso- och sjukvård i Region Stockholms regi inom psykiatri, primärvård, geriatrik, ASIH, närakuter, somatisk specialistvård, habilitering och hälsa samt hjälpmedel. I samverkan med Karolinska Institutet bedriver vi forskning, utbildning och utveckling. Läs mer om SLSO här.**
 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid/deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 0-100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/6084 | Kontakt: Christina Aronsson Jansson, Enhetschef Solna-Sundb 08-12368212, Anette Skoglund, Enhetschef admin Sollentuna-Väsby 08-12368203, | Facklig företrädare: Ola Tellner, Vision 0812340481, | Publicerat: 2025-10-15 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-05

title: Förrådsmedarbetare till Hjälpmedelsverksamheterna, Vikariat
description:
Hjälpmedelsverksamheterna ansvarar för drift av hjälpmedelsverksamhet för personer med rörelsehinder i södra delen av Stockholms län samt länsövergripande ansvar för personer med behov av förbrukningshjälpmedel i hemmet, medicinteknisk apparatur i hemmet samt kommunikations-, kognitions-, syn- och hörselhjälpmedel.
   

  

 Vårt anställningserbjudande
   

  

 Vårt arbete och vår verksamhet gör skillnad för tusentals människor varje år. Alla som arbetar hos oss har högt engagemang för att hjälpa människor som är i behov av extra stöd. Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde är en trygg och långsiktig arbetsgivare.
   

  

 Den aktuella tjänsten som vi nu erbjuder är en annorlunda, utvecklande och variationsrik tjänst inom lager/logistik.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 På enheten Lager och Transport arbetar ca 30 personer och hanterar ungefär 56000 hjälpmedelsbeställningar och leveranser per år.
   

  

 På vårt lager utför vi sedvanliga lageruppgifter såsom in- och utleverans. Vårt logistikflöde är komplext jämfört med många andra lager, och vi har ett lagersystem som är anpassat efter vårt arbetssätt. Mycket av registreringarna i vårt system sker manuellt med få kontrollpunkter. En stor del av arbetet innebär att kontrollera hjälpmedel vid både in- och utleverans. Eftersom våra patienter ofta är beroende av sitt hjälpmedel måste det bli rätt i alla steg av logistikflödet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Förmåga att snabbt förstå ett komplext logistikflöde med tillhörande IT-system.
* Mycket god samarbetsförmåga och erfarenhet från att arbeta i grupp.
* Strukturerad och noggrann.
* Trivs med att arbeta fysiskt då vi går och står större delen av dagen.
* Goda kunskaper i det svenska språket i tal och skrift.


**Övrigt**
 Våra lokaler ligger i Fruängen/Älvsjö, närmaste T-bana är Fruängen.
   

  

 Arbetstiderna är förlagda till vardagar, 8.00-16.45 och tjänsten är på heltid.
   

  

 I din ansökan, uppge löneanspråk samt från när du kan börja arbeta hos oss.
   

  

 Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att den inte behöver tas i anspråk för intern omplacering, enligt gällande regelverk.
   

  

**Vid patientnära arbete inom Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde:**
* tillämpas registerkontroll före beslut om anställning enligt SLSO:s övergripande anvisning för registerkontroll vid anställning.
* ska medarbetare som kommer att ha patientkontakt genomgå nyanställningsundersökning, enligt gällande direktiv, vilket sker genom företagshälsovården innan anställning.
* krävs, förutom svensk yrkeslegitimation, goda kunskaper i svenska språket motsvarande nivå C1 enligt den gemensamma europeiska referensramen (GERS). Samma krav är vägledande vad gäller icke-legitimerad personal med patientkontakt.


**Stockholms läns sjukvårdsområde (SLSO) är en av Sveriges största vårdgivare med 11 600 medarbetare. Vi erbjuder hälso- och sjukvård i Region Stockholms regi inom psykiatri, primärvård, geriatrik, ASIH, närakuter, somatisk specialistvård, habilitering och hälsa samt hjälpmedel. I samverkan med Karolinska Institutet bedriver vi forskning, utbildning och utveckling. Läs mer om SLSO här.**
 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Vill du vara med och utveckla vår Onestream-plattform? Vi söker dig med ekonomisk och teknisk kompetens till Group Accounting
description:
*Vi söker dig med högskoleutbildning och ett intresse för IT-systemutveckling till vårt specialistteam inom Group Accounting. Om du har erfarenhet av koncernredovisning och en god förståelse för ekonomiska IT-system, och om du är en driven och lösningsorienterad person som vill vara med och utveckla vår plattform OneStream, då kan detta vara rätt roll för dig!*
**Ditt team**
 Inom Group Accounting arbetar vi med koncernredovisning, kvartals- och årsbokslut samt förvaltning av viktiga system inom Financefunktionen som t.ex. OneStream. Vi säkerställer även att koncernen följer redovisningsregler och erbjuder intern rådgivning i redovisningsfrågor.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i vårt systemteam inom Group Accounting, som är ett kompetent och samarbetsorienterat team där varje medlem har djup specialistkunskap inom redovisning och systemutveckling. Tillsammans arbetar vi effektivt för att utveckla och förbättra våra IT-system, och vi trivs i en lösningsfokuserad och engagerad arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som medarbetare i vårt team kommer du primärt att arbeta med vårt koncernkonsolideringssystem OneStream, där du kommer att vara involverad i allt från systemadministration till utveckling och förbättring av funktioner. Din uppgift blir att förstå verksamhetens behov och hjälpa till att optimera och utveckla systemet för att effektivisera arbetet.
   

  

 Ditt arbete kommer att vara en kombination av att hjälpa verksamheten att analysera och administrera data, samt bidra till utvecklingen av funktionalitet för att förbättra användarupplevelsen.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har en högskoleutbildning (Ekonom, Ingenjör eller liknande) och erfarenhet av koncernredovisning. Du ska ha arbetat som avancerad användare eller administratör i systemet OneStream eller annat koncernkonsolideringssystem. Du ska ha en god förståelse för processen kring koncernrapportering och koncernkonsolidering.
   

  

 Det krävs kunskap om Excel på avancerad nivå, då vi arbetar mycket med förädling och analys av stora datamängder. Om du även har erfarenhet eller intresse av programmering (vb.net, C# eller sql), ser vi det som ett stort plus.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara strukturerad och kunna hantera olika typer av ärenden som kommer in till gruppen. Det är också viktigt att du är nytänkande, samarbetsorienterad och lösningsorienterad. Vi söker någon som är intresserad av att utveckla nya lösningar och har förmågan att se hur systemen kan utvecklas och förbättras för att skapa mervärde för verksamheten.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Som ett steg i Handelsbankens rekryteringsprocess krävs en godkänd bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat, utförd av en extern part, innan anställning kan ske.*
**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Peter Hertz, +46703341404, peter.hertz@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Talent Acquisition Partner:** 
 Matilda Lyngéus, +46730725876 matilda.lyngeus@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:** 
 Ann-Christin Thorsell, +46738020862, ann-christin.thorsell@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Cecilia Zielfelt, +46722108152 cecilia.zielfelt@handelsbanken.se

title: Dentist with orthodontic experience - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
 We are Dr SMILE Powered by
 **IMPRESS** 
 . We believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love and
 **WE ARE HIRING!!**
 We are seeking an experienced
 **Dentist with experience in Orthodontics** 
 to join our friendly team. An exciting and unique opportunity for you who is passionate about dentistry and is looking for a platform to develop and take their career to the next level!
   

  

 The job role requires
 **experience** 
 in dental scans using a
 **3D Scanner** 
 and providing treatments. Candidates with experience in
 **Orthodontics** 
 would be a bonus, however
 **Full training is given.**
**Dr Smile X Impress** 
 is well-established, and fast-growing company with over
 **150 locations** 
 across 10 countries in Europe.
   

  

**Why Join Us**
* Attractive Compensation Package based on experience and expectations.
* Participate in the medical teams' incentive plan to share in our success.
* Flexible schedule to suit your availability.
* Modern, beautifully designed clinics with high-end equipment.
* Special discounts & benefits on treatments, aligners, and products.
* Comprehensive training for professional growth.
* Dynamic, unique, and fast-paced environment with impressive career development opportunities.
* Full-time, permanent position (40 hours/week).


**Responsibilities**
* Be the face of IMPRESS, deliver a world-class experience for every customer.
* Explain, Review and Determine the suitable treatment plans for patients.
* Carry out other treatments such as fillings. dental hygiene, whitening or other If it is needed.
* Examine medical records and take 3D scans.
* Make follow up visits, IPRs, put engagers and deliver treatments of aligners.
* Submit the aligner diagnostics to our network for planning the treatment.
* Work with the medical director in preparing cases for production and following up inquiries.
* Educate patients on oral health practices and prescribe medication when necessary.
* Responsible use and maintenance of dental equipment.


**Requirements**
* Licensed dentist with a degree in dentistry from an accredited university.
* Valid Swedish dental license (Legitimation) issued by Socialstyrelsen (The National Board of Health and Welfare).
* Proven experience in the orthodontic sector is a MUST.
* Minimum of 2–3 years of clinical experience in dentistry
* Compliance with all dental and healthcare laws.
* Calm and professional manner with patients.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Strong computer skills with healthcare applications.
* Fluent Swedish or high-level proficiency in Swedish (minimum C1 level) is mandatory to practice.
* Fluent English communication skills.


**Diversity And Inclusion**
 We cultivate a culture of inclusion and diversity. We celebrate our employees' individual strengths, views, and experiences and we encourage all candidates to apply, without regard to race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or any other factor.
   

  

**Join us today and make a difference, one smile at a time!**
 Job Type: Full-time
   

  

 Pay: 490 000,00kr - 720 000,00kr per year
   

  

**Ability To Commute/relocate**
* 116 61 Stockholm: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)


**Application Question(s)**
* Do you speak fluent Swedish and English?


**Experience**
* Orthodontics: 1 year (Required)
* Dental practice: 2 years (Required)


**License/Certification**
* Swedish dental license (Required)


**Work Authorization**
* Sweden (Required)


 Work Location: In person

title: Assistant professor in Biocatalysis for Green Chemistry
description:
This position at KTH is part of the Mistra Future Environmental Research Leaders. Mistra is the Swedish foundation for strategic environmental research.
   

  

 Subject field
   

  

 Biocatalysis for Green Chemistry.
   

  

 Subject description
   

  

 Biocatalysis for Green Chemistry combines design and engineering of enzymes with biocatalytic processes for green-chemistry applications. These biocatalytic processes use enzymes for conversion of starting material (i.e., renewable resources or building blocks for chiral compounds) to value-added (often chiral) compounds. Green chemistry is defined as the field of chemistry and chemical engineering that focusses on production of chemicals through sustainable processes. The subject of this position combines this by using biocatalysis for green-chemical production.
   

  

 Duties
   

  

 The assistant professor is expected to set-up and manage an independent research team in Biocatalysis for Green Chemistry that is able to complement and collaborate with existing groups in the School of Engineering Sciences in Chemistry, Biotechnology and Health (CBH) at KTH Royal Institute of Technology. The assistant professor is expected to benefit from the rapid developments in the field of Biocatalysis and to help KTH realize the sustainability potential and further develop the field of Biocatalysis for Green Chemistry for both KTH, as well as Sweden. This includes initiating new research projects, acquisition of funding, setting up collaborations, training and coaching students and young researchers at master's, doctoral and postdoctoral levels, managing the group’s economy and maintaining a safe, stimulating and healthy work environment.
   

  

 Tasks in teaching include coordination and continued development of a course at the BSc or MSc level, and also includes supervision of master’s students in degree projects as well as teaching and course development at the PhD level.
   

  

 In addition, the assistant professor is expected to represent KTH, the CBH school and the Department of Industrial Biotechnology in general-audience, scientific presentations, networks and develop leadership in further advancing Biocatalysis for Green Chemistry both nationally and internationally. The assistant professor will participate in the joint leadership programme designed by Mistra, the Swedish foundation for strategic environmental research.
   

  

 The assistant professor will be given opportunity to develop their independence as researcher and gain accreditation that may allow them to take other teaching positions with higher eligibility requirements (see Chapter 4, Section 12 a of the Swedish Higher Education Ordinance). Following application, the assistant professor can apply for promotion to associate professor in accordance with Chapter 4, Section 12 c of the Higher Education Ordinance.
   

  

 Eligibility
   

  

 An individual who has completed a doctorate or equivalent scientific competence is qualified for appointment as an assistant professor. Candidates who met those qualifications a maximum of seven years before the deadline for applying for the appointment as an assistant professor has expired should be prioritized. Other candidates may also be considered if there are special reasons. Special reasons’ refers to absence due to illness, parental leave or other similar circumstances.
   

  

 Assessment criteria
   

  

 The assessment criteria for appointment as an assistant professor at KTH are stated in KTH's appointments procedure section 1.3, and apply in relation to the employment profile laid down.
   

  

**Of
 *highest importance* 
 is that the applicant has**
* potential to qualify for a higher teaching post. This includes the potential for independent development as a researcher and teacher within the subject field in question and also the ability to establish, review and develop the research area in question.
* scientific expertise within the subject field demonstrated through scientific publications, conference attendance, research cooperation and also other undertakings in the scientific community such as assignments as a reviewer or expert.


**Of
 *second highest importance* 
 is that the applicant has**
* an interest in and understanding of pedagogical development within the subject field.


**It is
 *also important* 
 that the applicant has**
* experience from a postdoctoral visit in a research environment other than the university at which the applicant defended their doctoral thesis. In application-oriented areas, experience from research and development work within the industry or other organisations is considered to correspond to a traditional postdoc visit to another university.
* interest in and insights concerning leadership in academia, collaboration with the outside community, and awareness of diversity and equal opportunity issues with a particular focus on gender equality.
* administrative expertise.


**Special grounds of assessment for promotion to associate professor**
*When assessing applications for promotion to associate professor, provisions according to Section 1.2.4 of Appointments procedure at KTH will be applied. Ability* 
*to teach in Swedish is a merit that is given great importance in the application for* 
*promotion.*
 Trade union representatives
   

  

 Contact information to trade union representatives can be found at KTH's web page.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should follow KTH's CV template for employment of teachers. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete according to the requirements in the ad and CV template.
   

  

 Your complete application must be received at KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Log into KTH recruitment system in order to apply to this position.
   

  

**Other**
 Time limitation:The appointment is for an indefinite term, but no more than six years, and may be extended if, due to the teacher’s absence due to sick leave, parental leave or other special grounds, more time is required to reach the objectives of the appointment. However, the total appointment period may not exceed eight years. The appointment is part of the Tenure Track system at KTH and the assistant professor may apply for promotion to tenured associate professor.
   

  

 For more information regarding KTH's assessment, see Appointments procedure at KTH
   

  

 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process please read here.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 Guidance on relocating and settling in at KTH and in Sweden.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer: In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.
