* Experience of development according to safety standards such as CENELEC (EN50126, EN50128, EN50129) or equivalent.
* Computer knowledge for example installation of operating systems, drivers and network configuration.
* Relevant experience working with requirements, specifications and documentation of complex technical systems.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Application**
 Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter Lema Naderi at lema.naderi@nexergroup.com We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
**Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here.**

title: Engineering Manager
description:
*Are you inspired to work in an international setting where you can contribute to a transformational digital journey? And imagine doing so at a company where innovation, collaboration and purpose comes together every day.* 




  





**Get to know your team** 




 Group Tech is the engine that keeps the lotteries running. In this department you'll be supporting every step of the journey, from ticket sales and payments, to draws and prize payouts. With a broad team of experts across Development, Data Management, Cloud Engineering, Cyber Security and more, Group Tech powers the systems we rely on and make sure everything runs smoothly.
 



  





 Group Tech consists of more than 350 people collaborating across lotteries. Together with our two other Engineering Managers in Sweden, you’ll be part of the local Tech management team and report to both the Head of Tech Nordics and Group Development Manager.
 



  





**How you’ll make a difference** 




 We are on a transformation journey to build scalable, best-in-class digital products that enable exceptional customer and user experiences. Your solid technical knowledge will be valuable as we build an international CMS platform, mobile apps, and consolidate our five different local back-end systems into one international platform.
 



  





 If you thrive in an international and dynamic setting, this is the place for you. You’ll play a central role in creating the best conditions for your team to thrive and deliver high-quality software that meets our business goals. With your team, you’ll deliver technical solutions across all lotteries in the Postcode Lottery Group. A key part of your contribution will be shaping engineering best practices and standards, driving architecture decisions to enhance scalability, resilience and performance, ensuring that we uphold high engineering standards across everything we build. You’ll guide your team in agile ways of working and continuously look for better, smarter ways to deliver value.
 



  





 This role includes staff responsibilities, meaning that you’ll support your team through regular 1:1s, performance reviews, recruitment and drive talent development.
 



  





**Good to know!** 
 Travel is an important part of the role, with regular visits to our sister lotteries. You’ll join an international network of peers while leading a highly engaged team locally in Sweden.
 



  





**Our techstack:** 
 Java, Springboot, Kotlin, Microservices, AWS, React, Next.JS, Typescript, PHP, Server-side JavaScript (Lambda) and a lot more. You’ll also maintain and report on ISO 27001 ensuring alignment with Group Tech standards.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* 6+ years as software engineer, preferably within front-end development.
* A proven track record of leading and developing people and teams through clear goals and inspiration.
* Demonstrated ability to guide teams through change, fostering stability, motivation, and long-term success in dynamic settings.
* Passionate about agile software development and modern engineering practices.
* You’re proactive and innovative. You deal with ambiguity effectively.
* Fluent in English and Swedish and eligible to work full-time in Stockholm without restrictions.
* Bachelor's or master's degree in engineering or a related field.



  





  





**Perks of being an employee at Svenska Postkodlotteriet** 




  





 🧡
 **Contribute to good causes** 




 Every year, we donate over one billion SEK to more than 60 nonprofit organizations. We gather at Stockholm City Hall where you and the organizations get to celebrate together.
 



  





 🧡
 **Lunch at the office.** 




 It should be easy to enjoy a good and healthy lunch every day. We have three refrigerators at the office filled with meals cooked from scratch. Lunch is free of charge and taxed as a benefit according to current tax regulations.
 



  





 🧡
 **Central office location.** 




 Our office is open, colorful, and fresh, located at Klarabergsviadukten 63 in Stockholm. With the Central Station right next door, it’s easy to get here by public transport or bike.
 



  





 🧡
 **Volunteer days.** 




 We give you the opportunity to do volunteer work during work hours three days per year. As a volunteer, you can make an extra contribution to an organization close to your heart.
 



  





 🧡
 **Professional development.** 




 No matter your role, it’s important to us that you feel you’re growing. There are opportunities for internal career paths, training, and international projects.
 



  





 🧡
 **Joy in big and small things.** 




 We believe that colleagues who have fun together work better together. In addition to our Christmas breakfast, summer party, and kickoff, we make sure to create moments that bring joy to everyday life.
 



  





 🧡
 **Wellness.** 




 Wellness is important for you to feel good both at work and in your free time. That’s why we offer a wellness allowance of 4,500 SEK per year, various health-related activities, and access to both massage and a gym at the office.

title: Verification, Validation and Test Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 A career at Hitachi Rail will help create a legacy. With operations in every corner of the world, our work goes to the cutting-edge of digital transformation and technology. From the multi-cultural strength of our global organisation to the sustainable and innovative ways we work to bring people together, there’s something for everyone to get stuck into. And that’s where you come in.
   

  

**Description**
**About Us**
 Hitachi rail is a global provider of rail solutions. In Sweden, we are delivering advanced railway signaling systems that meet the highest safety and performance standards.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Verification, Validation and Test Engineer to join our team in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

 This position is lab based, focusing on testing signaling systems and subsystems prior to field integration.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Develop, execute and maintain test plans and specifications
* Configure and operate lab test environment (simulators, hardware)
* Perform functional, regression testing
* Record, analysis and report test results
* Ensure traceability between requirements and test cases
* Collaborate with design and development teams to clarify issues and support problem solving
* Follow EN 50126728/29 standards


**Team & Work environment**
* Small Local team - You'll be joining a compact on-site team in Solna, where your contribution is highly visible and you'll gain broad, hands-on experience
* International Collaboration - Much of our engineering support& development comes from Italy, so excellent communication skills and cultural awareness are essential
* Proactive mindset- We value engineers who work independently, identify solutions and drive activities forward


**What We're Looking For**
* 2-5 years’ experience in testing
* Understanding of the V-cycle and requirements-based testing
* Degree in Electrical, Electronics, Computer Engineering or related field
* Experience with test tools, simulators and lab se-ups
* Basic knowledge of railway signaling concepts
* Strong communication skills for multi-site cross-cultural collaboration


**Why Join Hitachi in Sweden**
* Be part of a small compact team where your work has direct impact
* Direct customer delivery- the results of your test go straight into real projects
* Contribute to the future of sustainable, efficient transport in Sweden
* International collaboration with experts
* Have access to global Hitachi career opportunities


**Thank you for your interest in Hitachi Rail. If your application is of interest, we will be in contact. Please do not hesitate to discover more about us and our latest jobs at** 
**https://www.hitachirail.com/careers** 
**.**
**At Hitachi Rail, there is a place for everyone.** 
**We welcome and value differences in background, age, gender, sexuality, family status, disability, race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, and world view.** 
**It is our commitment to create an inclusive environment - we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.**
**We would be delighted if you would be one of our followers at https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirail**

title: Experienced Audio Researcher
description:
**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson's 6G vision, first introduced in 2020, remains pivotal for transforming business and society in the 2030s through secure, efficient, and sustainable communication services. Audio-visual content, which is estimated to account for nearly 75% of all mobile data traffic, is an essential part of this vision and a key enabler of the emerging services anticipated in the 6G cyber-physical world. To meet the demands of deploying such services at scale, audio technologies and standards continue to evolve, aiming to provide more efficient, flexible, scalable, and sustainable ways of delivering services to consumers and businesses world-wide.
   

  

 Innovation in audio compression and representation continues on several fronts. Immersive experiences require new formats and capabilities providing spatial audio while AI based methods promise even more compact representations that allow high-quality audio transmission for example via non-terrestrial links. In your role you will invent, implement, and evaluate algorithms for audio representations. You will document your findings, propose technology to standards and describe your inventions in patent applications. We expect the resulting standards to be implemented in millions of devices.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Be working in an international team of world class researchers in audio representations and coding.
* Have your research validated and recognized in a competitive standardization environment comprising world-class experts and leaders in the audio community.
* Be working in a dynamic department with opportunities for learning, taking on new responsibilities, impacting ways of working, and much more.


**The Skills You Bring**
* M.Sc. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical area.
* Interest and curiosity for solving problems and delivering innovative solutions.
* Passion and strong skills in programming and software handling, with experience in several programming languages, such as C/C++ and Python.
* Familiarity with audio standards defined in 3GPP or ISO/IEC MPEG (such as EVS, IVAS, MPEG-H audio, MPEG-I immersive audio, ...).
* Track record in publishing in scientific journals and delivering presentations at standardization meetings, academic conferences or relevant industry events.
* Experience and/or interest in:
* Audio coding
* Signal processing
* Neural networks, with application to audio coding and processing.


*We are looking forward to your application in English where you describe the value of your experience and skills in the above technical area.*
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774998

title: Senior mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Vill du arbeta i ett innovativt företag som är världsledande inom robotteknik och utveckla teknik som gör skillnad – för både människor och djur?
   

  

 DeLaval är den största utvecklaren, tillverkaren och leverantören av lösningar för mjölkproduktion globalt.
   

  

 Vi söker nu seniora mjukvaruutvecklare som vill vara med och utveckla robotmjölkningssystem – i en miljö där teknik, hållbarhet och samarbete står i centrum.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior mjukvaruutvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i ett utav våra utvecklingsteam. Du arbetar med systemutveckling inom robotstyrning, användargränssnitt och realtidsstyrning – huvudsakligen i Java, men även med inslag av C/C++ och Python. Du får möjlighet att påverka både tekniska beslut och strategier.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmodell med flexibilitet att arbeta på distans, och vår arbetsplats i Tumba ger dig en unik möjlighet att se resultatet av ditt arbete i praktiken där fabrik, utveckling och labb ligger sida vid sida.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Har en teknisk högskole-/universitetsutbildning inom exempelvis datateknik
* Har flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, gärna i komplexa system
* Behärskar Java och gärna även C/C++ eller Python
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Är van att ta ansvar, fatta beslut och driva utveckling framåt
* Trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team
* Har ett nyfiket och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt


**Jobba på DeLaval**
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där mångfald ses som en styrka
* Möjlighet att påverka tekniska beslut och strategier
* Kompetensutveckling och karriärvägar inom teknik och ledarskap
* Flexibla arbetstider och arbetstidsförkortning
* 30 dagars semester
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr/år
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Tjänstepension och arbetsrelaterad olycksfallsförsäkring


**Övrig information**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering vid DeLavals huvudkontor i Tumba, söder om Stockholm. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Rekryterande chef: Kattis Karttunen, kattis.karttunen@delaval.com
   

  

 Rekryterare: Agnes Edbom , agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**Om DeLaval**
 Vår vision är att göra hållbar livsmedelsproduktion möjlig.
   

  

 Som ett företag byggt på innovation arbetar vi ständigt med att hitta sätt att hjälpa våra kunder – mjölkbönder – att göra mer med mindre, genom att erbjuda världsledande mjölkningsutrustning och lösningar.
   

  

 Idag har DeLaval cirka 4 500 engagerade medarbetare som verkar i över 100 marknader världen över. DeLaval är en del av Tetra Laval-koncernen. Läs mer på corporate.delaval.com.

title: Examensarbete, 15 hp: AI utvecklad lösningsorienterad modell för systeminformation
description:
*Är du en student som är ivrig att tillämpa dina teoretiska kunskaper och nya perspektiv på verkliga utmaningar? På Saab tror vi att innovationer växer på nya idéer, och ditt examensarbete kan vara gnistan som tänder vårt nästa tekniska genombrott.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vi ser det enorma värdet som studenter tillför vårt företag. Din akademiska precision, i kombination med din entusiasm för avancerad teknik, gör att du kan närma dig problem med en unik och insiktsfull lins. På Saab får du möjlighet att samarbeta med erfarna ingenjörer och specialister, få ovärderlig praktisk erfarenhet och samtidigt bidra till vår tillväxt och utveckling.
   

  

**Bakgrund**
 Verksamheten genererar enorma mängder data från systemloggar. Mängden information behöver analyseras och avvikande beteende behöver detekteras i systemet för att antingen identifiera orsak eller belysa avvikelser för möjlighet till återkopplande lösning alternativt identifierad feldetektering.
   

  

**Beskrivning av examensarbetet**
 Examensarbetet syftar till att ta fram ett generative AI model för att säkerställa kvalitet och funktion i våra leveranser. Beovet finns för att identifera avvikelser, fel och felkällor och presentera kända lösningar och felkällor. Behov finns att identifiera standardiserad struktur i loggar för att förebygga begränsningar i nuvarande implementering.
   

  

 Enheten arbetar med systemvierifiering av plattformar som exempelvis Global eye. Ni blir en del av ett väl sammansvetsat gäng med stark gemenskap.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Arbetet är lämpligt för
 *2 i antal studenter* 
 med intresse för praktisk AI lösning samt försåelse för test/intergation och validering till implementation av model.
   

  

 Vi ger dig det stöd och den vägledning du behöver för att omsätta dina teoretiska kunskaper i praktiska lösningar. Bli en drivande kraft bakom Saabs tekniska framsteg!
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag**
 21-11-2025
   

  

**Kontaktperson**
 Fredrik Hansen, Chef
   

  

 Fredrik.hansen@saabgroup.com
   

  

 +46 734376548
